analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra

original: Hetu🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—dassanena pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe….🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—dassanena pahātabbe khandhe paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo ca nadassanena pahātabbo🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—dassanena pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo
analyzed: hetu  dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbam ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe pe  dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbe khandhe paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa  dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ ca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ  ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbam ekam khandham paṭicca tayo
translated: Cause

original: khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca …pe… dve khandhe …pe….
analyzed: khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca pe dve khandhe pe
translated: With ignorance as condition there is a (volitional) process rooted in ignorance. With a (volitional) process rooted in ignorance as condition there is consciousness rooted in ignorance. With consciousness rooted in ignorance as condition there is mentality-materiality rooted in ignorance. With mentality-materiality rooted in ignorance as condition there are the six sense bases rooted in ignorance. With the six sense bases rooted in ignorance as condition there is contact rooted in ignorance. With contact rooted in ignorance as condition there is feeling rooted in ignorance. With feeling rooted in ignorance as condition there is craving rooted in ignorance. With craving rooted in ignorance as condition there is clinging rooted in ignorance. With clinging rooted in ignorance as condition there is existence rooted in ignorance. With existence rooted in ignorance as condition there is birth rooted in ignorance. With birth rooted in ignorance as condition there is ageing and death rooted in ignorance. Such is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.🔽With ignorance as condition there is a (volitional) process rooted in ignorance. With a (volitional) process rooted in ignorance as condition there is consciousness rooted in ignorance. With consciousness rooted in ignorance as condition there is mentality-materiality rooted in ignorance. With mentality-materiality rooted in ignorance as condition there are the six sense bases rooted in ignorance. With the six sense bases rooted in ignorance as condition there is contact rooted in ignorance. With contact rooted in ignorance as condition there is feeling rooted in ignorance. With feeling rooted in ignorance as condition there is craving rooted in ignorance. With craving rooted in ignorance as condition there is clinging rooted in ignorance. With clinging rooted in ignorance as condition there is existence rooted in ignorance. With existence rooted in ignorance as condition there is birth rooted in ignorance. With birth rooted in ignorance as condition there is ageing and death rooted in ignorance. Such is the origin of this whole mass of suffering.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—nadassanena🔽pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe🔽…pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… khandhe paṭicca vatthu, vatthuṁ paṭicca khandhā, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe….
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na dassanena  pahātabbam ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe  pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe khandhe paṭicca vatthu vatthum paṭicca khandhāḥ ekam mahābhūtam pe
translated: With what is to be given up by seeing as condition, what is to be given up by seeing arises … (as in §1, but with nadassanena pahātabba instead of dassanena pahātabba.)

original: Dassanena pahātabbañca nadassanena pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbañca na dassanena pahātabbañca dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ
translated: With what is to be given up by seeing and what is not to be given up by seeing as condition, what is not to be given up by seeing … (as in §1, but with nadassanena pahātabba instead of dassanena pahātabba.)

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—dassanena pahātabbe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca🔽cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca  citta samuṭṭhānam
translated: (The rest of the section is to be elaborated in detail according to the method of the section on the faculties.)

translated: five, one in relation to the result, five in relation to nutriment, five in relation to the faculties, five in relation to the powers, five in relation to the path, five in relation to the jhānas, five in relation to the right endeavours, five in relation to the bases of spiritual success, five in relation to the factors of awakening, five in relation to the dependent origination, five in relation to the truths, five in relation to the illimitables, five in relation to the kinds of sense desire, five in relation to the causal jewels, five in relation to the fruits, five in relation to the aggregates, five in relation to the sense bases, five in relation to the elements, five in relation to the faculties, five in relation to the truths, five in relation to the dependent origination, five in relation to the wholesome, five in relation to the unwholesome, five in relation to the indeterminate, five in relation to the sensual realm, five in relation to the fine-material realm, five in relation to the immaterial realm, five in relation to the wholesome, five in relation to the unwholesome, five in relation to the indeterminate, five in relation to the sensual realm, five in relation to the fine-material realm, five in relation to the immaterial realm, five in relation to the unformed, and five in relation to the past, future, and present.🔽..... original: 2.13.1.1.2. Paccayapaccanīya🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Division on Analysis

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a root🔽A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing to be given up by seeing is related to a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing as a root condition.🔽A phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing is related to a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing as a root condition.

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato moho.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate khandhe paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ moho  na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka
translated: A single wholesome aggregate that is not to be given up by seeing is related to the other three aggregates that are not to be given up by seeing as a root condition.🔽A single aggregate that is not to be given up by seeing is related to the mind and mental factors that are not to be given up by seeing and that arise together with it as a root condition.

original: nadassanena pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… (yāva asaññasattā)🔽uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam ekam khandham pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe pe yāva asaññasattā  uddhacca sahagate khandhe paṭicca uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: The aggregates that are not to be given up by seeing and that arise together with uncertainty are related to uncertainty as a root condition.🔽The aggregates that are not to be given up by seeing and that arise together with agitation are related to agitation as a root condition.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra🔽Suddha🔽Nahetuyā dve, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā pañca, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare🔽tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte cattāri, napacchājāte pañca,

translated: The aggregates that are not to be given up by seeing and that arise

original: naāsevane pañca, nakamme dve, navipāke pañca, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne🔽ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na āsevane pañca na kamme dve na vipāke pañca na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne  na magge eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte dve no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: In the non-causality septad there are five in the non-causality triad and none in the rest of the triads.🔽In the non-kamma septad there are two in the non-kamma triad and none in the rest of the triads. In the non-result septad there are five in the non-result triad and none in the rest of the triads. In the non-nutriment septad there is one in the non-nutriment triad and none in the rest of the triads. In the non-faculty septad there is one in the non-faculty triad and none in the rest of the triads.

original: 2.13.1.2. Sahajātavāra
analyzed: sahajātavāra
translated: In the non-path septad there is one in the non-path triad and none in the rest of the triads. In the non-dissociation septad there are two in the non-dissociation triad and none in the rest of the triads. In the not-root septad there are three in the not-root triad and none in the rest of the triads. In the not-object septad there are three in the not-object triad and none in the rest of the triads.🔽… The section on conascence

translated: Cause🔽With ignorance as condition there arise bodily formations, with formations as condition: consciousness, mentality-materiality, the sixfold base, contact, feeling, birth, and ageing-and-death.

analyzed: pahātabbam ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe 🔽pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe yāva ajjhattikāḥ mahābhūtāḥ vatthum paccayā na dassanena pahātabbā khandhāḥ

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbā khandhā.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo ca nadassanena pahātabbo

translated: With a states to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a states to be abandoned by seeing arises … (as in §1, but with the first and second triads in reverse order).

original: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbā khandhā, mahābhūte🔽paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ.🔽Dassanena pahātabbañca nadassanena pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—dassanena pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā🔽tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe….
analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā vatthum paccayā dassanena pahātabbā khandhāḥ mahābhūte  paccayā citta samuṭṭhāna  dassanena pahātabbañca na dassanena pahātabbañca dhammam paccayā dassanena pahātabbo  dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbam ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā  tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe
translated: With a states to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a states to be abandoned by seeing and a states not to be abandoned by seeing arise … (as in §1, but with the first and third triads in reverse order).🔽With a states to be abandoned by seeing and a states not to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a states to be abandoned by seeing arises … (as in §1, but with the first and second triads in reverse order).

original: Dassanena pahātabbañca nadassanena pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paccayā nadassanena pahātabbo
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbañca na dassanena pahātabbañca dhammam paccayā na dassanena pahātabbaḥ
translated: With a states to be abandoned by seeing and a states not to be abandoned by seeing as condition, a states not to be abandoned by seeing arises … (as in §1, but with the first and third triads in reverse order).

original: dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—dassanena pahātabbe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā🔽cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbe khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā  citta samuṭṭhānam
translated: With the visible data and the four great primaries as condition, mind-made materiality arises.

original: Dassanena pahātabbañca nadassanena pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo🔽ca nadassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—dassanena pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ🔽khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… dassanena pahātabbe
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbañca na dassanena pahātabbañca dhammam paccayā dassanena pahātabbo  ca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā dassanena pahātabbam eka  khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe dassanena pahātabbe
translated: With a visible datum and a non-visible datum as condition, a visible datum and a non-visible datum arise …

original: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: With a visible datum and the four great primaries as condition, mind-made materiality arises.

analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure🔽Nine by cause; four by object; nine by predominance …

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava.🔽2.13.1.3.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava  paccaya paccanīya

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Exposition

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a Root

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate khandhe paccayā vicikicchāsahagato moho.
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate khandhe paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ moho
translated: With a visible datum as condition that is to be abandoned by seeing, a visible datum arises that is to be abandoned by seeing, by way of root-cause condition—with the aggregates that are conjoined with doubt as condition, the delusion that is conjoined with doubt arises.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka
translated: With an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing as condition, an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing arises, a non-cause condition.

original: nadassanena pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ🔽…pe… dve khandhe …pe… (yāva asaññasattā) cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe…
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam ekam khandham paccayā tayo khandhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa  pe dve khandhe pe yāva asaññasattā cakkha āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe
translated: With one object to be abandoned by the path of seeing as condition, three aggregates and materiality derived by clinging arise.🔽… With two aggregates … (up to) … With the eye base as condition, eye-consciousness …

original: kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ; vatthuṁ paccayā ahetukā nadassanena pahātabbā khandhā,
analyzed: kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā ahetukāḥ na dassanena pahātabbā khandhāḥ
translated: With the body base as condition, body-consciousness; with the physical basis as condition, the aggregates that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and that are without root-cause.

original: uddhaccasahagate khandhe paccayā uddhaccasahagato moho, vatthuṁ paccayā uddhaccasahagato moho.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā vicikicchāsahagato moho.
analyzed: uddhacca sahagate khandhe paccayā uddhacca sahagataḥ mohaḥ vatthum paccayā uddhacca sahagataḥ mohaḥ  na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā vatthum paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ moho
translated: With the aggregates associated with agitation as condition, delusion associated with agitation; with the physical basis as condition, delusion associated with agitation.🔽With an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing as condition, an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing arises, a non-cause condition: With the physical basis as condition, doubt and the associated delusion.

original: Dassanena pahātabbañca nadassanena pahātabbañca dhammaṁ paccayā dassanena pahātabbo
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbañca na dassanena pahātabbañca dhammam paccayā dassanena pahātabbo
translated: With an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing and an object to be abandoned by the path of development as condition, an object to be abandoned by the path of seeing …

original: dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā vicikicchāsahagato moho.
analyzed: dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ moho
translated: A state of the mind-element and the mind-consciousness element that is causally produced, and which is related to wrong view, is related to wrong view as a condition being a non-cause condition.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on the Calculation

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā cattāri, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare🔽tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte cattāri, napacchājāte nava,🔽naāsevane nava, nakamme cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā cattāri na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare  tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte cattāri na pacchājāte nava  na āsevane nava na kamme cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne
translated: The Pure

original: ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na magge eka na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte dve no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: In the non-cause section there are four. In the non-object section there are three. In the non-dominance section there are nine. In the non-antecedent section there are three. In the non-conascence section there are three. In the non-supporter section there are three. In the non-nutrient section there are one. In the non-faculty section there are one. In the non-path section there are one. In the non-association section there are three. In the non-disappearance section there are three. In the non-disconnection section there are two.

original: 2.13.1.4. Nissayavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāra
translated: The Section on the Requisite

original: Itare dve gaṇanāpi nissayavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.1.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra
analyzed: itare dve gaṇanā api nissaya vāro api kātabbo  sa saṭṭhavāra
translated: The other two should be calculated and the requisite section should be done.

original: 2.13.1.5.1–4 Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: The Section on the Conjoined

original: Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: … a state that is to be given up through vision (of the first path) is conjoined with a state that is to be given up through vision (of the first path) and arises as a condition being a cause condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽… a state that is to be given up through vision (of the first path) is conjoined with a state that is to be given up through development (of the higher paths) and arises as a condition being a cause condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽… a state that is to be given up through vision (of the first path) is conjoined with a state that is not to be given up and arises as a condition being a cause condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽… a state that is to be given up through development (of the higher paths) is conjoined with a state that is to be given up through development (of the higher paths) and arises as a condition being a cause condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽… a state that is to be given up through development (of the higher paths) is conjoined with a state that is to be given up through vision (of the first path) and arises as a condition being a cause condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽… a state that is to be given up through development (of the higher paths) is conjoined with a state that is not to be given up and arises as a condition being a cause condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽… a state that

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A state to be abandoned by the vision of the path is related to a state to be abandoned by the vision of the path as object condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā dve, (sabbattha dve) vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve.
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā dve sabbattha dve vipāke ekam pe avigate dve
translated: In the section on root cause there are two [instances], in the section on object there are two, in the section on predominance there are two, in the sections on nutriment, faculty, path, and association there is one [instance], in the section on non-causality there are two, in the sections on non-predominance, non-nutriment, non-faculty, and non-association there are two, in the section on non-deprivation there are two.

original: Anulomaṁ.🔽Dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho dassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—vicikicchāsahagate khandhe saṁsaṭṭho vicikicchāsahagato moho.
analyzed: anuloma  dassanena pahātabbam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā vicikicchā sahagate khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ vicikicchā sahagataḥ moho
translated: The forward order.🔽A state to be abandoned by the vision of the path is related to a state to be abandoned by the vision of the path as non-root-cause condition. Delusion associated with doubt is related to the aggregates associated with doubt as non-root-cause condition.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: A state to be abandoned by the vision of the path is related to a state not to be abandoned by the vision of the path as non-root-cause condition. Delusion associated with doubt is related to the aggregates not associated with doubt as non-root-cause condition.

original: Nahetuyā dve, naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, nakamme dve, navipāke dve, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte dve.
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ dve na adhipatiyāḥ dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na kamme dve na vipāke dve na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte dve
translated: In the section on non-root-cause there are two [instances], in the sections on non-predominance, non-nutriment, non-faculty, and non-association there are two, in the section on non-deprivation there are two, in the section on non-causality there are two, in the sections on non-restraint, non-action, and non-defeat there is one [instance], in the section on non-nutritive-result there are two, in the sections on non-path, non-development, and non-association there is one [instance], in the section on non-inefficacy there are two.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: The reverse order.

original: 2.13.1.6. Sampayuttavāra
translated: The section on related by way of the related factors.

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.1.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ  pañhāvāra
translated: So too with the other two.🔽The Mode of Conveying Questions🔽The Mode of Conveying Conditions

original: 2.13.1.7.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Mode of Conveying the Description

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—nadassanena
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi  na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na dassanena
translated: A state that is to be given up through vision is a condition, as cause condition, for a state that is to be given up through vision. … There are three.

original: pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena
analyzed: pahātabbāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena
translated: A state that is not to be given up through vision is a condition, as cause condition, for a state that is not to be given up through vision. The causes that are not to be given up through vision are a condition, as cause condition, for the aggregates associated with them and for the kinds of materiality derived by clinging.

original: paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dassanena🔽pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: ārammaṇa  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayodassanena  pahātabbam rāgam assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: Object🔽A state that is to be given up through vision is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is to be given up through vision. One approves of, welcomes, and greets form, etc., that is to be given up through vision, and so lust, views, conceit, or whatever is the state that is to be given up through vision arises in dependence on that.🔽One approves of, welcomes, and greets feeling, etc., that is to be given up through vision, and so lust, views, conceit, or whatever is the state that is to be given up through vision arises in dependence on that.

original: diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā uppajjati, dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati; dassanena
analyzed: diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā uppajjati dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati dassanena
translated: One approves of, welcomes, and greets perception that is to be given up through vision, and so lust, views, conceit, or whatever is the state that is to be given up through vision arises in dependence on that.🔽One approves of, welcomes, and greets the mental formations that are to be given up through vision, and so lust, views, conceit, or whatever is the state that is to be given up through vision arises in dependence on that.🔽One approves of, welcomes, and greets consciousness that is to be given up through vision, and so lust, views, conceit, or whatever is the state that is to be given up through vision arises in dependence on that.

original: pahātabbaṁ diṭṭhiṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati,🔽diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; vicikicchaṁ ārabbha vicikicchā🔽uppajjati, diṭṭhi …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ ārabbha
analyzed: pahātabbam diṭṭhim assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati  diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā pe domanassam uppajjati vicikiccham ārabbha vicikicchā  uppajjati diṭṭhi pe domanassam uppajjati dassanena pahātabbam domanassam ārabbha
translated: He delights in and enjoys a view that should be abandoned by seeing, and because of that, lust that should be abandoned by seeing arises.🔽A view that should be abandoned by seeing … Uncertainty that should be abandoned by seeing … Grief that should be abandoned by seeing arises. Uncertainty that should be abandoned by seeing …🔽A view that should be abandoned by seeing … Grief that should be abandoned by seeing arises. Grief that should be abandoned by seeing …

original: dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—ariyā🔽dassanena pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti, pubbe samudāciṇṇe …pe… dassanena🔽pahātabbe khandhe aniccato …pe… vipassati, cetopariyañāṇena dassanena pahātabbacittasamaṅgissa
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo ariyā  dassanena pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti pubbe samudāciṇṇe pe dassanena  pahātabbe khandhe aniccataḥ pe vipassati cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena dassanena pahātabba citta samaṅgissa
translated: A view that should be abandoned by seeing … Uncertainty that should be abandoned by seeing arises.🔽A state that should be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as object condition, for a state that should be abandoned by seeing. Noble

original: cittaṁ jānāti, dassanena pahātabbā khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,
analyzed: cittam jānāti dassanena pahātabbā khandhā cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa
translated: when they review the defilements that have been abandoned by seeing, and the previously committed bodily and verbal deeds that have already been done and put aside, and the wealth that has been used and enjoyed, and the sacrifices that have been offered and exhausted; when they reflect on the impermanence of the aggregates that should be abandoned by seeing, and they reflect on their own breakup; when, by means of knowledge of penetration of minds, they know the mind and mental factors of a person whose mind is in conformity with what should be abandoned by seeing; when the aggregates that should be abandoned by seeing are a condition, as object condition, for knowledge of past lives, for knowledge of the death and rebirth of beings,

original: yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: for knowledge of the destination in accordance with kamma, for knowledge of the future, for adverting, it is a condition, as object condition.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing.

original: paccayo—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: paccayodānam pe sīlam pe uposatha kammam katvā tam paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati
translated: Having given a gift … having observed the Uposatha, he reviews that, he relishes it, he is addicted to it.🔽From that as object, lust, resentment, or anger not to be given up by seeing arises.

original: taṁ ārabbha nadassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati; uddhaccaṁ …pe… nadassanena pahātabbaṁ🔽domanassaṁ uppajjati, pubbe suciṇṇāni …pe… jhānā …pe… ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ🔽paccavekkhanti …pe… phalassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; ariyā nadassanena🔽pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti, vikkhambhite kilese …pe… pubbe …pe… cakkhuṁ
analyzed: tam ārabbha na dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati uddhaccam pe na dassanena pahātabba  domanassam uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni pe jhānā pe ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā magga  paccavekkhanti pe phalassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ariyāḥ na dassanena  pahātabbe pahīne kilese paccavekkhanti vikkhambhite kilese pe pubbe pe cakkhu
translated: He reviews the defilements that have been given up by seeing … the jhānas … the paths …🔽the fruitions … He adverts to the paths …

original: …pe… vatthuṁ nadassanena pahātabbe khandhe aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: pe vatthum na dassanena pahātabbe khandhe aniccato pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati
translated: the fruitions … He reviews the defilements that have been given up by the noble paths … the cankers that have been destroyed … the defilements that have been abandoned … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed … the fetters that have been given up … the cankers that have been destroyed …

original: taṁ ārabbha nadassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, uddhaccaṁ …pe… nadassanena pahātabbaṁ
analyzed: tam ārabbha na dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati uddhaccam pe na dassanena pahātabba
translated: Delight and greed that are to be given up by seeing are aroused by that, and uncertainty … and the bodily-pain that is to be given up by seeing are aroused.

original: domanassaṁ uppajjati; dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati …pe… anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya
analyzed: domanassam uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati pe anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya
translated: The divine eye sees form … and the knowledge of the future is the condition,

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as object condition.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya udāna
translated: A state to be given up by seeing is the condition, as object condition, for a state to be given up by development: giving …

original: …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ …pe… pubbe …pe… jhānā …pe… cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ nadassanena
analyzed: pe sīlam pe uposatha kammaṃ pe pubbe pe jhānā pe cakkhum pe vatthum na dassanena
translated: virtue … the service to mother and father … past life … the jhānas … the eye … the six sense spheres … the four primary elements … the physical heart-basis that is to be given up by development.

original: pahātabbe khandhe assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: pahātabbe khandhe assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: He delights in and enjoys the physical heart-basis that is to be given up by seeing, and greed is aroused in him that is to be given up by seeing.

original: diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā …pe… dassanena pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā pe dassanena pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati
translated: And uncertainty … and the bodily-pain that is to be given up by seeing are aroused.

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominance

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A state to be given up by seeing is the condition, as dominance condition, for a state to be given up by seeing: as object dominance,

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—dassanena pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati dassanena pahātabbam rāgam garum katvā assādeti
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is twofold, as conascence predominance condition and as object predominance condition.🔽The condition being by way of object predominance condition is when lust to be abandoned by the path of seeing delights in, welcomes, remains committed to, and clings to the object,

original: abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā dassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati,
analyzed: abhinandati tam garum katvā dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: and because of that delighting in, welcoming, remaining committed to, and clinging to the object, lust to be abandoned by the path of seeing arises, and view arises,🔽and because of that delighting in, welcoming, remaining committed to, and clinging to the view, … and so on. The condition being by way of conascence predominance condition is when a condition being by way of predominance condition that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is related to the associated aggregates as predominance condition.

original: diṭṭhiṁ garuṁ katvā …pe…. Sahajātādhipati—dassanena pahātabbādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: diṭṭhim garum katvā pe sahajāta adhipati dassanena pahātabba adhipati sampayuttakāna  khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A condition being by way of object predominance condition is when a condition being by way of object predominance condition that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is related to the associated aggregates as predominance condition.🔽A condition being by way of object predominance condition is when a condition being by way of object predominance condition that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is related to the associated aggregates as predominance condition.🔽A condition being by way of object predominance condition is when a condition being by way of object predominance condition that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is related to the associated aggregates as predominance condition.

original: Sahajātādhipati—dassanena pahātabbādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa ca nadassanena pahātabbassa ca
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati dassanena pahātabba adhipati citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa ca na dassanena pahātabbassa ca
translated: A condition being by way of object predominance condition is when a condition being by way of object predominance condition that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is related to the associated aggregates as predominance condition.

original: dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—dassanena pahātabbādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati dassanena pahātabba adhipati sampayuttakāna
translated: A condition being by way of object predominance condition is when a condition being by way of object predominance condition that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing is related to the associated aggregates as predominance condition.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The aggregates and the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness are conditionally related as a dominant condition.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ🔽…pe… pubbe …pe… jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, assādeti abhinandati,🔽taṁ garuṁ katvā nadassanena pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati, ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ🔽garuṁ katvā …pe… phalassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ nadassanena

original: … diṭṭhiṁ … patthanaṁ upanissāya pāṇaṁ hanati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati; dassanena pahātabbo
analyzed: diṭṭhim patthanam upanissāya pāṇam hanati pe saṅgham bhindati dassanena pahātabbaḥ
translated: … view … aspiration is a condition, as decisive support condition, for killing living beings … for schism … for wrong view.

original: rāgo …pe… patthanā dassanena pahātabbassa rāgassa …pe… patthanāya upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: rāgaḥ pe patthanā dassanena pahātabbassa rāgassa pe patthanāya upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena
translated: Lust … aspiration is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the abandoning of lust … for the abandoning of view … for the abandoning of aspiration by seeing.🔽A factor that is to be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as decisive support condition, for a factor that is not to be abandoned by seeing.

original: paccayo—anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—dassanena pahātabbaṁ🔽rāgaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti dassanena pahātabbaṁ dosaṁ …🔽mohaṁ … diṭṭhiṁ … patthanaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti; dassanena🔽pahātabbo rāgo …pe… patthanā saddhāya …pe… paññāya … nadassanena pahātabbassa rāgassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ anantara upanissayo pakata upanissayo pe pakata upanissayo dassanena  rāgam upanissāya dānam deti pe samāpattim uppādeti dassanena pahātabbam dosam  moham diṭṭhim patthanam upanissāya dānam deti pe samāpattim uppādeti dassanena  pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ pe patthanā saddhāya pe paññāya na dassanena pahātabbassa rāgassa
translated: As decisive support condition: the decisive support condition as prior support, the decisive support condition as subsequent support, the decisive support condition as both prior and subsequent support. As subsequent support: because of lust …🔽because of hatred … because of delusion … because of view … because of aspiration one gives a gift … one undertakes the precepts … one purifies one’s virtue … one purifies one’s view … one arouses energy … one attains absorption … one generates insight … one attains the fruit of stream-entry … of once-returning … of non-returning … of arahantship … one enters and emerges from the signless concentration of mind … the void concentration of mind … the desireless concentration of mind … the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling.

original: … dosassa … mohassa … mānassa … patthanāya … kāyikassa sukhassa …pe… phalasamāpattiyā
analyzed: dosassa mohassa mānassa patthanāya kāyikassa sukhassa pe phala samāpattiyā
translated: Lust … aspiration is a condition, as decisive support condition, for faith … for energy … for mindfulness … for concentration … for understanding … for bodily pleasure … for the happiness faculty … for the non-identifying … for the attainment of the fruit of stream-entry … of once-returning … of non-returning … of arahantship … for the attainment of the signless concentration of mind … the void concentration of mind … the desireless concentration of mind … the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling … for the fruit attainment.

original: upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ  na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena
translated: is a condition, as a decisive support condition.🔽A state that is to be given up by not seeing is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for a state that is to be given up by not seeing.

original: paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—saddhaṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ
translated: The decisive support condition is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for faith, virtue, generosity, and wisdom.

original: upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti, mānaṁ jappeti; sīlaṁ …pe… paññaṁ,🔽nadassanena pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ … dosaṁ … mohaṁ … mānaṁ … patthanaṁ … kāyikaṁ sukhaṁ🔽…pe… senāsanaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti, mānaṁ jappeti; saddhā
analyzed: upanissāya dānam deti pe samāpattim uppādeti mānam jappeti sīlam pe pañña  na dassanena pahātabbam rāgam dosam moham mānam patthanam kāyikam sukha  pe senāsanam upanissāya dānam deti pe samāpattim uppādeti mānam jappeti saddhā
translated: Because of faith one gives a gift … one generates an attainment; because of virtue … because of generosity … because of wisdom one gives a gift … one generates an attainment.

original: …pe… paññā, nadassanena pahātabbo rāgo …pe… patthanā … kāyikaṁ sukhaṁ …pe… senāsanaṁ
analyzed: pe paññā na dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ pe patthanā kāyikam sukham pe senāsana
translated: Because of faith one generates greed, hate, and delusion; one makes plans; one gives a gift … one generates an attainment; one makes a verbal expression. Because of virtue … because of generosity … because of wisdom one generates greed, hate, and delusion; one makes plans; one gives a gift … one generates an attainment; one makes a verbal expression.

original: saddhāya …pe… paññāya nadassanena pahātabbassa rāgassa …pe… patthanāya … kāyikassa
analyzed: saddhāya pe paññāya na dassanena pahātabbassa rāgassa pe patthanāya kāyikassa
translated: Because of faith one generates bodily pleasure and mental joy; one gives a gift … one generates an attainment; one makes a verbal expression. Because of virtue … because of generosity … because of wisdom one generates bodily pleasure and mental joy; one gives a gift … one generates an attainment; one makes a verbal expression.

original: sukhassa … kāyikassa dukkhassa … maggassa, phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sukhassa kāyikassa dukkhassa maggassa phala samāpattiyāḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A wholesome root that is not to be abandoned by seeing is a condition, as support condition, for a pleasant feeling, for bodily pleasure, for the path, for fruition attainment.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. translated: A state that is to be given up by seeing (the truth) is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for a state that is to be given up by seeing (the truth) by way of object.

original: vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ🔽ārabbha dassanena pahātabbo rāgo …pe… diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā …pe… dassanena pahātabbaṁ
analyzed: vatthu purejātaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum assādeti abhinandati  ārabbha dassanena pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ pe diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā pe dassanena pahātabba
translated: The basis is prior to the mental factors. The object is prior to the mental factors. Eye … mind is prior to the mental factors that are to be abandoned by seeing, and is related to them.

original: domanassaṁ uppajjati. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu dassanena pahātabbānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: domanassam uppajjati vatthu purejāta vatthu dassanena pahātabbānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Because of that, lust … view … uncertainty … aversion that is to be abandoned by seeing arises. The basis is prior to the mental factors that are to be abandoned by seeing, and is related to them. The basis is related to the mental factors that are to be abandoned by seeing as a prior and co-existing condition.

original: Pacchājātāsevana🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: pacchā jāta āsevana  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhitta
translated: Post-arising and repetition🔽A factor that is to be abandoned by seeing is related to a factor that is not to be abandoned by seeing as a post-arising condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa pacchājātapaccayena paccayo (saṅkhittaṁ) … āsevanapaccayena paccayo … dve.🔽Kamma
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ saṅkhittaḥ āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ dve 🔽kamma
translated: A factor that is not to be abandoned by seeing is related to a factor that is not to be abandoned by seeing as a post-arising condition. (Abbreviated.) … as a repetition condition … two.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—dassanena pahātabbā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā,
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ dassanena pahātabbā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as action condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing. The volition that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as action condition, for the associated aggregates.

original: nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—dassanena pahātabbā cetanā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena🔽paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—dassanena pahātabbā cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca
analyzed: nānākkhaṇikā sahajāta adassanena pahātabbā cetanā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam kamma paccayena  paccayaḥ nānākkhaṇikā dassanena pahātabbā cetanā vipākānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as action condition, for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing. Conascent and postnascent states are a condition, as action condition, for prenascent states.

original: rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa ca nadassanena pahātabbassa ca🔽dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—dassanena pahātabbā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa ca na dassanena pahātabbassa ca  dhammassa kamma paccayena paccaya udassanena pahātabbā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam
translated: Conascent states are a condition, as action condition, for the materiality originated by consciousness. Postnascent states are a condition, as action condition, for the materiality originated by consciousness.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as action condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing and for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing. The volition that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as action condition, for the associated aggregates and for the materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā,🔽nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—nadassanena pahātabbā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nānākkhaṇikā—nadassanena pahātabbā
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā  nānākkhaṇikā sahajāta anadassanena pahātabbā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca  rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe nānākkhaṇikāna dassanena pahātabbā
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as a kamma condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing. Conascent …🔽and postnascent. Conascent: volition that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as a kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cetanā vipākānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Postnascent: volition that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as a kamma condition, for the materiality originated by consciousness at the moment of rebirth-linking and for the kinds of materiality originated by nutriment.

original: Vipākādi
analyzed: vipāka ādi
translated: Resultant, etc.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vipākapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as a result condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing.

original: … ekaṁ … āhārapaccayena paccayo … cattāri … indriyapaccayena paccayo … cattāri …
analyzed: ekam āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri indriya paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: … is a condition, as a nutriment condition, for four … is a condition, as an influence condition, for four …

original: jhānapaccayena paccayo … cattāri … maggapaccayena paccayo … cattāri … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … dve.
analyzed: jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri magga paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: is a condition, as a jhāna condition, for four … is a condition, as a path condition, for four … is a condition, as an association condition, for two …

original: Vippayutta
analyzed: vippayutta
translated: Dissociated

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta  na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta pacchājāta
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as disjoined condition, for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing. Conascence, post-nascence. (Abbreviated.)🔽A phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as disjoined condition, for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing. Conascence, prenascence, post-nascence. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—vatthu dassanena pahātabbānaṁ khandhānaṁ vippayuttapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta vatthu dassanena pahātabbānam khandhānam vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as disjoined condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing. Prenascence—the physical basis is a condition, as disjoined condition, for the aggregates that are to be given up by seeing.

original: Atthyādi
analyzed: atthi ādi
translated: The Existent, etc.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo.🔽(Paṭiccasadisaṁ.) Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthipaccayena
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽paṭicca sadisa dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthi paccayena
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as existent condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing.🔽(Similar to the Dependent Origination.) A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as existent condition, for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing.

original: paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena🔽pahātabbassa ca nadassanena pahātabbassa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo. (Paṭiccavārasadisā.)🔽Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ,🔽purejātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo
analyzed: paccaya usahajāta pacchājāta saṅkhitta dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena  pahātabbassa ca na dassanena pahātabbassa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭicca vāra sadisā  na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta  purejāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ
translated: A condition being: as conascence, as post-nascence. (In brief.) A state that is to be given up through vision is related to a state that is to be given up through vision and to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a presence condition. (As in the Dependent Origination, the Path, and the Faculties.)🔽A state that is not to be given up through vision is related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a presence condition: as conascence,🔽as prenascence, as postnascence, as nutriment, as faculty. (In brief.) A state that is not to be given up through vision is related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a presence condition: as nutriment, as faculty.

original: dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe….🔽(Saṅkhittaṁ, purejātasadisaṁ.)🔽Dassanena pahātabbo ca nadassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa🔽atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajāto—dassanena pahātabbo eko khandho
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhum pe 🔽saṅkhitta purejāta sadisa 🔽dassanena pahātabbo ca na dassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa 🔽atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta sahajāta udassanena pahātabbaḥ ekaḥ khandho
translated: A condition being: conascence, post-nascence. (In brief.) A state that is to be given up through vision is related to a state that is to be given up through vision and to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is to be given up through vision as a condition being related to a state that is not to be given

original: ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe….
analyzed: ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca pe
translated: and the basis are a condition, as presence condition, for the three aggregates that are not to be abandoned by seeing … for two aggregates …

original: Dassanena pahātabbo ca nadassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbo ca na dassanena pahātabbaḥ ca dhammā na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa
translated: A state to be abandoned by seeing and a state not to be abandoned by seeing are a condition, as presence condition, for a state not to be abandoned by seeing.

original: atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. Sahajātā—dassanena🔽pahātabbā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.🔽Pacchājātā—dassanena pahātabbā khandhā ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena
analyzed: atthi paccayena paccayosahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya sahajāta ādassanena  pahātabbā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ  pacchājātādassanena pahātabbā khandhā ca kabaḷīkāraḥ āhāro ca imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena
translated: Conascence, post-nascence, nutriment, and faculty are a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽Post-nascent states to be abandoned by seeing are a condition, as presence condition, for this body.

original: paccayo. Pacchājātā—dassanena pahātabbā khandhā ca rūpajīvitindriyañca kaṭattārūpānaṁ🔽atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ pacchājātā dassanena pahātabbā khandhā ca rūpa jīvita indriyam ca  atthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Post-nascent states to be abandoned by seeing are a condition, as presence condition, for the kinds of materiality that are derived.

original: Natthipaccayena paccayo, vigatapaccayena paccayo, avigatapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: natthi paccayena paccayaḥ vigata paccayena paccayaḥ avigata paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As absence condition, as disappearance condition, as non-disappearance condition.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Numerals

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā pañca, anantare cattāri, samanantare🔽cattāri, sahajāte pañca, aññamaññe dve, nissaye satta, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte🔽dve, pacchājāte dve, āsevane dve, kamme cattāri, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre cattāri, indriye
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā pañca anantare cattāri samanantare  cattāri sahajāte pañca aññamaññe dve nissaye satta upanissaye cattāri purejāte  dve pacchājāte dve āsevane dve kamme cattāri vipāke eka āhāre cattāri indriye
translated: As to cause, there are four; as to object, there are four; as to predominance, there are five; as to proximity, there are four;

original: cattāri, jhāne cattāri, magge cattāri, sampayutte dve, vippayutte tīṇi, atthiyā satta,
analyzed: cattāri jhāne cattāri magge cattāri sampayutte dve vippayutte tīṇi atthiyā satta
translated: as to contiguity, there are four; as to presence, there are five; as to absence, there are two; as to disappearance, there are two; as to arising, there are two; as to presence and absence, there are two; as to result, there is one; as to kamma, there are four; as to nutriment, there are four; as to faculty, there are four; as to jhāna, there are four; as to path, there are four; as to association, there are two; as to dissociation, there are three; as to presence, there are seven;

original: natthiyā cattāri, vigate cattāri, avigate satta.
analyzed: natthiyā cattāri vigate cattāri avigate satta
translated: as to absence, there are four; as to disappearance, there are four; as to non-disappearance, there are seven.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra  dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The reverse order🔽A state that is to be given up through vision is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is to be given up through vision. … It is a condition, as conascence condition, … It is a condition, as decisive-support condition, for a state that is to be given up through vision.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is to be given up through vision is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is not to be given up through vision.

original: … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as a co-nascent condition … as a decisive support condition … as a post-nascence condition.

original: … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as a kamma condition.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa ca nadassanena pahātabbassa ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa ca na dassanena pahātabbassa ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as a co-nascent condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing and for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena
translated: A phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing.

original: paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo  upanissaya paccayena paccayo  purejāta paccayena
translated: … as a co-nascent condition … as a support condition … as a pre-arising condition …

original: paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as a post-arising condition … as a kamma condition … as a nutriment condition …

original: … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … as a faculty condition.

original: Nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A phenomenon that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by seeing. … as a support condition … as a pre-arising condition.

original: Dassanena pahātabbo ca nadassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.🔽Dassanena pahātabbo ca nadassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā nadassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.🔽2.13.1.7.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: dassanena pahātabbo ca na dassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta  dassanena pahātabbo ca na dassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā na dassanena pahātabbassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya  paccaya paccanīya
translated: Factors that should be abandoned by vision and factors that should not be abandoned by vision are conascent with, and postnascent to, factors that should not be abandoned by vision, and are a prenascent and postnascent condition for them.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: ..... Condition Reverse-Compendium🔽The Section on Numbers

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare🔽satta, nasahajāte pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, nanissaye pañca, naupanissaye satta,🔽napurejāte cha, napacchājāte satta …pe… namagge satta, nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte🔽cattāri, noatthiyā cattāri, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta, noavigate cattāri.
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare satta na samanantare  satta na sahajāte pañca na aññamaññe pañca na nissaye pañca na upanissaye satta  na purejāte cha na pacchājāte satta pe na magge satta na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte  cattāri no atthiyā cattāri no natthiyā satta no vigate satta no avigate cattāri
translated: Pure

original: 2.13.1.7.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya
analyzed: paccaya anuloma paccanīya
translated: In the section on the root causeless, there are seven in the root condition, seven in the object condition, seven in the predominance condition, seven in the proximity condition, seven in the absence condition, seven in the disappearance condition, seven in the cessation condition, seven in the path condition, seven in the non-root condition, seven in the non-object condition, seven in the non-predominance condition, seven in the non-proximity condition, seven in the non-absence condition, seven in the non-disappearance condition, seven in the non-cessation condition, seven in the non-path condition, seven in the non-root-non-non-root condition, seven in the non-object-non-non-object condition, seven in the non-predominance-non-non-predominance condition, seven in the non-proximity-non-non-proximity condition, seven in the non-absence-non-non-absence condition, seven in the non-disappearance-non-non-disappearance condition, seven in the non-cessation-non-non-cessation condition, seven in the non-path-non-non-path condition, seven in the root-non-root condition, seven in the object-non-object condition, seven in the predominance-non-predominance condition, seven in the proximity-non-proximity condition, seven in the absence-non-absence condition, seven in the disappearance-non-disappearance condition, seven in the cessation-non-cessation condition, seven in the path-non-path condition, seven in the root-non-root-non-non-root condition, seven in the object-non-object-non-non-object condition, seven in the predominance-non-predominance-non-non-predominance condition, seven in the proximity-non-proximity-non-non-proximity condition, seven in the absence

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cattāri, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare cattāri, nasamanantare🔽cattāri, naaññamaññe dve, naupanissaye cattāri (sabbattha cattāri), nasampayutte
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe cattāri na adhipatiyā nava na anantare cattāri na samanantare  cattāri na aññamaññe dve na upanissaye cattāri sabbattha cattāri na sampayutte
translated: With respect to condition being root, there are four [non-conditions] in object, nine in predominance, four in proximity, four in absence,🔽two in presence, two in non-deprivation, two in non-disappearance, four in non-disconnection,

original: dve, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā cattāri, novigate cattāri.
analyzed: dve na vippayutte dve no natthiyā cattāri no vigate cattāri
translated: two in association, two in dissociation, four in non-possession, and four in non-deprivation.

original: 2.13.1.7.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: ... The reverse order of conditions in sequence

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā pañca (anulomamātikā kātabbā) …pe… avigate satta.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā pañca anuloma mātikā kātabbā pe avigate satta
translated: With respect to non-condition being root, there are four [conditions] in object, five in predominance (the table should be done in the forward order) … and seven in non-disappearance.

original: Dassanena pahātabbadukaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.🔽2.13.2. Bhāvanāyapahātabbaduka
analyzed: dassanena pahātabba dukam niṭṭhita  bhāvanāya pahātabbaduka
translated: The section on what is to be abandoned by seeing is finished.🔽... The section on what is to be abandoned by development

original: 2.13.2.1–4. Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: ...–. The sequence of conditions, etc.

original: 2.13.2.1–4.1–4 Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: ...–.– The sequence of conditions, etc.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Yathā dassanadukaṁ, evaṁ vitthāretabbaṁ, ninnānākaraṇaṁ.)
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā yathā dassana duka evam vitthāretabba
translated: With respect to a conditioned phenomenon to be abandoned by development, a conditioned phenomenon to be abandoned by development arises conditioned by root cause. (It should be expanded as in the section on what is to be abandoned by seeing, but without the distinctions.)

original: Hetuyā pañca …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca pe avigate pañca
translated: With respect to root cause, there are five … and with respect to non-disappearance, there are five.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: The forward order.

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca uddhaccasahagato moho.🔽Nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ🔽nabhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ …pe… (yāva asaññasattā) vicikicchāsahagate khandhe🔽paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato moho. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā uddhacca sahagate khandhe paṭicca uddhacca sahagataḥ moho  na bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka  na bhāvanāya pahātabbam ekam khandham pe yāva asaññasattā vicikicchā sahagate khandhe  paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ moho
translated: Dependent on a state that is to be abandoned by development, a state that is to be abandoned by development arises with non-root-cause condition … (as in §10, but with the first and second conditions in reverse order.)🔽Dependent on a state that is not to be abandoned by development, a state that is not to be abandoned by development arises with non-root-cause condition … (as in §10, but with the first and second conditions in reverse order.)🔽Dependent on a state that is not to be abandoned by development, a state that is to be abandoned by development arises with non-root-cause condition … (as in §10, but with the first and second conditions in reverse order.)🔽(The rest is as in §10.)

original: Nahetuyā dve …pe… novigate tīṇi.🔽Paccanīyaṁ.🔽(Paccayavārapaccanīye nahetupaccaye uddhaccasahagate tīṇi, moho uddharitabbo. Sabbepi vārā dassanadukasadisā, uddhaccapaccanīyampi nānaṁ.)🔽2.13.2.7. Pañhāvāra🔽2.13.2.7.1–4. Paccayānulomādi🔽Vibhaṅgavāra🔽Hetu
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ dve pe na u vigate tīṇi 🔽paccanīya 🔽paccaya vāra paccanīye na hetu paccaye uddhacca sahagate tīṇi mohaḥ uddharitabbaḥ sabbe pi vārāḥ dassana duka sadisāḥ uddhacca paccanīyam pi nānā 🔽pañhāvāra 🔽paccaya anuloma ādi 🔽vibhaṅgavāra 🔽hetu

With a state not to be abandoned by development as condition, a state to be abandoned by the path of seeing and by the path of development and by development and by the path of seeing and by the path of development and by development arises, not as root-cause condition. With a state not to be abandoned by development as condition, a state to be abandoned by the path of seeing and by the path of development and by development and by the path of seeing and by the path of development

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—bhāvanāya pahātabbā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by development. The three roots that are to be given up by development are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates.

original: Nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo nabhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ na bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A phenomenon that is not to be given up by development is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a phenomenon that is not to be given up by development. (In brief.)

original: Ārammaṇa
analyzed: ārammaṇa
translated: Objects

original: Bhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—bhāvanāya🔽pahātabbaṁ rāgaṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbo rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ bhāvanāya pahātabbassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ bhāvanāya  pahātabbam rāgam assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: A phenomenon that is to be given up by development is a condition, as object condition, for a phenomenon that is to be given up by development.🔽One approves of, welcomes, and remains holding to the passion that is to be given up by development. The passion that is to be given up by development arises in dependence on that.

original: uddhaccaṁ uppajjati; bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ domanassaṁ uppajjati; uddhaccaṁ ārabbha
analyzed: uddhaccam uppajjati bhāvanāya pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati uddhaccam ārabbha

translated: agitation arises; the distress that is to be given up by development arises. In dependence on the distress that is to be given up by development,🔽the distress that is to be given up by development arises.

analyzed: domanassam ārabbha bhāvanāya pahātabbam domanassam uppajjati uddhaccam uppajjati
translated: and grief that should be abandoned by development.🔽A state that should be abandoned by development is a condition, as object condition, for a state that should not be abandoned by development.
