translated: A factor associated with thought is a condition, as root-cause condition, for thought. The associated aggregates are …🔽at the stage of rebirth-linking …

original: Savitakkañca avitakkañca dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho savitakko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—savitakkaṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhañca vitakkañca saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sa vitakkam ca avitakkam ca dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā a sa vitakka  ekam khandhañca vitakkañca sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe pe
translated: A factor associated with thought and a factor not associated with thought are a condition, as root-cause condition, for thought. The associated aggregates and thought are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates. At the stage of rebirth-linking …

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha, adhipatiyā cha (sabbattha cha) avigate cha.🔽Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha adhipatiyā cha sabbattha cha avigate cha  anuloma
translated: (In brief:) As to root-cause, there are six; as to object, there are six; as to predominance, there are six; as to non-deprivation, there are six.🔽In the affirmative section there are six questions to be answered in the same way as in the section on the cause, but substituting “without root-cause” for “with root-cause.” The three kinds of root-cause should be omitted.

original: Savitakkaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho savitakko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Evaṁ cha pañhā kātabbā anulomasadisā, ahetukāti niyāmetabbā, tīṇiyeva, moho uddharitabbo.)
analyzed: sa vitakkam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā evam cha pañhā kātabbā anuloma sadisā ahetukā ati niyāmetabbā mohaḥ uddharitabbaḥ
translated: A factor not associated with thought is a condition, not as root-cause condition, for a factor not associated with thought. (The six questions are to be formulated in the same way as in the affirmative section, but substituting “without root-cause” for “with root-cause.” The three kinds of root-cause should be omitted.)

original: Nahetuyā cha, naadhipatiyā cha, napurejāte cha, napacchājāte cha, naāsevane cha, nakamme cattāri, navipāke cha, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge cha, navippayutte cha.
analyzed: na hetuyā cha na adhipatiyā cha na purejāte cha na pacchājāte cha na āsevane cha na kamme cattāri na vipāke cha na jhāne eka na magge cha na vippayutte cha
translated: With no cause as condition, there are six. With no predominance, there are six. With no prior condition, there are six. With no post-condition, there are six. With no repetition, there are six. With no kamma, there are four. With no kamma-result, there are six. With no jhāna, there is one. With no path, there are six. With no non-causality, there are six.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: The reverse order.

original: 2.13.5.6. Sampayuttavāra
translated: The Section on Conjoined

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.5.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ  pañhāvāra
translated: The other two enumerations and the section on conjoined should be done in the same way.🔽The Section on Questions🔽The Section on Conditions in Regular Order

original: 2.13.5.7.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Section on Analysis

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—savitakkā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Savitakko dhammo avitakkassa🔽dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—savitakkā hetū vitakkassa cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo sa vitakkāḥ hetū  khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ a vitakkassa  dhammassa hetu paccayena paccaya usa vitakkāḥ hetū vitakkassa citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ
translated: A state with applied-thought is a condition, as cause condition, for a state with applied-thought—the causes with applied-thought are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates.🔽A state with applied-thought is a condition, as cause condition, for a state without applied-thought—the causes with applied-thought are a condition, as cause condition, for applied-thought and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakkā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe mūlam kātabba sa vitakkā hetū sampayuttakāna
translated: A state with applied-thought is a condition, as cause condition, for a state with applied-thought and for a state without applied-thought—the causes with applied-thought are a condition, as cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for applied-thought and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…
analyzed: khandhānam vitakkassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: The states of the aggregates and the form that is derived from the mind element are related to applied thought as a cause condition. At the stage of rebirth-linking …

original: Avitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—avitakkā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Ārammaṇa🔽Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—savitakke khandhe
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ avitakkāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  ārammaṇa  sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sa vitakke khandhe
translated: A state that is not connected with applied thought is related to a state that is not connected with applied thought as a cause condition. The causes that are not connected with applied thought are related to the associated aggregates and to the form that is derived from the mind element as a cause condition. At the stage of rebirth-linking …

original: ārabbha savitakkā khandhā uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakke khandhe ārabbha🔽avitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakke khandhe ārabbha🔽savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: ārabbha sa vitakkāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti mūlam kātabba sa vitakke khandhe ārabbha  avitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti mūlam kātabba sa vitakke khandhe ārabbha  sa vitakkāḥ khandhāḥ ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti
translated: Object condition means: A state that is connected with applied thought is related to a state that is connected with applied thought as an object condition. The states that are connected with applied thought are related to the states that are connected with applied thought as an object condition. (The same method applies to the remaining two kinds of object condition.)

original: Avitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—ariyā avitakkā jhānā
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayoariyāḥ avitakkāḥ jhānāḥ
translated: The states that are connected with applied thought are related to the states that are not connected with applied thought as an object condition. The states that are connected with applied thought are related to the states that are connected with applied thought and to applied thought as an object condition.

original: vuṭṭhahitvā avitakkaṁ jhānaṁ paccavekkhanti, maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhanti,🔽phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ avitakkassa
analyzed: vuṭṭhahitvā avitakkam jhānam paccavekkhanti maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam paccavekkhanti  phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalam paccavekkhanti nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam avitakkassa
translated: having emerged from the formless jhāna, they review the jhāna that has the thought-conception and the exploration of form, having emerged from the path, they review the path,

original: maggassa, phalassa, vitakkassa ca ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ
analyzed: maggassa phalassa vitakkassa ca ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe vatthu
translated: having emerged from the fruition attainment, they review the fruition attainment, they review Nibbāna, Nibbāna is related to the path, fruition, and thought-conception, as object condition. Eye sense-sphere … mind sense-sphere …

original: avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ🔽ārabbha vitakko uppajjati, dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ
analyzed: avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca aniccato pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati  ārabbha vitakkaḥ uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā sadda
translated: having emerged from the formless jhāna, they contemplate the impermanence, etc., of the aggregates that are without thought-conception and thought-conception, they aspire for them, they are intent on them, they welcome them, they are greedy for them,

original: suṇāti, cetopariyañāṇena avitakkacittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānāti, ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ
analyzed: suṇāti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena a vitakka citta samaṅgissa cittam jānāti
translated: having emerged from the formless jhāna, they see a visible form with the divine eye, they hear a sound with the divine ear element, they understand the mind of someone without thought-conception with the knowledge of the mind of another, they understand the base of infinite space as peaceful and sublime,

original: …pe… ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ …pe… rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ …pe…
analyzed: pe ākiñcaññāyatanam pe rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam pe
translated: the base of infinite consciousness … the base of nothingness … a visible form as a visible form element … a tangible as a tangible element,

original: avitakkā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa
analyzed: avitakkā khandhā iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa
translated: the aggregates that are without thought-conception are related to the knowledge of the modes of supernormal power, the knowledge of the mind of another, the knowledge of recollection of past lives,

original: yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, vitakkassa ca ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo;🔽avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha avitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa vitakkassa ca ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha avitakkā khandhā ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti
translated: The object condition is a condition, as object condition, for knowledge of how far to go and for knowledge of past lives and for thinking.🔽The object condition is a condition, as object condition, for the states that are without thought and for thinking, in dependence on the aggregates that are without thought and on thinking.

original: Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—ariyā avitakkā jhānā
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayoariyāḥ avitakkāḥ jhānāḥ
translated: A state that is without thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that has thought,🔽when noble disciples, having emerged from the formless attainments,

original: vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… maggā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalaṁ paccavekkhanti,🔽nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, savitakkassa maggassa,
analyzed: vuṭṭhahitvā pe maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe phalāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā phalam paccavekkhanti  nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa sa vitakkassa maggassa
translated: review the path, review the fruit, review Nibbāna,

original: phalassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ avitakke khandhe🔽ca vitakkañca aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati
analyzed: phalassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe vatthum avitakke khandhe  ca vitakkañca aniccato pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: review the formless attainments, and review the attainment of cessation; when they review the path, review the fruit, review Nibbāna, and review the attainment of cessation, in dependence on the formless attainments that are without thought;🔽when they review the formless attainments that are without thought and thinking as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, a boil, a dart, a calamity, an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as empty, as nonself; when they review the formless attainments that are without thought and thinking as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, a boil, a dart, a calamity, an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as empty, as nonself, and greed arises in them,

original: …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha savitakkā khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: pe domanassam uppajjati avitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca ārabbha sa vitakkāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: repugnance arises in them, and applied thought arises in them.🔽The object condition is a condition, as object condition, for the states that are without thought and for thinking, in dependence on the aggregates that are without thought and on thinking.

original: Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—ariyā
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo ariyā
translated: A state that is without thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is with thought and for a state that is without thought.

original: avitakkā jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… maggā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalaṁ paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: a vitakkā jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā pe maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe phalāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā phalam paccavekkhanti
translated: Noble ones, having emerged from the jhāna that is without thought … having emerged from the path that is without thought … having emerged from fruition that is without thought, review the fruition.

original: nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, savitakkassa maggassa,
analyzed: nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa sa vitakkassa maggassa
translated: They review Nibbāna. Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the path that is with thought,

original: phalassa, āvajjanāya, vitakkassa ca ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ🔽avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ
analyzed: phalassa āvajjanāya vitakkassa ca ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe vatthu  avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca aniccato pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati
translated: for fruition that is with thought, for adverting, and for thought. Eye sense-sphere … mind sense-sphere …

original: ārabbha savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti, avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca
analyzed: ārabbha sa vitakkā khandhā ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti avitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca
translated: When someone contemplates as impermanent the materiality dependent on the four great primaries that are without thought, and he contemplates the thought as impermanent, and he is equanimous about it, approves of it, and delights in it,

original: ārabbha savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: ārabbha sa vitakkā khandhā ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti
translated: then, depending on that, the states that are with thought and the thought arise.🔽When someone contemplates as impermanent the materiality and the thought dependent on the four great primaries that are without thought,🔽and he is equanimous about it, approves of it, and delights in it, then, depending on that, the states that are with thought and the thought arise.

original: Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā savitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—savitakke
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sa vitakke
translated: A state that is with thought and a state that is without thought are a condition, as object condition, for a state that is with thought.

original: khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha savitakkā khandhā uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakke
analyzed: khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha sa vitakkāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti mūlam kātabba sa vitakke
translated: The factors that are with applied-thought, in dependence on the factors that are with applied-thought and on applied-thought. (The root should be supplied.)

original: khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha avitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.)
analyzed: khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha avitakkā khandhā ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti mūlam kātabba
translated: The factors that are without applied-thought, in dependence on the factors that are with applied-thought and on applied-thought. (The root should be supplied.)

original: Savitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti.🔽Adhipati
analyzed: sa vitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca ārabbha sa vitakkā khandhā ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti  adhipati
translated: The factors that are with applied-thought, in dependence on the factors that are with applied-thought and on applied-thought.

original: Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—savitakke khandhe garuṁ katvā savitakkā khandhā
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati sa vitakke khandhe garum katvā sa vitakkā khandhā
translated: Dominant condition means: A factor that is with applied-thought is a condition, by way of dominant condition, for a factor that is with applied-thought—as object-predominance,🔽as co-nascence-predominance. As object-predominance: Having given importance to the factors that are with applied-thought, the factors that are with applied-thought …

original: uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—savitakkādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati sa vitakka adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As co-nascence-predominance: The predominance of the factors that are with applied-thought is a condition, by way of dominant condition, for the associated factors.

original: Savitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A factor that is with applied-thought is a condition, by way of dominant condition, for a factor that is without applied-thought—as object-predominance,

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—savitakke khandhe garuṁ katvā vitakko uppajjati.
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati sa vitakke khandhe garum katvā vitakkaḥ uppajjati
translated: Object predominance condition means: having made the mental factors of the first jhāna great, applied thought arises.

original: Sahajātādhipati—savitakkādhipati vitakkassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati sa vitakka adhipati vitakkassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Associated predominance condition means: the predominance of the first jhāna is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for applied thought and for the forms that are derived from the mind.

original: Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—savitakke khandhe garuṁ katvā savitakkā khandhā🔽ca vitakko ca uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—savitakkādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati sa vitakke khandhe garum katvā sa vitakkā khandhā  ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati sa vitakka adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam
translated: A state with applied thought is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a state with applied thought and for a state without applied thought.🔽Object predominance condition means: having made the mental factors of the first jhāna great, the mental factors of the first jhāna and applied thought arise.

original: vitakkassa ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: vitakkassa ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: Associated predominance condition means: the predominance of the first jhāna is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the associated mental factors and for the forms that are derived from the mind.🔽A state without applied thought is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a state without applied thought.

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā avitakkā jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… maggā vuṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati ariyāḥ avitakkāḥ jhānāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā
translated: Object predominance condition means: having emerged from the formless attainments without applied thought, having emerged from the path without applied thought, having emerged from fruition without applied thought, having emerged from the attainment of cessation, having emerged from the state of non-percipient beings,

original: …pe… phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: pe phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti
translated: … they review the path … they review the fruition … they review Nibbāna as foremost,

original: nibbānaṁ avitakkassa maggassa, phalassa, vitakkassa ca adhipatipaccayena paccayo;🔽cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati,🔽taṁ garuṁ katvā vitakko uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—avitakkādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: nibbānam avitakkassa maggassa phalassa vitakkassa ca adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  cakkhum pe vatthum avitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca garum katvā assādeti abhinandati  tam garum katvā vitakkaḥ uppajjati sahajāta adhipati a vitakka adhipati sampayuttakāna
translated: and Nibbāna is a condition, as predominance condition, for the path and fruition of the non-perplexed, and for applied thought.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The eye … the mind-object … the eye-consciousness … the mind-consciousness element … the states associated with non-perplexity are a condition, as predominance condition, for the states associated with applied thought and for the states associated with sustained thought.

original: Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā🔽avitakkā jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… maggā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… phalā vuṭṭhahitvā phalaṁ garuṁ
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati ariyā  a vitakkā jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā pe maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe phalāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā phalam garu
translated: A non-perplexed state is a condition, as predominance condition, for a perplexed state.

original: katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa,
analyzed: katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa
translated: As object-predominance: Noble disciples, emerging from the non-perplexity of the jhānas … emerging from the non-perplexity of the paths … emerging from the non-perplexity of the fruitions … reviewing the fruition … reviewing Nibbāna as foremost,🔽and Nibbāna is a condition, as predominance condition, for the change-of-lineage consciousness,

original: vodānassa, savitakkassa maggassa, phalassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe…🔽vatthuṁ avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ
analyzed: vodānassa sa vitakkassa maggassa phalassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe  vatthum avitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garu
translated: the path of non-return … the fruit of non-return … the path of arahantship … the fruit of arahantship are respectively related to the path of arahantship as a decisive support condition.🔽The five aggregates as objects of clinging that are related to the five aggregates as objects of clinging that are wholesome and to applied thought as a support are a condition, as a decisive support condition, for the five aggregates as objects of clinging that are wholesome and for applied thought.

original: katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garuṁ katvā🔽savitakkā khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati avitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca garum katvā  sa vitakkāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: The five aggregates as objects of clinging that are related to the five aggregates as objects of clinging that are wholesome and to applied thought as a support are a condition, as a decisive support condition, for the five aggregates as objects of clinging that are wholesome and for applied thought.

original: Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā avitakkā jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… maggā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… phalā
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  ārammaṇa adhipati ariyāḥ avitakkāḥ jhānāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe phalā
translated: A state that is not accompanied by applied thought is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for a state that is accompanied by applied thought and for a state that is not accompanied by applied thought.🔽As the object of decisive support: Noble disciples, emerging from the attainment of the first jhāna that is not accompanied by applied thought … emerging from the attainment of the second jhāna … emerging from the attainment of the third jhāna … emerging from the attainment of the fourth jhāna … emerging from the attainment of the path … emerging from the attainment of the fruition …

original: vuṭṭhahitvā phalaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: vuṭṭhahitvā phalam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti
translated: contemplate the fruit as a support. They contemplate Nibbāna as a support.

original: nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, savitakkassa maggassa, phalassa, vitakkassa ca adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa sa vitakkassa maggassa phalassa vitakkassa ca adhipati paccayena
translated: Nibbāna is a condition, as a decisive support condition, for the path of stream-entry … for the fruit of stream-entry … for the path of once-returning … for the fruit of once-returning … for the path of non-return … for the fruit of non-return … for the path of arahantship … for the fruit of arahantship … for applied thought.

original: paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garuṁ katvā assādeti🔽abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati; avitakke khandhe ca
analyzed: paccayaḥ cakkhum pe vatthum avitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garum katvā assādeti  abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati avitakke khandhe ca
translated: the mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought, and applied thought itself, are a condition, as a dominant condition, for the other four immaterial aggregates.

original: vitakkañca garuṁ katvā savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca uppajjanti.🔽Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā savitakkassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Ārammaṇādhipati—savitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garuṁ katvā savitakkā khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: vitakkam ca garum katvā sa vitakkā khandhāḥ ca vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti  sa vitakkaḥ ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakkassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayo  ārammaṇa adhipati sa vitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca garum katvā sa vitakkāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: Craving and view arise in dependence on the mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought, and applied thought itself.🔽The mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought, and applied thought itself, are a condition, as a dominant condition, for the mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought.

original: (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garuṁ katvā vitakko uppajjati.🔽(Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakke khandhe ca vitakkañca garuṁ katvā savitakkā khandhā ca
analyzed: mūlam kātabba sa vitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca garum katvā vitakkaḥ uppajjati  mūlam kātabba sa vitakke khandhe ca vitakkam ca garum katvā sa vitakkā khandhā ca
translated: Dominant condition as object: the mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought, and applied thought itself, are a condition, as a dominant condition, for the mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought.🔽(The same method as above.) The mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought, and applied thought itself, are a condition, as a dominant condition, for applied thought.

original: vitakko ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: vitakkaḥ ca uppajjanti
translated: (The same method as above.) The mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought, and applied thought itself, are a condition, as a dominant condition, for the mental factors of the cognitive process that occur together with applied thought, and for applied thought.

original: Anantarādi
analyzed: anantara ādi
translated: Immediately preceding condition

original: Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā savitakkā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ savitakkānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā sa vitakkā khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam sa vitakkānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state with applied-thought is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state with applied-thought. The preceding preceding aggregates are a condition, as proximate condition, for the succeeding succeeding aggregates.

original: Savitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā savitakkā🔽khandhā pacchimassa pacchimassa vitakkassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; savitakkaṁ🔽cuticittaṁ avitakkassa upapatticittassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; āvajjanā pañcannaṁ🔽viññāṇānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo; savitakkā khandhā avitakkassa vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā sa vitakkā  khandhā pacchimassa pacchimassa vitakkassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ sa vitakka  cuti cittam avitakkassa upapatti cittassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ āvajjanā  viññāṇānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ sa vitakkāḥ khandhāḥ avitakkassa vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena
translated: A state with applied-thought is a condition, as proximate condition, for a state without applied-thought. The preceding preceding aggregates are a condition, as proximate condition, for the applied-thought of the succeeding succeeding consciousness.🔽The state with applied-thought is a condition, as proximate condition, for the state without applied-thought. The death consciousness with applied-thought is a condition, as proximate condition, for the rebirth-linking consciousness without applied-thought.

original: paccayo; dutiyassa jhānassa parikammaṁ dutiyassa jhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: paccayaḥ dutiyassa jhānassa parikammam dutiyassa jhānassa anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: The adverting is a condition, as proximate condition, for the five consciousnesses. The aggregates with applied-thought are a condition, as proximate condition, for the emergence without applied-thought. The preliminary work for the second jhāna is a condition, as proximate condition, for the second jhāna.

original: tatiyassa jhānassa parikammaṁ …pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa
analyzed: tatiyassa jhānassa parikammam pe nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammam nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa
translated: The preliminary work to the third absorption … The preliminary work to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception …

original: …pe… dibbassa cakkhussa parikammaṁ …pe… dibbāya sotadhātuyā parikammaṁ …pe… iddhividhañāṇassa🔽parikammaṁ …pe… cetopariyañāṇassa parikammaṁ …pe… pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa parikammaṁ🔽…pe… yathākammūpagañāṇassa parikammaṁ yathākammūpagañāṇassa …pe… anāgataṁsañāṇassa
analyzed: pe dibbassa cakkhussa parikammam pe dibbāya sota dhātuyāḥ parikammam pe iddhividha ñāṇassa  parikammaṃ pe cetas pariya ñāṇassa parikammaṃ pe pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa parikamma  pe yathākammūpaga ñāṇassa parikammam yathākammūpaga ñāṇassa pe anāgata sañāṇassa
translated: … The preliminary work to the divine eye … The preliminary work to the divine ear … The preliminary work to knowledge of the mind of another …🔽… The preliminary work to knowledge of past lives … The preliminary work to knowledge of the future … The preliminary work to knowledge of the ending of the effluents …

original: parikammaṁ anāgataṁsañāṇassa anantarapaccayena paccayo. Gotrabhu avitakkassa maggassa
analyzed: parikammam anāgata sañāṇassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ gotrabhu a vitakkassa maggassa
translated: … The preliminary work to knowledge of the ending of the effluents is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for knowledge of the future. The state of change-of-lineage is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the path that is without thought …

original: … vodānaṁ avitakkassa maggassa … anulomaṁ avitakkāya phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vodānam avitakkassa maggassa anulomam avitakkāya phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: … The state of change-of-lineage is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the path that is without thought … The conformity is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit that is without thought.

original: Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayopurimā
translated: A thought-connected factor is a condition, by way of proximity condition, for a thought-connected factor and for a thought-disconnected factor—the preceding …

original: purimā savitakkā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ savitakkānaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa🔽ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimo purimo vitakko
analyzed: purimā sa vitakkā khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam sa vitakkānam khandhānam vitakkassa  ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimaḥ purimaḥ vitakko
translated: The preceding thought-accompanied aggregates are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the succeeding thought-accompanied aggregates and for thought.

original: pacchimassa pacchimassa vitakkassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; purimā purimā avitakkā🔽khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ avitakkānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: pacchimassa pacchimassa vitakkassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā avitakkā  khandhāḥ pacchimānam pacchimānam avitakkānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A thought-free state is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a thought-free state—the preceding thought is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the succeeding thought; the preceding thought-free aggregates are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the succeeding thought-free aggregates;

original: avitakko maggo avitakkassa phalassa …pe… avitakkaṁ phalaṁ avitakkassa phalassa …pe…
analyzed: avitakkaḥ maggaḥ a vitakkassa phalassa pe avitakkam phalam a vitakkassa phalassa pe
translated: the thought-free path is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the thought-free fruit of the path … the thought-free fruit of the path is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the thought-free fruit of the path …

original: nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ avitakkāya phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam avitakkāya phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: when emerging from cessation, the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the thought-free attainment of fruit.

original: Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimo purimo vitakko
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimaḥ purimaḥ vitakko
translated: A thought-free state is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a thought-accompanied state—the preceding thought is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the thought-accompanied aggregates …

original: pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ savitakkānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo; avitakkaṁ
analyzed: pacchimānam pacchimānam sa vitakkānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ avitakka
translated: The preceding of the successive immaterial aggregates are conditions, as proximity condition, for the immaterial aggregates that follow.

original: cuticittaṁ savitakkassa upapatticittassa, avitakkaṁ bhavaṅgaṁ āvajjanāya, avitakkā🔽khandhā savitakkassa vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cuti cittam sa vitakkassa upapatti cittassa avitakkam bhavaṅgam āvajjanāya avitakkā  khandhā sa vitakkassa vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The death consciousness that is without thought is a condition, as proximity condition, for the rebirth-linking consciousness that is with thought. The thought-free life-continuum is a condition, as proximity condition, for the adverting that is with thought. The thought-free aggregates are a condition, as proximity condition, for the arising that is with thought.

original: Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimo🔽purimo vitakko pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ savitakkānaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā savitakkassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā🔽purimā savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ savitakkānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimaḥ  purimaḥ vitakko pacchimānam pacchimānam sa vitakkānam khandhānam vitakkassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ  sa vitakkaḥ ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakkassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayopurimā  purimā sa vitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca pacchimānam pacchimānam sa vitakkānam khandhānam
translated: A thought-free state is a condition, as proximity condition, for a thought-free state and for a state with thought—the preceding thought is a condition, as proximity condition, for the successive thought-free aggregates and for thought.

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state with thought and a thought-free state are conditions, as proximity condition, for a state with thought—the preceding thought-free aggregates and thought are conditions, as proximity condition, for the successive thought-free aggregates and for thought.

original: Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā avitakkassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā🔽purimā savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca pacchimassa pacchimassa vitakkassa anantarapaccayena🔽paccayo; savitakkaṁ cuticittañca vitakko ca avitakkassa upapatticittassa …pe… āvajjanā🔽ca vitakko ca pañcannaṁ viññāṇānaṁ …pe… savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca avitakkassa🔽vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; dutiyassa jhānassa parikammañca vitakko ca
analyzed: sa vitakko ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā avitakkassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayopurimā  purimā sa vitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca pacchimassa pacchimassa vitakkassa anantara paccayena  paccayo sa vitakkam cuti cittam ca vitakko ca avitakkassa upapatti cittassa pe āvajjanā  ca vitakko ca pañcannam viññāṇānam pe sa vitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca a vitakkassa  vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ dutiyassa jhānassa parikammañca vitakko ca
translated: Ideas that are both accompanied by applied thought and accompanied by sustained thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for ideas that are not accompanied by applied thought. Preceding …🔽preceeding ideas that are accompanied by applied thought and applied thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for succeeding applied thought. The death consciousness that is accompanied by applied thought and applied thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the rebirth-linking consciousness that is not accompanied by applied thought. …

original: …pe… (heṭṭhā likhitaṁ lekhaṁ iminā kāraṇena daṭṭhabbaṁ); anulomañca vitakko ca avitakkāya
analyzed: pe heṭṭhā likhitam lekham iminā kāraṇena daṭṭhabba anulomaṃ ca vitakko ca a vitakkāya
translated: Applied thought and applied thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the five consciousnesses. … Ideas that are accompanied by applied thought and applied thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the arising of the non-percipient attainment. The preliminary-work concentration for the second jhana and applied thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the second jhana. …

original: phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … the path and applied thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the fruition attainment that is not accompanied by applied thought.

original: Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa anantarapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa anantara paccayena
translated: Ideas that are both accompanied by applied thought and accompanied by sustained thought are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for ideas that are accompanied by applied thought and for ideas that are not accompanied by applied thought.

original: paccayo—purimā purimā savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ savitakkānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayopurimā purimā sa vitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca pacchimānam pacchimānam sa vitakkānam  khandhānam vitakkassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought and the thought itself are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates with applied thought🔽and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates without applied thought🔽and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates with applied thought

original: Samanantarapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … nava … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … nava … nissayapaccayena paccayo … nava.🔽Upanissaya🔽Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,
analyzed: samanantara paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ nava  aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ nava  nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ nava  upanissaya  sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ
translated: and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates without applied thought🔽and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates with applied thought🔽and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates without applied thought

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—savitakkā khandhā savitakkānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakkā khandhā avitakkānaṁ
analyzed: anantara upanissayo pakata upanissayo pe pakata upanissayo sa vitakkā khandhā  khandhānam upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam sa vitakkā khandhā avitakkānam
translated: and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates with applied thought🔽and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates without applied thought🔽and for the thought. (The root should be expanded.) As a condition being prior and support: the former and former aggregates with applied thought are conditions, as a support condition, for the latter and latter aggregates with applied thought

original: khandhānaṁ vitakkassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Savitakkā
analyzed: khandhānam vitakkassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba sa vitakkā

original: Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā avitakkassa dhammassa vippayuttapaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)

original: Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo. (Ekaṁ, paṭiccasadisaṁ.)
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ eka paṭicca sadisa
translated: A factor with applied thought and sustained thought is related to a factor with applied thought and sustained thought as a condition being existent. (One, similar to the condition.)

original: Savitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ.
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta pacchājāta
translated: A factor with applied thought and sustained thought is related to a factor without applied thought and sustained thought as a condition being existent—conascence, post-nascence.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena
analyzed: saṅkhitta sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena
translated: (Condensed.) A factor with applied thought and sustained thought is related to a factor with applied thought and sustained thought and to a factor without applied thought and sustained thought as a condition being existent—

original: paccayo. (Paṭiccasadisaṁ.)🔽Avitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ,🔽pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa
analyzed: paccayaḥ paṭicca sadisa  avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta purejāta  pacchājāta āhāra indriya saṅkhitta avitakkaḥ dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa
translated: (Similar to the condition.)🔽A factor without applied thought and sustained thought is related to a factor without applied thought and sustained thought as a condition being existent—conascence, prenascence,🔽post-nascence, nutriment, faculty. (Condensed.) A factor without applied thought and sustained thought is related to a factor with applied thought and sustained thought as a condition being existent—

original: atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa
analyzed: atthi paccayena avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa
translated: conascence, prenascence. (Condensed.) A factor without applied thought and sustained thought is related to a factor with applied thought and sustained thought and to a factor without applied thought and sustained thought as a condition being existent—

original: ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajāto—vitakko🔽sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽vitakko sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo, paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽vatthu vitakkassa sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ🔽…pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha vitakko ca🔽sampayuttakā ca khandhā uppajjanti, vatthu vitakkassa sampayuttakānañca khandhānaṁ
analyzed: ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta purejāta sahajātaḥ vitakko  sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  vitakko sampayuttakānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca rūpānam atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  vatthu vitakkassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta cakkhu  pe vatthum aniccataḥ pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha vitakko ca  sampayuttakā ca khandhā uppajjanti vatthu vitakkassa sampayuttakānaṃ ca khandhānaṃ
translated: … of a state that is not applied thought: the condition is by way of presence condition.🔽Conascence condition means: applied thought🔽is for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness, a condition by way of presence condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking🔽applied thought is for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality derived from the four great primaries, a condition by way of presence condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking🔽the physical heart-basis is for applied thought and for the associated aggregates, a condition by way of presence condition. Preceding state condition means: one who sees materiality … … one who sees the mind … … one who sees things … … one who sees the eye … … one who sees the ear … … one who sees the nose … … one who sees the tongue … … one who sees the body … … one who sees the ear-element … … one who sees the nose-element … … one who sees the tongue-element … … one who sees the body-element … … one who sees the visible-data element … … one who sees the mind-element … … one who sees the mental-data element … … one who sees the eye-consciousness element … … one who sees the ear-consciousness element … … one who sees the nose-consciousness element … … one who sees the tongue-consciousness element … … one who sees the body-consciousness element … … one who sees the mind-element … … one who sees the mind-consciousness element … … one who sees the eye-contact element … … one who sees the ear-contact element … … one who sees the nose-contact element … … one who sees the tongue-contact element … … one who sees the body-contact element … … one who sees the mind-contact element … … one who sees the feeling born of eye-contact … … one who sees the feeling born of ear-contact … … one who sees the feeling born of nose-contact … … one who sees the feeling born of tongue-contact … … one who sees the feeling born of body-contact … … one who sees the feeling born of mind-contact … … one who sees the perception of forms … … one who sees the perception of sounds … … one who sees the perception of odours … … one who sees the perception of flavours … … one who sees the perception of tangible data … … one who sees the perception of mental data … … one who sees the volition regarding forms

translated: The condition being by way of presence condition is: that which is born before is a condition for that which is born after.🔽That which is born together is a condition for that which is born together: the one thought-associated aggregate and thought are a condition for the presence of three aggregates … two aggregates …🔽That which is born together is a condition for that which is born together: the one thought-associated aggregate and the physical basis are a condition for the presence of three aggregates … two aggregates …🔽(At the consciousness moment of rebirth two things are born together.)🔽That which is associated with thought and that which is not associated with thought are a condition for that which is not associated with thought by way of presence condition: that which is born together,🔽that which is born before, that which is born after, nutriment, and faculty. That which is born together is a condition for that which is born together: the thought-associated aggregates and thought are a condition for the presence of the form that is derived from thought. That which is born together is a condition for that which is born together: the thought-associated aggregates and the physical basis are a condition for the presence of the form that is derived from thought.

original: khandhā ca vitakko ca purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo. Pacchājātā—savitakkā🔽khandhā ca vitakko ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa kāyassa atthipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: khandhā ca vitakko ca purejātassa imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo pacchājātā sa vitakkā  khandhā ca vitakko ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo
translated: The aggregates and applied thought are a condition, as presence condition, for this body that arose before.🔽Postnascent states that are accompanied by applied thought🔽are a condition, as presence condition, for materiality due to kamma-formation and for the material septad of physical basis and the rest.

original: Pacchājātā—savitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca rūpajīvitindriyañca kaṭattārūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo.🔽Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa atthipaccayena🔽paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajāto—savitakko eko khandho ca vitakko ca tiṇṇannaṁ
analyzed: pacchājātā asavitakkā khandhā ca vitakko ca rūpa jīvita indriyañca kaṭattā rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayo  sa vitakkaḥ ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa atthi paccayena  paccayo usahajāta purejāta sahajāta usa vitakkaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vitakko ca
translated: Postnascent states that are accompanied by applied thought are a condition, as presence condition, for the heart-basis and for the materiality of temperature and consciousness.🔽States that are accompanied by applied thought and states that are not accompanied by applied thought are a condition, as presence condition, for states that are accompanied by applied thought and for states that are not accompanied by applied thought.🔽Conascent states that are accompanied by applied thought—one aggregate …

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca
translated: two aggregates …

original: …pe…. Sahajāto—savitakko eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ vitakkassa
analyzed: pe sahajāta usa vitakkaḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānam vitakkassa
translated: Conascent states that are accompanied by applied thought—one aggregate and the physical basis …🔽two aggregates and the physical basis …

original: ca atthipaccayena paccayo …pe… dve khandhā ca …pe…. (Paṭisandhiyāpi dve.)
analyzed: ca atthi paccayena paccayaḥ pe dve khandhā ca pe paṭisandhiyā api dve
translated: are a condition, as presence condition, for the three aggregates and for applied thought.

original: Natthipaccayena paccayo … vigatapaccayena paccayo … avigatapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: natthi paccayena paccayaḥ vigata paccayena paccayaḥ avigata paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being by way of the condition being a non-existent condition … The condition being by way of the condition being a departed condition … The condition being by way of the condition being a non-departed condition.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Numerals

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava,🔽sahajāte nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava  sahajāte nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: In terms of cause there are four, in terms of object there are nine, in terms of predominance there are nine, in terms of proximity there are nine, in terms of contiguity there are nine,

original: tīṇi, āsevane nava, kamme cattāri, vipāke nava, āhāre cattāri, indriye cattāri, jhāne
analyzed: tīṇi āsevane nava kamme cattāri vipāke nava āhāre cattāri indriye cattāri jhāne
translated: in terms of immediacy there are nine, in terms of repetition there are nine, in terms of kamma there are four, in terms of result there are nine, in terms of nutriment there are four, in terms of faculty there are four,

original: nava, magge nava, sampayutte cha, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava,
analyzed: nava magge nava sampayutte cha vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava
translated: in terms of absorption there are nine, in terms of path there are nine, in terms of association there are six, in terms of dissociation there are five, in terms of presence there are nine, in terms of absence there are nine,

original: vigate nava, avigate nava.
analyzed: vigate nava avigate nava
translated: in terms of disappearance there are nine, in terms of non-disappearance there are nine.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: The forward order.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra🔽Savitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra  sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: The reverse order🔽A thought with applied thought is related to a thought with applied thought by way of the object condition … by way of the condition being together …

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo. Savitakko dhammo
analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sa vitakkaḥ dhammo
translated: by way of the condition being prior … by way of the kamma condition. A thought with applied thought is related to a thought without applied thought …

original: avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo. Savitakko dhammo
analyzed: avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sa vitakkaḥ dhammaḥ
translated: A state that is without thought is a condition, as support condition, for a state that is without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.🔽A state that is without thought is a condition, as kamma condition, for a state that is without thought.🔽A state that is with thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is with thought and is also without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is without thought.

original: savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena  paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is with thought is a condition, as support condition, for a state that is with thought and is also without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is without thought.🔽A state that is with thought is a condition, as kamma condition, for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.🔽A state that is without thought is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.

original: Avitakko dhammo avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena
analyzed: avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena  paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo purejāta paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena
translated: A state that is without thought is a condition, as support condition, for a state that is without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.🔽A state that is without thought is a condition, as prenascence condition, for a state that is without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.🔽A state that is without thought is a condition, as postnascence condition, for a state that is without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.🔽A state that is without thought is a condition, as kamma condition, for a state that is without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.

original: paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.🔽Avitakko dhammo savitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽avitakkaḥ dhammaḥ sa vitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: A state that is without thought is a condition, as nutriment condition, for a state that is without thought … for a state that is with thought … for a state that is with thought and is also without thought.🔽A state that is without thought is a condition, as faculty condition

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo. Avitakko dhammo
analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ avitakkaḥ dhammo
translated: is a condition, as decisive support condition, as pre-arising condition. A state that is without thought🔽is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is with thought and for a state that is without thought. It is a condition, as co-nascence condition,

original: savitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: sa vitakkassa ca avitakkassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: as mutuality condition, as support condition, as association condition, as pre-arising condition, as post-arising condition, as repetition condition, as disappearance condition, as appearance condition, as development condition, as non-disappearance condition, as object of contemplation condition, as non-contemplation condition, as decisive-support condition, as pre-nascence condition.🔽A state that is with thought and a state that is without thought are a condition, as object condition, for a state that is with thought.

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: They are a condition, as co-nascence condition, as mutuality condition, as support condition, as association condition, as pre-arising condition, as post-arising condition, as repetition condition, as disappearance condition, as appearance condition, as development condition, as non-disappearance condition, as decisive-support condition, as pre-nascence condition.

original: Savitakko ca avitakko ca dhammā savitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: sa vitakkaḥ ca avitakkaḥ ca dhammā sa vitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: A state that is with thought and a state that is without thought are a condition, as object condition, for a state that is without thought. They are a condition, as co-nascence condition,

original: … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Savitakko ca avitakko
analyzed: sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ sa vitakko ca avitakko
translated: as mutuality condition, as support condition, as association condition, as pre-arising condition, as post-arising condition, as repetition condition, as disappearance condition, as appearance condition, as development condition, as non-disappearance condition, as decisive-support condition, as pre-nascence condition.

original: ca dhammā avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo
analyzed: ca dhammā avitakkassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sahajāta paccayena paccayo
translated: A state that is with thought and a state that is without thought are a condition, as object condition, for a state that is with thought and for a state that is without thought. They are a condition, as co-nascence condition,

original: paṭicca sappītiko ca appītiko ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ sappītikaṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhañca pītiñca paṭicca tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe🔽ca …pe… ahetukaṁ sappītikaṁ ekaṁ khandhañca pītiñca paṭicca tayo khandhā …pe… dve

translated: With pleasure and without pleasure as conditions, there arises what is not conditionally arisen …🔽With one aggregate and with pleasure as condition, there arise three aggregates and materiality originated by consciousness. … With two aggregates and with pleasure as condition, there arise two aggregates and materiality originated by consciousness. …🔽With one aggregate and with pleasure as condition, there arise three aggregates and consciousness. … With two aggregates and with pleasure as condition, there arise two aggregates and consciousness. …

original: khandhe ca …pe… ahetuke sappītike khandhe ca pītiñca mahābhūte ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: khandhe ca pe ahetuke sappītike khandhe ca pītiñca mahābhūte ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: With the aggregates that are without root-cause and with pleasure as condition, there arises materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on the Modes of Conveying a Numerical Category

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi …pe… naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme cattāri, navipāke
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi pe na upanissaye  tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme cattāri na vipāke
translated: In the mode of “not as condition being nine,” “not as object being three,” “not as predominance being nine,” “not as proximity being three,” … “not as support being three,”🔽“not as prenascence being nine,” “not as postnascence being nine,” “not as nutriment being nine,” “not as kamma being four,” “not as result being nine,”

original: nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge nava, nasampayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge nava na sampayutte tīṇi
translated: “not as nutriment being one,” “not as faculty being one,” “not as jhāna being one,” “not as path being nine,” “not as association being three,”

original: navippayutte cha, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na vippayutte cha no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: “not as dissociation being six,” “not as presence being three,” “not as absence being three.”

original: 2.13.7.2. Sahajātavāra
analyzed: sahajātavāra
translated: The Section on Conascence

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sahajātavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.7.3.1–4 Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sahajāta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ  paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: The following should be done:🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of root-condition.

original: Sappītikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sappītiko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: sa ppītikam dhammam paccayā sa ppītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of object-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of predominance-condition.

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava pe avigate nava
translated: With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-disappearance-condition.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: The following should be done:🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-root-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-object-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-predominance-condition.

original: Sappītikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sappītiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā … tīṇi. (Paṭiccasadisā.)
analyzed: sa ppītikam dhammam paccayā sa ppītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā tīṇi paṭicca sadisā
translated: With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-disappearance-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-root-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-object-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-predominance-condition.

original: Appītikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā appītiko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Pavattipaṭisandhi🔽kātabbā paṭiccavārasadisā, yāva asaññasattā.) Cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ
analyzed: appītikam dhammam paccayā appītikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā pavatti paṭisandhi  kātabbā paṭiccavāra sadisā yāva asañña sattā cakkha āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa
translated: With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-disappearance-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-root-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-object-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-predominance-condition.

original: …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā ahetukā appītikā khandhā pīti
analyzed: pe kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā ahetukāḥ appītikā khandhāḥ pīti
translated: With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-disappearance-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-root-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-object-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-predominance-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-disappearance-condition.

original: ca, vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā vicikicchāsahagato
analyzed: ca vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ
translated: With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-root-condition.🔽With a profitable idea as condition, a profitable idea arises, by way of non-object-condition.

original: uddhaccasahagato moho. (Anulomasadisā nava pañhā, pavattiyeva paṭisandhi natthi, ekoyeva moho.)🔽Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi …pe… naupanissaye
analyzed: uddhacca sahagataḥ mohaḥ anuloma sadisāḥ nava pañhā pavattiyā iva paṭisandhi natthi ekaḥ yā iva moho  na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi pe na upanissaye
translated: Delusion associated with restlessness. (Nine questions as in the Direction, but there is no rebirth-linking, only one kind of delusion.)🔽With non-cause as condition, three. With non-object as condition, three. With non-predominance as condition, nine. With non-antecedent as condition, three. … With non-decisive-support as condition, three.🔽With non-pre-nascence as condition, nine. With non-post-nascence as condition, nine. With non-nutritive-essence as condition, nine. With non-kamma as condition, nine. With non-result as condition, nine.

original: tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme nava, navipāke🔽nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge nava, nasampayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme nava na vipāke  nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge nava na sampayutte tīṇi
translated: With non-food as condition, one. With non-faculty as condition, one. With non-path as condition, one. With non-association as condition, three.

original: navippayutte cha, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na vippayutte cha no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: With non-dissociation as condition, six. With non-presence as condition, three. With non-conascence as condition, three.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: The reverse order.

original: 2.13.7.4. Nissayavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāra
