translated: The other two ways of counting and the section on dependence should be done in the same way.🔽The Associated Mode

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: … with a profitable idea as object a profitable idea associated with pleasure arises by means of the cause condition … with a profitable idea as object a profitable idea associated with pleasure arises by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely, by means of the cause condition, … by means of the object condition, … by means of the six conditions, namely,

original: Nahetuyā cha, naadhipatiyā cha, napurejāte cha, napacchājāte cha, naāsevane cha, nakamme cattāri, navipāke cha, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge cha, navippayutte cha.
analyzed: na hetuyā cha na adhipatiyā cha na purejāte cha na pacchājāte cha na āsevane cha na kamme cattāri na vipāke cha na jhāne eka na magge cha na vippayutte cha
translated: With no cause as condition, there are six. With no predominance, there are six. With no prior condition, there are six. With no post-condition, there are six. With no repetition, there are six. With no kamma, there are four. With no kamma-result, there are six. With no jhāna, there is one. With no path, there are six. With no non-causality, there are six.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: The reverse order.

original: 2.13.7.6. Sampayuttavāra
translated: The Section on Conjoined

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.7.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ  pañhāvāra
translated: The other two enumerations and the section on conjoined should be done in the same way.🔽The Section on Questions🔽The Section on Conditions in Direct Order, etc.

original: 2.13.7.7.1–4. Paccayānulomādi🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Section on Analysis

original: Hetu🔽Sappītiko dhammo sappītikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—sappītikā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Sappītiko dhammo appītikassa🔽dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—sappītikā hetū pītiyā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ
analyzed: hetu  sappītikaḥ dhammaḥ sappītikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo sappītikāḥ hetū  khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe sa pītikaḥ dhammaḥ appītikassa  dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayosappītikāḥ hetū pītiyā ca citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ
translated: Cause

original: hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Sappītikā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe mūlam kātabba sappītikā hetū sampayuttakāna
translated: A cause that is accompanied by pleasure is a condition, as a cause condition, for a dhamma that is accompanied by pleasure. The causes that are accompanied by pleasure are a condition, as a cause condition, for the aggregates that are accompanied by pleasure. At the moment of rebirth-linking … (as in the preceding section) … A cause that is accompanied by pleasure is a condition, as a cause condition, for a dhamma that is not accompanied by pleasure. The causes that are accompanied by pleasure are a condition, as a cause condition, for the pleasure and for the materiality originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking … (as in the preceding section) … The causes that are accompanied by pleasure are a condition, as a cause condition, for the aggregates that are not accompanied by pleasure.

original: khandhānaṁ pītiyā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: khandhānam pītiyā ca citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: A state without joy is a condition, as root condition, for the joy and for the materiality originated by consciousness.🔽A state without joy is a condition, as root condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Appītiko dhammo appītikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—appītikā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Ārammaṇa
analyzed: appītikaḥ dhammaḥ appītikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ appītikāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  ārammaṇa
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Sappītiko dhammo sappītikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—sappītike khandhe🔽ārabbha sappītikā khandhā uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Sappītike khandhe ārabbha🔽appītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Sappītike khandhe ārabbha
analyzed: sa ppītikaḥ dhammaḥ sa ppītikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sappītike khandhe  ārabbha sappītikāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti mūlam kātabba sappītike khandhe ārabbha  appītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti mūlam kātabba sappītike khandhe ārabbha
translated: A state with joy is a condition, as object condition, for a state with joy. With a state with joy as object, states with joy arise.🔽With a state with joy as object, states without joy arise.

original: sappītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: sappītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti
translated: With a state with joy as object, states with joy and states without joy arise.

original: Appītiko dhammo appītikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—appītikena cittena
analyzed: appītikaḥ dhammaḥ appītikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ appītikena cittena
translated: A state without joy is a condition, as object condition, for a state without joy. With a state without joy as object,🔽states without joy arise.🔽With a state without joy as object, states with joy arise.🔽With a state without joy as object, states with joy and states without joy arise.

original: dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā appītikena cittena paccavekkhati, assādeti
analyzed: dānam datvā sīlam pe uposatha kammam katvā appītikena cittena paccavekkhati assādeti
translated: Having given a gift and observed morality … and performed the Uposatha … he reviews it with a sense of the uninspiring.

original: abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha appītiko rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, vicikicchā uppajjati,🔽uddhaccaṁ uppajjati, domanassaṁ uppajjati; appītikā jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… maggā
analyzed: abhinandati tam ārabbha appītikaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati vicikicchā uppajjati  uddhaccam uppajjati domanassam uppajjati appītikāḥ jhānāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā pe maggāḥ
translated: Delight arises in him in dependence on that, and greed, view, doubt,🔽agitation, and grief arise. Having emerged from the uninspiring jhāna …🔽Having emerged from the path … Having emerged from fruition, he reviews the fruition with a sense of the uninspiring. Noble

original: vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… phalā vuṭṭhahitvā appītikena cittena phalaṁ paccavekkhati, ariyā🔽appītikena cittena nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ appītikassa gotrabhussa, vodānassa,

translated: ones review Nibbāna with a sense of the uninspiring. Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the uninspiring noble identity, for the uninspiring change-of-lineage,

analyzed: appītike khandhe ca pītiñca ārabbha sappītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti
translated: With regard to the pleasant aggregates and to happiness, the pleasant aggregates and happiness arise.

original: Sappītiko ca appītiko ca dhammā sappītikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—sappītike
analyzed: sappītikaḥ ca appītikaḥ ca dhammā sappītikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo sappītike
translated: A pleasant and an unpleasant condition is a condition, as object condition, for a pleasant condition.

original: khandhe ca pītiñca ārabbha sappītikā khandhā uppajjanti. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Sappītike
analyzed: khandhe ca pītiñca ārabbha sa pītikāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti mūlam kātabba sa pītike
translated: With regard to the pleasant aggregates and to happiness, the pleasant aggregates arise. (The rest should be elaborated as in the preceding condition.)

original: khandhe ca pītiñca ārabbha appītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: khandhe ca pītiñca ārabbha appītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti
translated: With regard to the pleasant aggregates and to happiness, the unpleasant aggregates arise.

original: (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Sappītike khandhe ca pītiñca ārabbha sappītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti.
analyzed: mūlam kātabba sappītike khandhe ca pītiñca ārabbha sappītikā khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti
translated: (The rest should be elaborated as in the preceding condition.) With regard to the pleasant aggregates and to happiness, the pleasant aggregates and happiness arise.

original: Adhipati🔽Sappītiko dhammo sappītikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—sappītike khandhe garuṁ katvā sappītikā khandhā
analyzed: adhipati  sa ppītikaḥ dhammaḥ sa ppītikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati sappītike khandhe garum katvā sappītikā khandhā
translated: Dominant🔽A pleasant condition is a condition, as dominant condition, for a pleasant condition. As object-predominant condition,🔽as co-nascent-predominant condition. As object-predominant condition, with regard to the pleasant aggregates, the pleasant aggregates arise.

original: uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—sappītikādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati sappītika adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As co-nascent-predominant condition, the pleasant predominant faculties are a condition, as dominant condition, for the associated aggregates.

original: Sappītiko dhammo appītikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,🔽sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—sappītike khandhe garuṁ katvā appītikā khandhā ca
analyzed: sa ppītikaḥ dhammaḥ appītikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati sappītike khandhe garum katvā appītikā khandhā ca
translated: A state with joy is a condition, as dominance condition, for a state without joy.🔽Dominance as object and dominance as co-nascence. As object: Having made the aggregates with joy weighty, the aggregates without joy …

original: pīti ca uppajjanti. analyzed: pīti ca uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati sappītika adhipati pītiyā ca citta samuṭṭhānānam ca  rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  sappītikaḥ dhammaḥ sappītikassa ca appītikassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati  sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati sappītike khandhe garum katvā sappītikā khandhā
translated: A state with happiness is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state without happiness. As object-dominant condition and as co-nascent dominant condition. As object-dominant condition, the five aggregates with happiness are a condition, as dominant condition, for the aggregates without happiness and for happiness. As co-nascent dominant condition, the dominant influence of the aggregates with happiness is a condition, as dominant condition, for happiness and for the kinds of materiality derived by clinging.

original: ca pīti ca uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—sappītikādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽pītiyā ca cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.

translated: A state with happiness is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state with happiness and for a state without happiness. As object-dominant condition and as co-nascent dominant condition. As object-dominant condition, the five aggregates with happiness are a condition, as dominant condition, for the aggregates with happiness and for happiness. As co-nascent dominant condition, the dominant influence of the aggregates with happiness is a condition, as dominant condition, for the associated aggregates and for happiness and for the kinds of materiality derived by clinging.

original: Appītiko dhammo appītikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: appītikaḥ dhammaḥ appītikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A state without happiness is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state without happiness. As object-dominant condition and as co-nascent dominant condition.

original: khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti. Sahajātādhipati—appītikādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: khandhā ca pīti ca uppajjanti sahajāta adhipati appītika adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam
translated: and the aggregates of feeling and perception and the aggregates of form that arise together with them.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is a condition in the way stated.🔽A state that is without happiness is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a state that is with happiness.

original: Appītiko dhammo sappītikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—appītikena🔽cittena dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ …pe… (saṅkhittaṁ) nibbānaṁ sappītikassa
analyzed: appītikaḥ dhammaḥ sa ppītikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati appītikena  cittena dānam pe sīlam pe uposatha kammam pe saṅkhitta nibbānam sappītikassa
translated: The condition being by way of object predominance condition is a state that is without happiness is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for a state that is with happiness.

original: gotrabhussa, vodānassa, maggassa, phalassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe…🔽vatthuṁ appītike khandhe ca pītiñca sappītikena cittena garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: gotrabhussa vodānassa maggassa phalassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe  vatthum appītike khandhe ca pītiñca sappītikena cittena garum katvā assādeti abhinandati
translated: The condition being by way of object predominance condition is a state that is without happiness is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the change-of-lineage, for the path, for the fruit, for Nibbāna.🔽The eye …🔽The condition being by way of object predominance condition is a state that is without happiness is a condition, by way of predominance condition, for the aggregates that are with happiness that arise together with the eye, and for the form that arises together with the mind.

original: taṁ garuṁ katvā sappītiko rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati; appītike khandhe ca pītiñca
analyzed: tam garum katvā sappītikaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati appītike khandhe ca pītiṃ ca
translated: Having made much of the aggregates that are without happiness and of happiness, he delights in them, welcomes them, and remains holding to them.

original: garuṁ katvā sappītikā khandhā uppajjanti.
analyzed: garum katvā sappītikāḥ khandhāḥ uppajjanti
translated: Because of making much of them, the happiness that is with happiness arises, and view arises.🔽The aggregates that are with happiness arise together with the aggregates that are without happiness and with happiness.

original: Appītiko dhammo sappītikassa ca appītikassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ …pe… (saṅkhittaṁ) nibbānaṁ sappītikassa gotrabhussa, vodānassa,
analyzed: appītikaḥ dhammaḥ sappītikassa ca appītikassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  ārammaṇa adhipati dānam pe saṅkhitta nibbānam sappītikassa gotrabhussa vodānassa
translated: A state that is accompanied by happiness is a condition, as dominant condition, for a state that is accompanied by happiness and for a state that is not accompanied by happiness.

translated: As a prior condition

analyzed: pe vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa
translated: A non-pleasant state is a condition, as a prior condition, for a non-pleasant state: as the object condition and as the support condition. As the object condition: When someone contemplates as impermanent, … as painful, … as not self, the unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body, and on that basis equanimity arises, … lust … hate … delusion … fear arises, and he is gladdened, delighted, and satisfied by that, then the unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body is a condition, as the object condition, for the unarisen unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body arising, and, when arisen, for its maintenance, non-confusion, non-disappearance, increase, expansion, and fulfillment. When someone contemplates the unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body, and on that basis equanimity arises, … lust … hate … delusion … fear arises, and he is gladdened, delighted, and satisfied by that, then the unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body is a condition, as the object condition, for the unarisen unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body arising, and, when arisen, for its maintenance, non-confusion, non-disappearance, increase, expansion, and fulfillment. When someone contemplates the unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body, and on that basis equanimity arises, … lust … hate … delusion … fear arises, and he is gladdened, delighted, and satisfied by that, then the unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body is a condition, as the object condition, for the unarisen unattractiveness of, the unattractive things in, or the sign of the unattractive things in the body arising,

original: …pe… vatthu appītikānaṁ khandhānaṁ pītiyā ca purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe vatthu appītikānam khandhānam pītiyā ca purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: …pe… the basis of the pleasant is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant and for the faculties of pleasure and joy.

original: Appītiko dhammo sappītikassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,
analyzed: appītikaḥ dhammaḥ sappītikassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta
translated: A condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant: the prenascent object condition,

original: vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ sappītikena cittena aniccato🔽…pe… vipassati, assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha sappītiko rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi
analyzed: vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum sappītikena cittena aniccato  pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha sa pītikaḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi
translated: the prenascent basis condition. The prenascent object condition: the eye sense sphere … the mind sense sphere is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant and for the faculties of pleasure and joy.

original: uppajjati. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu sappītikānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppajjati vatthu purejāta vatthu sappītikānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The prenascent basis condition: the basis of the pleasant is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant faculties.

original: Appītiko dhammo sappītikassa ca appītikassa ca dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ sappītikena cittena aniccato
analyzed: appītikaḥ dhammaḥ sappītikassa ca appītikassa ca dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum sappītikena cittena aniccato
translated: A condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant and the unpleasant: the prenascent object condition,🔽the prenascent basis condition. The prenascent object condition: the eye sense sphere … the mind sense sphere is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant and for the faculties of pleasure and joy.

original: …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha pīti ca sampayuttakā khandhā ca
analyzed: pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha pīti ca sampayuttakā khandhā ca
translated: …pe… the mind sense sphere is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the unpleasant and for the faculties of pain and grief.🔽The prenascent basis condition: the basis of the pleasant is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the unpleasant faculties.🔽The prenascent basis condition: the basis of the unpleasant is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant faculties.🔽The prenascent basis condition: the basis of the unpleasant is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the pleasant and for the faculties of pleasure and joy.

analyzed: uppajjanti vatthu purejāta vatthu sappītikānam khandhānam pītiyā ca purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The physical basis is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the pleasant-feeling aggregates and for pleasant feeling.

analyzed: pacchājāta ādi  sappītikaḥ dhammaḥ appītikassa dhammassa pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi āsevana paccayena  paccayaḥ nava kamma paccayena paccayaḥ cha sahajātā api nānākkhaṇikā api kātabbā  dve nānākkhaṇikā vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ nava āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri  indriya paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ nava magga paccayena

translated: A pleasant feeling is a condition, as post-nascence condition, for three … as repetition condition … for nine … as kamma condition … for six (as conascence and as post-nascence, and as kammas of different moments) … as kamma-result condition … for nine … as nutriment condition … for four … as faculty condition … for four … as jhāna condition … for nine … as path condition … for four … as association condition … for six … as non-disappearance condition … for nine … as disappearance condition … as non-disappearance condition … for nine.

analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha

analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte

analyzed: tīṇi āsevane nava kamme cha vipāke nava āhāre cattāri indriye cattāri jhāne

analyzed: nava magge cattāri sampayutte cha vippayutte pañca atthiyā nava natthiyā nava

The death consciousness accompanied by pleasure🔽is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the rebirth-linking consciousness accompanied by pleasure … The life-continuum accompanied by pleasure🔽is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the adverting … The resultant body-consciousness accompanied by pleasure🔽is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the resultant mind element … The resultant mind-consciousness element accompanied by pleasure

original: … sukhasahagataṁ bhavaṅgaṁ nasukhasahagatassa bhavaṅgassa … sukhasahagataṁ kusalākusalaṁ🔽nasukhasahagatassa vuṭṭhānassa … kiriyaṁ vuṭṭhānassa … phalaṁ vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena🔽paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Purimā purimā sukhasahagatā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ

translated: is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the functional mind-consciousness element … The life-continuum accompanied by pleasure🔽is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the life-continuum not accompanied by pleasure … The wholesome and functional consciousness accompanied by pleasure

original: sukhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ sukhassa ca anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sukha sahagatānam khandhānam sukhassa ca anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the arising of the unwholesome and functional consciousness not accompanied by pleasure … The functional consciousness is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the arising of the resultant consciousness … The functional consciousness is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the arising of the fruition consciousness. The immediately preceding condition should be quoted in detail. The earlier and earlier pleasant aggregates are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the later and later pleasant aggregates and for pleasure.

original: Nasukhasahagato dhammo nasukhasahagatassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo— purimā purimā nasukhasahagatā …pe….
analyzed: na sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ na sukha sahagatassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimā purimā na sukha sahagatā pe
translated: A state that is associated with displeasure is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is associated with displeasure. The earlier … are an immediately preceding condition for the later …

original: Sukhasahagato ca nasukhasahagato ca dhammā sukhasahagatassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena🔽paccayo—purimā purimā sukhasahagatā khandhā ca sukhañca pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ sukhasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Purimā purimā sukhasahagatā

translated: A state that is not accompanied by pleasure is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is not accompanied by pleasure. The former … are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the latter …🔽A state that is accompanied by pleasure and a state that is not accompanied by pleasure are an immediately preceding condition for a state that is accompanied by pleasure. analyzed: musā pe pisuṇam pe sampham pe sandhim pe nillopam pe ekāgārikam pe paripanthe
translated: or through the support of the state of being

original: …pe… paradāraṁ …pe… gāmaghātaṁ …pe… nigamaghātaṁ karoti; nasukhasahagatā saddhā …pe…
analyzed: pe paradāram pe gāma ghātam pe nigama ghātam karoti na sukha sahagatā saddhā pe

original: senāsanaṁ sukhañca sukhasahagatāya saddhāya …pe… paññāya … rāgassa … mānassa … diṭṭhiyā
analyzed: senāsanam sukham ca sukha sahagatāya saddhāya pe paññāya rāgassa mānassa diṭṭhiyā
translated: a dwelling place is a condition, as a support condition, for the faith associated with pleasure … for understanding … for greed … for conceit … for a view …

original: … patthanāya … kāyikassa sukhassa … maggassa phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: patthanāya kāyikassa sukhassa maggassa phala samāpattiyāḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … for longing … for bodily pleasure … for the path … for attainment of the fruit, as a support condition.

original: Nasukhasahagato dhammo sukhasahagatassa ca nasukhasahagatassa ca dhammassa upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: na sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa ca na sukha sahagatassa ca dhammassa upanissaya paccayena
translated: A wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling is a condition, as a support condition, for a wholesome thought associated with pleasure and for a wholesome thought associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling,

original: paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—nasukhasahagataṁ
analyzed: paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ na sukha sahagata
translated: as a support condition, as a prenascent support condition, as a postnascent support condition, as a prenascent and postnascent support condition, as a natural support condition … as a natural support condition:

original: saddhaṁ upanissāya sukhasahagatena cittena dānaṁ deti …pe… (dutiyagamanasadisaṁ)
analyzed: saddham upanissāya sukha sahagatena cittena dānam deti pe dutiya gamana sadisa
translated: having relied on the faith associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, one gives a gift … (as in the second section of the first chapter) …🔽one recites the scriptures. Having relied on the conceit associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, one gives a gift … (as in the second section of the first chapter) …

original: mānaṁ jappeti, diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti; nasukhasahagataṁ sīlaṁ …pe… senāsanaṁ sukhaṁ upanissāya
analyzed: mānam jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti na sukha sahagatam sīlam pe senāsanam sukham upanissāya
translated: one recites the scriptures. Having relied on virtue … a dwelling place associated with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling, one gives a gift … (as in the second section of the first chapter) …

original: dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ uppādeti, sukhasahagatena cittena adinnaṁ ādiyati …pe…
analyzed: dānam deti pe samāpattim uppādeti sukha sahagatena cittena adinnam ādiyati pe
translated: He gives a gift … He resolves … He generates a mind-made image … He takes what is not given …

original: nasukhasahagatā saddhā …pe… senāsanaṁ sukhañca sukhasahagatāya … saddhāya …pe… patthanāya
analyzed: na sukha sahagatā saddhā pe senāsanam sukham ca sukha sahagatāya saddhāya pe patthanāya
translated: Faith, etc., that are not associated with pleasure are a condition, as decisive support condition, for a dwelling that is pleasant and for faith, etc., that are associated with pleasure.

original: … kāyikassa sukhassa, maggassa, phalasamāpattiyā sukhassa ca upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kāyikassa sukhassa maggassa phala samāpattiyā sukhassa ca upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … for bodily pleasure, for the path, and for the pleasant fruition attainment.

original: Sukhasahagato ca nasukhasahagato ca dhammā sukhasahagatassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: sukha sahagataḥ ca na sukha sahagataḥ ca dhammā sukha sahagatassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: And states that are associated with pleasure and states that are not associated with pleasure are a condition, as decisive support condition, for three kinds of pleasure.

original: Purejātādi🔽Nasukhasahagato dhammo nasukhasahagatassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,
analyzed: purejāta ādi  na sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ na sukha sahagatassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta
translated: Prior and so on

original: vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ nasukhasahagatena cittena
analyzed: vatthu purejāte ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum na sukha sahagatena cittena
translated: A state not associated with pleasure is a condition, as prior condition, for a state not associated with pleasure. Herein, as object condition: Eye is as condition for the states not associated with pleasure that are dependent on it, as object condition. … The physical basis is as condition for the states not associated with pleasure that are dependent on it, as object condition.🔽When someone contemplates as impermanent … as not self, he relishes it, desires it, and welcomes it. Then greed arises in him.

original: aniccato …pe… vipassati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha nasukhasahagato rāgo uppajjati
analyzed: aniccataḥ pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha na sukha sahagataḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: he contemplates as impermanent, as suffering, as nonself, as unattractive, as a disease, as a tumour, as a dart, as a calamity, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as a plague, as an obstruction, as empty, as nonself. He becomes dispassionate towards it, not delighting in it. He turns his mind away from it, not directing it towards it. He abandons his attachment to it, not grasping it.🔽As he does so, lust does not arise in him.🔽

original: …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati, sukhaṁ uppajjati, dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati …pe…
analyzed: pe domanassam uppajjati sukham uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati pe
translated: … and joy arises … and pleasure arises … and he sees a form with the divine eye …🔽The tangible-object element is a condition, as prenascence condition, for body-consciousness …

original: phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe…. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu purejāta cakkhu āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: The eye element is a condition, as prenascence condition, for eye-consciousness …🔽… for the pleasant aggregates …

original: …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… vatthu nasukhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ sukhassa
analyzed: pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu na sukha sahagatānam khandhānam sukhassa
translated: A phenomenon that is not associated with pleasure is a condition, as prenascence condition, for a phenomenon that is associated with pleasure. Prenascence condition means:

original: ca purejātapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nasukhasahagato dhammo sukhasahagatassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ sukhasahagatena cittena aniccato🔽…pe… vipassati, assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha sukhasahagato rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi
analyzed: ca purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ  na sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum sukha sahagatena cittena aniccato  pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha sukha sahagataḥ rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi
translated: as object prenascence condition,🔽as physical basis prenascence condition. As object prenascence condition means: Eye … physical basis … he reflects on the impermanence of the physical basis with a pleasant consciousness …

original: uppajjati. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu sukhasahagatānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: uppajjati vatthu purejāta vatthu sukha sahagatānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … he reflects on the impermanence of the physical basis with a pleasant consciousness, he approves, he relishes, he desires, and because of that greed arises, view arises. As physical basis prenascence condition means: The physical basis is a condition, as prenascence condition, for the pleasant aggregates.

original: Nasukhasahagato dhammo sukhasahagatassa ca nasukhasahagatassa ca dhammassa purejātapaccayena
analyzed: na sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa ca na sukha sahagatassa ca dhammassa purejāta paccayena
translated: A state that is not accompanied by pleasure is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for a state that is accompanied by pleasure and for a state that is not accompanied by pleasure.

original: paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ, vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ🔽sukhasahagatena cittena aniccato …pe… vipassati, assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha🔽sukhañca sampayuttakā khandhā ca uppajjanti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu sukhasahagatānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ sukhassa ca purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayo ārammaṇa purejāta vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthu  sukha sahagatena cittena aniccataḥ pe vipassati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha  sukham ca sampayuttakā khandhā ca uppajjanti vatthu purejāta vatthu  khandhānam sukhassa ca purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: As the object condition and as the support condition. As the object condition: the eye is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the materiality that is its result and for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure.

original: Pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi … āsevanapaccayena paccayo … nava.🔽Kammādi
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ nava  kamma ādi
translated: As the support condition: the eye is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure. As the object condition: the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the materiality that is its result and for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure.

original: Sukhasahagato dhammo sukhasahagatassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo— sahajātā,🔽nānākkhaṇikā. (Cha kammāni cattāri sahajātāpi nānākkhaṇikāpi kātabbā, dve nānākkhaṇikā.)
analyzed: sukha sahagataḥ dhammaḥ sukha sahagatassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ sahajātā 🔽nānākkhaṇikā cha kammāni cattāri sahajātā api nānākkhaṇikā api kātabbā dve nānākkhaṇikā
translated: As the support condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the mind element and for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure. As the object condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure.🔽As the support condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the mind-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure. As the object condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure.🔽As the object condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure. As the support condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure. As the object condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure. As the support condition: a mental object is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the states associated therewith that are accompanied by pleasure. original: Vipākapaccayena paccayo … nava … āhārapaccayena paccayo … cattāri … indriyapaccayena
analyzed: vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ nava āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri indriya paccayena
translated: Condition by way of nutriment condition: four …🔽Condition by way of faculty condition:

original: paccayo … nava … jhānapaccayena paccayo … nava … maggapaccayena paccayo … cattāri
analyzed: paccayaḥ nava jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ nava magga paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: nine … Condition by way of absorption condition: nine … Condition by way of path condition: four …

original: … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … cha … vippayuttapaccayena paccayo … pañca … atthipaccayena🔽paccayo … nava … natthipaccayena paccayo … nava … vigatapaccayena paccayo … nava
analyzed: sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ cha vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ pañca atthi paccayena  paccayaḥ nava natthi paccayena paccayaḥ nava vigata paccayena paccayaḥ nava
translated: Condition by way of association condition: six … Condition by way of dissociation condition: five … Condition by way of presence condition:🔽nine … Condition by way of absence condition: nine … Condition by way of disappearance condition: nine …🔽Condition by way of non-disappearance condition: nine.

original: … avigatapaccayena paccayo … nava.🔽2.13.9.7.1. Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: avigata paccayena paccayaḥ nava  paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: ..... Conditions in forward order, etc.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on numbers

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: Pure

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe nava, adhipatiyā nava, anantare nava, samanantare nava,🔽sahajāte nava, aññamaññe nava, nissaye nava, upanissaye nava, purejāte tīṇi, pacchājāte
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe nava adhipatiyā nava anantare nava samanantare nava  sahajāte nava aññamaññe nava nissaye nava upanissaye nava purejāte tīṇi pacchājāte
translated: With respect to cause there are four, with respect to object there are nine, with respect to predominance there are nine, with respect to proximity there are nine, with respect to contiguity there are nine,🔽with respect to arising together there are nine, with respect to presence there are nine, with respect to non-disappearance there are nine, with respect to disappearance there are nine,

original: tīṇi, āsevane nava, kamme cha, vipāke nava, āhāre cattāri, indriye nava, jhāne nava,
analyzed: tīṇi āsevane nava kamme cha vipāke nava āhāre cattāri indriye nava jhāne nava
translated: with respect to arising before there are three, with respect to arising after there are three, with respect to arising together there are nine, with respect to kamma there are six, with respect to result there are nine, with respect to nutriment there are four, with respect to faculty there are nine, with respect to absorption there are nine,

original: magge cattāri, sampayutte cha, vippayutte pañca, atthiyā nava, natthiyā nava, vigate nava, avigate nava.
analyzed: magge cattāri sampayutte cha vippayutte pañca atthiyāḥ nava natthiyāḥ nava vigate nava avigate nava
translated: there are four in the path, six in the associated, five in the dissociated, nine in the present, nine in the past and future, nine in the unarisen, nine in the already arisen, nine in the deciduous, and nine in the indecisive.

original: (Evaṁ paccanīyavibhaṅgopi gaṇanāpi sappītikadukasadisaṁ kātabbaṁ, yadipi vimati atthi anulomaṁ passitvā gaṇetabbaṁ.)
analyzed: evam paccanīya vibhaṅgaḥ api gaṇanā api sappītika duka sadisam yadi api atthi anulomam passitvā gaṇetabba
translated: (The reverse order and the calculation should be done in the same way as the triad with happiness, only the pervasion is different. If there is doubt, it should be calculated after seeing the direct order.)

original: Sukhasahagatadukaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: sukha sahagata dukam
translated: The triad with happiness is finished.🔽The triad with equanimity

analyzed: upekkhā sahagata duka  paṭiccavāra
translated: The section on conditions🔽The section on conditions in direct order

original: 2.13.10.1.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The section on analysis

original: Hetu🔽Upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— upekkhāsahagataṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… upekkhāsahagataṁ🔽dhammaṁ paṭicca naupekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—upekkhāsahagate khandhe
analyzed: hetu  upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā upekkhā sahagata  ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe upekkhā sahagata  dhammam paṭicca na upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā upekkhā sahagate khandhe
translated: Cause🔽With equanimity as condition, a state with equanimity arises: with equanimity as condition, the two aggregates, with the mental-data aggregate as a condition, the four great elementals, with the mental-data aggregate as condition, the two great elementals, with the mental-data aggregate as condition, the three aggregates, with the mental-data aggregate as condition, the two aggregates. At the mind’s rebirth-linking, with the mental-data aggregate as condition, the two aggregates, with the mental-data aggregate as condition, the three aggregates, with the mental-data aggregate as condition, the four aggregates.

original: paṭicca upekkhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Upekkhāsahagataṁ
analyzed: paṭicca upekkhā citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe upekkhā sahagata
translated: With a state with equanimity as condition, a state without equanimity arises: with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the four great elementals, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the two great elementals, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the mind element, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the mind-consciousness element, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the four aggregates, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the three aggregates, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the two aggregates. At the mind’s rebirth-linking, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the four aggregates, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the three aggregates, with the aggregates with equanimity as condition, the two aggregates.

original: dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato ca naupekkhāsahagato ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā—
analyzed: dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ ca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome root as condition: a wholesome thought-arisings and a resultant thought-arising arise.🔽With a wholesome thought-arising as condition: a resultant thought-arising and a functional thought-arising arise.🔽With a resultant thought-arising as condition: a resultant thought-arising and a functional thought-arising arise.🔽With a functional thought-arising as condition: a functional thought-arising arises.

original: upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā upekkhā ca cittasamuṭṭhānañca🔽rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhāḥ upekkhā ca citta samuṭṭhānam ca  rūpa dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: With a wholesome thought-arising as condition: a wholesome thought-arising and a resultant thought-arising arise.🔽With a wholesome thought-arising as condition: a wholesome thought-arising and a functional thought-arising arise.🔽With a wholesome thought-arising as condition: a wholesome thought-arising, a resultant thought-arising, and a functional thought-arising arise.🔽With a resultant thought-arising as condition: a resultant thought-arising and a functional thought-arising arise.

original: Naupekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naupekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—naupekkhāsahagataṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe…🔽upekkhaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe naupekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ
analyzed: na aupekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na aupekkhā sahagata  ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe  upekkham paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhikkhaṇe na aupekkhā sahagatam eka
translated: With a resultant thought-arising as condition: a resultant thought-arising and a functional thought-arising arise.

original: khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: With a resultant thought-arising as condition: a resultant thought-arising, a wholesome thought-arising, and a functional thought-arising arise.🔽With a functional thought-arising as condition: a functional thought-arising arises.🔽With a functional thought-arising as condition: a functional thought-arising and a resultant thought-arising arise.

original: upekkhaṁ paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, khandhe paṭicca vatthu, vatthuṁ paṭicca khandhā, upekkhaṁ
analyzed: upekkham paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa khandhe paṭicca vatthu vatthum paṭicca khandhāḥ upekkha
translated: With a functional thought-arising as condition: a functional thought-arising, a wholesome thought-arising, and a resultant thought-arising arise.

original: paṭicca vatthu, vatthuṁ paṭicca upekkhā, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe…. (Sappītikadukasadisaṁ,
analyzed: paṭicca vatthu vatthum paṭicca upekkhā ekam mahābhūtam pe

translated: With the aggregates that are associated with doubt and with the aggregates that are associated with agitation …

analyzed: mohaḥ upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuke
translated: With the delusion that is associated with doubt and with the delusion that is associated with agitation. With a factor with equanimity as condition there arises a factor without equanimity that is without root cause.

original: …pe…. Upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato ca naupekkhāsahagato ca dhammā🔽uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca dve khandhā
analyzed: pe upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ ca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ ca dhammā  uppajjanti na hetu paccayā ahetukam upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandham paṭicca dve khandhā

analyzed: upekkhā ca citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpa dve khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  na aupekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca na upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka  na aupekkhā sahagatam ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānam ca rūpam pe
translated: … With an equanimity-unrelated thought as condition, an equanimity-unrelated thought …🔽… At the linking of conception …🔽… With an equanimity-unrelated thought as condition, the form that is mind-created and is related to equanimity …

original: dve khandhe …pe… ahetukaṁ upekkhaṁ paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe

analyzed: pe upekkham paṭicca vatthu vatthum paṭicca upekkhā ekam mahābhūtam pe yāva asaññasattā
translated: … equanimity … the great primaries … (up to) … the non-percipient beings.🔽With an object not associated with equanimity, an object not associated with equanimity arises with non-root-cause condition: with a root-cause-free

original: Naupekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ🔽upekkhaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā🔽khandhā; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagatā khandhā; vicikicchāsahagataṁ🔽uddhaccasahagataṁ upekkhaṁ paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.🔽Naupekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato ca naupekkhāsahagato ca dhammā
analyzed: na upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka  upekkham paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkham paṭicca sampayuttakā  khandhāḥ ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe vatthum paṭicca upekkhā sahagatā khandhā vicikicchā sahagata  uddhacca sahagatam upekkham paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho  na aupekkhā sahagatam dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ ca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ ca dhammā
translated: equanimity associated with the aggregates, at the time of rebirth-linking, with equanimity associated with the aggregates, at the time of rebirth-linking, with an object associated with the aggregates, with the aggregates associated with equanimity, with doubt associated with equanimity, with delusion associated with agitation and equanimity.🔽With an object not associated with equanimity, an object associated with equanimity and an object not associated with equanimity arise with non-root-cause condition: with a root-cause-free

original: uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ upekkhaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca
analyzed: uppajjanti na hetu paccayā ahetukam upekkham paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānam ca
translated: equanimity associated with the aggregates, and with the mind element and mind-consciousness element associated with equanimity, with the four immaterial aggregates and with materiality originated by consciousness, at the time of rebirth-linking, with the four immaterial aggregates and with materiality originated by consciousness, at the time of rebirth-linking, with an object associated with the aggregates, with the aggregates associated with equanimity, with the four immaterial aggregates and with materiality originated by consciousness, at the time of rebirth-linking, with doubt associated with equanimity, with the four immaterial aggregates and with materiality originated by consciousness, at the time of rebirth-linking, with delusion associated with agitation and equanimity, with the four immaterial aggregates and with materiality originated by consciousness, at the time of rebirth-linking.

original: rūpaṁ, ahetukaṁ upekkhaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā, mahābhūte paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ🔽rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ,🔽ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhaṁ paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā, mahābhūte paṭicca
analyzed: rūpa ahetukam upekkham paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte paṭicca citta samuṭṭhāna  rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkham paṭicca sampayuttakā khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpa  ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe upekkham paṭicca sampayuttakāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte paṭicca
translated: the materiality that is with root-cause and with equanimity as condition is the states associated with the mind element and the mind-consciousness element, and the materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽At the impulsion stage of the rebirth process, the states associated with equanimity as condition are the states associated with the mind element and the mind-consciousness element, and the materiality derived from the four great primaries.

original: kaṭattārūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagatā khandhā, mahābhūte
analyzed: vatthum paṭicca upekkhā sahagatāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte
translated: At the impulsion stage of the rebirth process, the states associated with equanimity as condition are the states associated with the mind element and the mind-consciousness element, and the materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽At the impulsion stage of the rebirth process, the materiality derived from kamma is with the four great primaries as its condition.

original: paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ, ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthuṁ paṭicca upekkhā ca sampayuttakā ca khandhā.🔽Upekkhāsahagatañca naupekkhāsahagatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati
analyzed: paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe vatthum paṭicca upekkhā ca sampayuttakā ca khandhā  upekkhā sahagatam ca na aupekkhā sahagatam ca dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati
translated: At the impulsion stage of the rebirth process, the states associated with equanimity as condition are the states associated with the mind element and the mind-consciousness element, and the materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽At the impulsion stage of the rebirth process, the basis as condition is the states associated with equanimity and the materiality derived from the four great primaries.🔽At the impulsion stage of the rebirth process, the basis as condition is the states associated with equanimity and the states associated with equanimity and the states not associated with equanimity.

original: nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca upekkhañca paṭicca dve khandhā,
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ahetukam upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandhañca upekkhañca paṭicca dve khandhā
translated: With non-root-cause condition: At the impulsion stage of the rebirth process, with one root-cause and equanimity as condition there are two states …

original: dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca upekkhañca
analyzed: dve khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandhañca upekkhañca
translated: With two aggregates …🔽At the mind’s rebirth-linking at the moment of conception, with a single aggregate and with equanimity …

original: paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ
analyzed: paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkhā sahagatam eka
translated: With two aggregates …🔽At the mind’s rebirth-linking at the moment of conception, with a single aggregate and with the physical basis …🔽With two aggregates …

original: khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhā; dve khandhe …pe… vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate
analyzed: khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate
translated: With the aggregates that are associated with uncertainty and with restlessness and with equanimity …

original: khandhe ca upekkhañca paṭicca vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: khandhe ca upekkhañca paṭicca vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: With the aggregates that are associated with uncertainty and with restlessness and with equanimity …

original: Upekkhāsahagatañca naupekkhāsahagatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naupekkhāsahagato dhammo
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatam ca na aupekkhā sahagatam ca dhammam paṭicca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo
translated: With the aggregates that are associated with equanimity and with those that are not associated with equanimity …🔽With the aggregates that are not associated with equanimity …

original: uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetuke upekkhāsahagate khandhe ca upekkhañca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ
analyzed: uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuke upekkhā sahagate khandhe ca upekkhañca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhāna
translated: At the mind’s rebirth-linking at the moment of conception, with the aggregates that are associated with equanimity and with equanimity …

original: rūpaṁ, ahetuke upekkhāsahagate khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ;
analyzed: rūpa ahetuke upekkhā sahagate khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: With the aggregates that are associated with equanimity and with the great primaries …

original: ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhāsahagate khandhe ca upekkhañca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ,
analyzed: ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkhā sahagate khandhe ca upekkhañca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa
translated: At the mind’s rebirth-linking at the moment of conception, with the aggregates that are associated with equanimity and with equanimity …

original: ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhāsahagate khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ,
analyzed: ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkhā sahagate khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattā rūpa
translated: At the mind-renewal moment of rebirth-linking without root-cause, the materiality derived by kamma consisting of the faculties, etc., is due to the states of the aggregates and the great primaries associated with equanimity.

original: ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhāsahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paṭicca upekkhā.🔽Upekkhāsahagatañca naupekkhāsahagatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca upekkhāsahagato ca naupekkhāsahagato🔽ca dhammā uppajjanti nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca upekkhañca🔽paṭicca dve khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ, dve khandhe …pe… ahetukaṁ upekkhāsahagataṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhañca upekkhañca paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… ahetuke upekkhāsahagate🔽khandhe ca upekkhañca mahābhūte ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkhā sahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paṭicca upekkhā  upekkhā sahagatañca na aupekkhā sahagatañca dhammam paṭicca upekkhā sahagataḥ ca na aupekkhā sahagataḥ  ca dhammā uppajjanti na hetu paccayā ahetukam upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandhañca upekkhañca  paṭicca dve khandhā citta samuṭṭhānam ca rūpa dve khandhe pe ahetukam upekkhā sahagata  ekam khandhañca upekkhañca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe ahetuke upekkhā sahagate  khandhe ca upekkhañca mahābhūte ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: At the mind-renewal moment of rebirth-linking without root-cause, equanimity is due to the states of the aggregates and the physical heart- basis associated with equanimity.🔽When there is a state associated with equanimity and a state not associated with equanimity as condition, there is a state associated with equanimity and a state not associated with equanimity as non-root-cause condition. At the mind-renewal moment of rebirth-linking without root-cause, due to one aggregate associated with equanimity and to equanimity, there are two aggregates and materiality derived by kamma consisting of the faculties, etc.

original: upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca upekkhañca paṭicca dve khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpaṁ,
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandhañca upekkhañca paṭicca dve khandhā kaṭattā ca rūpa
translated: Due to two aggregates … Due to one aggregate associated with equanimity and to equanimity, there are two aggregates. Due to two aggregates … At the mind-renewal moment of rebirth-linking without root-cause, materiality derived by kamma consisting of the faculties, etc., is due to the states of the aggregates associated with equanimity and to equanimity and to the great primaries. At the mind-renewal moment of rebirth-linking without root-cause, due to one aggregate associated with equanimity and to equanimity, there are two aggregates and materiality derived by kamma consisting of the faculties, etc.

original: dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhañca upekkhañca
analyzed: dve khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandhañca upekkhañca
translated: with two aggregates …🔽at the consciousness-moment of rebirth-linking without root-cause, with one aggregate and with the heart-basis …

original: paṭicca dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… ahetuke upekkhāsahagate khandhe ca upekkhañca
analyzed: paṭicca dve khandhā dve khandhe pe ahetuke upekkhā sahagate khandhe ca upekkhañca
translated: with two aggregates …🔽with the two aggregates and with the four great elementals …

original: mahābhūte ca paṭicca kaṭattārūpaṁ; ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ
analyzed: mahābhūte ca paṭicca ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe upekkhā sahagatam eka
translated: at the consciousness-moment of rebirth-linking without root-cause, with one aggregate and with the mental-data base …🔽with two aggregates …

original: khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhā upekkhā ca, dve khandhe …pe… (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: khandhañca vatthuñca paṭicca dve khandhāḥ upekkhā ca dve khandhe pe
translated: (The rest is abridged.)

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on the Modes of Direct Relation

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, naaññamaññe tīṇi,🔽naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme cattāri,🔽navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne nava, namagge nava, nasampayutte
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na aññamaññe tīṇi  na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme cattāri  na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne nava na magge nava na sampayutte
translated: In the mode of direct relation through no cause: nine. In the mode of direct relation through no object: three. In the mode of direct relation through no predominance: nine. In the mode of direct relation through no proximity: three. In the mode of direct relation through no contiguity: three.

original: tīṇi, navippayutte cha, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na vippayutte cha no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: In the mode of direct relation through no immediacy: three. In the mode of direct relation through no continuity: three. In the mode of direct relation through no dependence: three. In the mode of direct relation through no dissociation: six. In the mode of direct relation through no presence: three. In the mode of direct relation through no absence: three.

original: 2.13.10.2. Sahajātavāra
analyzed: sahajātavāra
translated: The Section on the Modes of Origination

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sahajātavāropi kātabbo.
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sahajāta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ
translated: Conditioned by way of Root

original: 2.13.10.3. Paccayavāra🔽2.13.10.3.1–4. Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya vāra  paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: Conditioned by way of Antecedent

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root Cause

original: Upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paccayā upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— upekkhāsahagataṁ
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paccayā upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With equanimity as condition, a state with equanimity arises, conditioned by way of root cause—🔽one aggregate conditioned by way of root cause, two aggregates … two aggregates …

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… (yathā🔽savitakkadukasadisaṁ paccayavāre nānākaraṇaṁ. “Upekkhan”ti navapi pañhā kātabbā,
analyzed: ekam khandham paccayā dve khandhā dve khandhe pe paṭisandhikkhaṇe pe yathā  sa vitakka duka sadisam paccaya vāre nānākaraṇe upekkhanti nava pi pañhā kātabbā
translated: at the stage of rebirth-linking …🔽(The method of treatment in the section on conditions is the same as in the case of the triad with applied thought. The nine questions should be treated in the same way as in the case of equanimity.

original: paṭisandhipavattipi vatthupi.)
analyzed: paṭisandhi pavattipi vatthupi
translated: The same method of treatment applies to the stage of rebirth-linking and to the base.)

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe nava …pe… purejāte nava, āsevane nava (sabbattha nava), avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe nava pe purejāte nava āsevane nava sabbattha nava avigate nava
translated: Nine in the root cause, nine in the object, etc. Nine in the prior, nine in the subsequent, nine in the support, nine in the dissociation, nine in the presence, nine in the absence, nine in the disappearance, and nine in the non-disappearance.

original: Anulomaṁ.🔽Upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ paccayā upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ
analyzed: anuloma  upekkhā sahagatam dhammam paccayā upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka
translated: The direct method.🔽With equanimity as condition, a state without equanimity arises, conditioned by way of root cause—

original: upekkhāsahagataṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatam ekam khandham paccayā dve khandhā dve khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe
translated: one aggregate without root cause conditioned by way of root cause, two aggregates … two aggregates … at the stage of rebirth-linking …

original: …pe… vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe paccayā vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato
analyzed: pe vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe paccayā vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ
translated: … with uncertainty … with agitation … with the states associated with uncertainty … with the states associated with agitation.

original: moho. (Evaṁ navapi pañhā pavattipaṭisandhiyo yathā savitakkadukassa evaṁ kātabbā.
analyzed: moho evam nava api pañhā pavatti paṭisandhiyaḥ yathā sa vitakka dukassa evam kātabbā
translated: (In the same way as in the case of the Dyad with Thinking, the Ninefold Formula should be worked out in the case of the Ninefold Causal Formula, the occurrence, rebirth-linking, and the rest.🔽But only three are due to delusion. And the exposition should be done in the case of the occurrence of the states.

original: Tīṇiyeva moho, pavatte vatthupi kātabbā.)
analyzed: mohaḥ kātabbā
translated: Delusion is the three, and in the occurrence of the basis, too, it should be done.

original: Nahetuyā nava, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare
analyzed: na hetuyā nava na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare
translated: In the case of non-cause, there are nine; in the case of non-object, there are three; in the case of non-predominance, there are nine; in the case of non-antecedent, there are three; in the case of non-conascence, there are three;

original: tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme🔽cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge nava,
analyzed: tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme  cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na aindriye eka na jhāne eka na magge nava
translated: in the case of non-support, there are three; in the case of non-prenascence, there are nine; in the case of non-postnascence, there are nine; in the case of non-kamma, there are nine; in the case of non-kamma-result, there are nine; in the case of non-ripening, there are nine; in the case of non-nutriment, there is one; in the case of non-faculty, there is one; in the case of non-path, there are nine;

original: nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte cha, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte cha no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: in the case of non-association, there are three; in the case of non-dissociation, there are six; in the case of non-presence, there are three; in the case of non- disappearance, there are three.🔽The reverse order.🔽The dependence method.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.🔽2.13.10.4. Nissayavāra🔽13.10.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra
analyzed: paccanīya  nissaya vāra  sa saṭṭhavāra
translated: The association method.

original: 2.13.10.5.1–4 Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: The method of conditions in forward order, etc.

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: (Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi nissayavāropi kātabbo.)
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api nissaya vāro api kātabbo
translated: (The other two ways of counting and the dependence method should be worked out in the same way.)

original: Upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—upekkhāsahagataṁ
analyzed: upekkhā sahagatam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ upekkhā sahagataḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā upekkhā sahagata
translated: A factor associated with equanimity is related to a factor associated with equanimity as a root-cause condition.🔽

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā dve khandhā, dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Yathā
analyzed: ekam khandham sa saṭṭhāḥ dve khandhāḥ dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe yathā
translated: A state associated with equanimity … (as in §1, but with the first and second triads only).

original: savitakkadukaṁ sampayuttavāro evaṁ kātabbo.)
analyzed: sa vitakka dukam sampayutta vāraḥ evam kātabbaḥ
translated: (As in the Savitakka-dvay section, but with the third triad only.)

original: Hetuyā cha, ārammaṇe cha (sabbattha cha), avigate cha.
analyzed: hetuyā cha ārammaṇe cha sabbattha cha avigate cha
translated: As root cause, six; as object, six; as condition, six.

original: Anulomaṁ.🔽Upekkhāsahagataṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho upekkhāsahagato dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā—ahetukaṁ

original: Nahetuyā cha, naadhipatiyā cha, napurejāte cha, napacchājāte cha, naāsevane cha, nakamme cattāri, navipāke cha, navippayutte cha.

translated: … states associated with equanimity are an immediately preceding condition for the succeeding equanimity. Resultant mind element is an immediately preceding condition for resultant mind-consciousness element not associated with equanimity. The life-continuum associated with equanimity is an immediately preceding condition for the life-continuum not associated with equanimity. The life-continuum associated with equanimity is an immediately preceding condition for the adverting not associated with equanimity. The adverting associated with equanimity is an immediately preceding condition for the seeing not associated with equanimity. The seeing associated with equanimity is an immediately preceding condition for the hearing … for the smelling … for the tasting … for the touching … for the cognizing not associated with equanimity.
