original: sahajāte nava, aññamaññe cha, nissaye nava, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte cattāri,
analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe cha nissaye nava upanissaye cattāri purejāte cattāri
translated: as decisive support, four; as support, nine; as prenascence, nine; as postnascence, nine; as repetition, four; as non- repetition, nine; as karmically similar, nine; as karmically dissimilar, nine; as karmic result, four; as nutriment, four; as faculty, nine; as jhāna, four; as path, four; as association, nine; as dissociation, nine; as presence, nine; as absence, nine; as disappearance, nine; as non-disappearance, nine.🔽In the section on root cause, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a root cause, there are nine possibilities.

original: āsevane cattāri, kamme nava …pe… avigate nava.🔽Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: āsevane cattāri kamme nava pe avigate nava  anuloma
translated: In the section on condition being an object, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a predominance, there are nine possibilities.

original: Kāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— ahetukaṁ kāmāvacaraṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacaram dhammam paccayā kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam kāmāvacara
translated: In the section on condition being a proximity, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a contiguity, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a decisive support, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a support, there are nine possibilities.

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… (yāva asaññasattā) cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: ekam khandham paccayā pe ahetuka paṭisandhi khaṇe pe yāva asaññasattā cakkhu āyatana
translated: In the section on condition being a prenascence, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a postnascence, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a repetition, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a non-repetition, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a karmically similar, there are nine possibilities.

original: paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā ahetukā
analyzed: paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā ahetukā
translated: In the section on condition being a karmically dissimilar, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a karmic result, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a nutriment, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a faculty, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a jhāna, there are four possibilities.

original: kāmāvacarā khandhā, vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā🔽vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: kāmāvacarā khandhāḥ vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā  vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: In the section on condition being a path, there are four possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being an association, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a dissociation, there are nine possibilities.🔽In the section on condition being a presence, there are nine possibilities.

original: Naārammaṇapaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi
translated: In the section on condition being an absence, there are nine possibilities.

original: Naadhipatyādi
analyzed: na adhipati ādi
translated: In the section on condition being

original: Kāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … ekaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacaram dhammam paccayā kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā eka
translated: With sense-sphere states as condition, a sense-sphere state arises, not through predominance condition … (as in the section on root cause, from one to eleven).

original: (yāva asaññasattā). Kāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā—vatthuṁ
analyzed: yāva asaññasattā kāmāvacaram dhammam paccayā na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā vatthu
translated: With sense-sphere states as condition, a non-sense-sphere state arises, not through predominance condition: the physical basis

original: paccayā nakāmāvacarādhipati, vatthuṁ paccayā vipākā nakāmāvacarā khandhā; paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽…pe…. Kāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā kāmāvacaro ca nakāmāvacaro ca dhammā uppajjanti🔽naadhipatipaccayā— vatthuṁ paccayā vipākā nakāmāvacarā khandhā, mahābhūte paccayā
analyzed: paccayā na kāmāvacara adhipati vatthum paccayā vipākāḥ na kāmāvacarāḥ khandhāḥ paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  pe kāmāvacaram dhammam paccayā kāmāvacaro ca na kāmāvacaro ca dhammā uppajjanti  na adhipati paccayā vatthum paccayā vipākāḥ na kāmāvacarāḥ khandhāḥ mahābhūte paccayā
translated: as condition, the predominance of the non-sense-sphere faculties; the physical basis as condition, the non-sense-sphere resultant aggregates; at the rebirth-linking moment …

original: cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: With sense-sphere states as condition, a sense-sphere state and a non-sense-sphere state arise, not through predominance condition: the physical basis as condition, the non-sense-sphere resultant aggregates; the great elements as condition, the form that is derived from the great elements; at the rebirth-linking moment …

original: Nakāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā … tīṇi. (Paṭiccasadisā.)
analyzed: na kāmāvacaram dhammam paccayā na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā tīṇi paṭicca sadisā
translated: With a non-sense-sphere state as condition, a non-sense-sphere state arises, not through predominance condition … three … (as in the section on root cause).

original: Kāmāvacarañca nakāmāvacarañca dhammaṁ paccayā kāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā
analyzed: kāmāvacaram ca na kāmāvacaram ca dhammam paccayā kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā
translated: With a sense-sphere and a non-sense-sphere state as condition, a sense-sphere state arises, not through predominance condition:

original: Nakāmāvacare khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā nakāmāvacarādhipati, vipākaṁ nakāmāvacaraṁ
analyzed: na kāmāvacare khandhe ca vatthum ca paccayāḥ na kāmāvacara adhipati vipākam na kāmāvacara
translated: With the states of the fine-material sphere and the physical basis as condition, a fine-material resultant aggregate is a condition, …🔽With one aggregate and the physical basis as condition, three aggregates … two aggregates … At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe🔽…pe…. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Vipākaṁ nakāmāvacaraṁ ekaṁ khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo
analyzed: ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe ca pe paṭisandhi kkhaṇe  pe mūlam kātabba vipākam na kāmāvacaram ekam khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo
translated: … a fine-material resultant aggregate is a condition, …

original: khandhā …pe… dve khandhe ca …pe… vipāke nakāmāvacare khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā
analyzed: khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe vipāke na kāmāvacare khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paccayā
translated: With one aggregate and the physical basis and the great primaries as condition, materiality derived from the four great primaries … At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: … a fine-material resultant aggregate is a condition, …

original: Naupanissayapaccayā … tīṇi … naāsevanapaccayā. (Suddhake arūpamissake ca “vipākan”ti niyāmetabbaṁ, rūpamissake natthi. Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na upanissaya paccayā tīṇi na āsevana paccayā suddhake arūpa missake ca vipāka nti niyāmetabba rūpa missake natthi saṅkhitta
translated: As root-cause condition, three … As repetition condition, none. (In the case of the pure and the immaterial, “resultant” should be limited. In the case of the material, there is none.)

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi, nasamanantare
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā nava na anantare tīṇi na samanantare
translated: Pure

original: tīṇi, naupanissaye tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava, nakamme
analyzed: tīṇi na upanissaye tīṇi na purejāte nava na pacchājāte nava na āsevane nava na kamme
translated: With the exception of root-cause condition, one; with the exception of object condition, three; with the exception of predominance condition, nine; with the exception of proximity condition, three; with the exception of contiguity condition, three; with the exception of support condition, three; with the exception of prenascence condition, nine; with the exception of postnascence condition, nine; with the exception of nutriment condition, nine; with the exception of faculty condition, nine; with the exception of jhāna condition, nine; with the exception of path condition, nine; with the exception of association condition, three; with the exception of non-disappearance condition, three.

original: cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ,🔽nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.🔽Paccanīyaṁ.🔽2.13.11.4. Nissayavāra🔽13.11.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra🔽2.13.11.5.1–4 Paccayānulomādi🔽Vibhaṅgavāra🔽Hetu🔽(Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi nissayavāropi kātabbo.)🔽Kāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho kāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— kāmāvacaraṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Nakāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho nakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— nakāmāvacaraṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: cattāri na vipāke nava na āhāre eka na aindriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka  na sampayutte tīṇi na vippayutte dve no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi  paccanīya  nissaya vāra  sa saṭṭhavāra  paccaya anuloma ādi  vibhaṅgavāra  hetu  evam itare dve gaṇanā api nissaya vāro api kātabbo  kāmāvacaram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā kāmāvacaram ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhā pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  na kāmāvacaram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na kāmāvacaram ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhā pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: Four, in the non-resultant triad nine, in the non-nutrient one, in the non-faculty one, in the non-jhana one, in the non-path one,

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve, adhipatiyā dve (sabbattha dve), avigate dve.
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve adhipatiyā dve sabbattha dve avigate dve
translated: in the non-associated two, in the non-dissociate two, in the not-roots three, in the not-conditions three, in the not-nascence three, in the not-decisive-support three, in the not-decisive-support-condition three, in the not-reflexion three, in the not-reflexion-condition three, in the not-conascence three, in the not-conascence-condition three, in the not-pconascence three, in the not-pconascence-condition three, in the not-possession three, in the not-deprivation three, in the not-attributive-action three, in the not-rebirth-linking three, in the not-obtaining three, in the not-medium-of-action three, in the not-language three, in the not-false-speech three, in the not-false-for-others three, in the not-false-thought three, in the not-false-communication three, in the not-greed three, in the not-hatred three, in the not-delusion three, in the not-conscientiousness three, in the not-calm three, in the not-non-greed three, in the not-non-hatred three, in the not-non-delusion three, in the not-conscientiousness three, in the not-calm three, in the not-non-greed three, in the not-non-hatred three, in the not-non-delusion three, in the not-conscientiousness three, in the not-calm three, in the not-non-greed three, in the not-non-hatred three, in the not-non-delusion three, in the not-conscientiousness three, in the not-calm three, in the not-non-greed three, in the not-non-hatred three, in the not-non-delusion three, in the not-conscientiousness three, in the not-calm three, in the not-non-greed three, in the not-non-hatred three, in the not-non

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: In conformity.

original: Kāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho kāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— ahetukaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacaram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetuka
translated: A factor belonging to the sense-sphere, in association with a factor belonging to the sense-sphere, arises with non-root-cause condition …🔽A single aggregate belonging to the sense-sphere, in association with three aggregates … two aggregates …

original: kāmāvacaraṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… ahetukapaṭisandhikkhaṇe
analyzed: kāmāvacaram ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe pe ahetuka paṭisandhi kkhaṇe
translated: At the consciousness-relinking moment of a non-root-cause rebirth-linking …

original: …pe… vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe saṁsaṭṭho vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: pe vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe sa saṭṭhaḥ vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: … in association with the aggregates that are conjoined with doubt and with agitation, the delusion that is conjoined with doubt and with agitation arises.🔽With non-root-cause as condition, one …🔽With non-predominance as condition, two …🔽With non-pre-nascence as condition, two …🔽With non-post-nascence as condition, two …🔽With non-nutriment as condition, two …

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, nakamme dve, navipāke dve, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte dve.
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na kamme dve na vipāke dve na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte dve
translated: With non-kamma as condition, two …🔽With non-result as condition, two …🔽With non-path as condition, one …🔽With non-non-causality as condition, two …🔽The reverse order should be done in the opposite way.

original: Paccanīyaṁ.🔽2.13.11.6. Sampayuttavāra
analyzed: paccanīya
translated: … Associated with …🔽The other two sections should be enumerated in the same way.🔽… Questions

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.11.7. Pañhāvāra🔽2.13.11.7.1. Paccayānuloma
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ  pañhāvāra  paccaya anuloma
translated: … In accordance with the condition

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Exposition

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Root-cause

original: Kāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—kāmāvacarā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ kāmāvacarassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo kāmāvacarāḥ hetū
translated: A factor belonging to the sense-sphere is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a factor belonging to the sense-sphere. Sense-sphere root-causes are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Nakāmāvacaro dhammo nakāmāvacarassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo— nakāmāvacarā🔽hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. Nakāmāvacaro🔽dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—nakāmāvacarā hetū cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na kāmāvacarassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ na kāmāvacarā  hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe na kāmāvacaraḥ  dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo na kāmāvacarāḥ hetū citta samuṭṭhānāna
translated: The mental factors and the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness are related to the aggregates as a condition being a cause condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking …🔽A state that is not of the sense sphere is related to a state that is not of the sense sphere as a condition being a cause condition. The causes that are not of the sense sphere are related to the aggregates that are not of the sense sphere as a condition being a cause condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Nakāmāvacarā
analyzed: rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe mūlam kātabba na kāmāvacarā
translated: A state that is not of the sense sphere is related to a state that is of the sense sphere as a condition being a cause condition. The causes that are not of the sense sphere are related to the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness as a condition being a cause condition. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo;
analyzed: hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The causes that are not of the sense sphere are related to the aggregates that are not of the sense sphere and to the kinds of materiality that originate with consciousness as a condition being a cause condition.

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Ārammaṇa
analyzed: ārammaṇa
translated: Object

original: Kāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ datvā sīlaṁ
analyzed: kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ kāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya udānam
translated: A state of the sense sphere is related to a state of the sense sphere as a condition being an object condition. Having given a gift, having undertaken the precepts, having developed the meditation, having given a gift, having undertaken the precepts, having developed the meditation,

original: …pe… uposathakammaṁ …pe… pubbe suciṇṇāni paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ
analyzed: pe uposatha kammaṃ pe pubbe su ciṇṇāni paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati
translated: … the observance-day ceremony … previously-done wholesome things … he recollects, welcomes, & delights in them.

original: ārabbha rāgo …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; ariyā gotrabhuṁ paccavekkhanti, vodānaṁ paccavekkhanti;
analyzed: ārabbha rāgaḥ pe domanassam uppajjati ariyāḥ gotrabhum paccavekkhanti vodānam paccavekkhanti
translated: From that, lust, aversion, or delusion arises. … He reviews the noble ones’ release. He reviews the fading of lust.

original: pahīne kilese …pe… vikkhambhite kilese …pe… pubbe suciṇṇāni …pe… cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ🔽kāmāvacare khandhe aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa
analyzed: pahīne kilese pe vikkhambhite kilese pe pubbe su ciṇṇāni pe cakkhum pe vatthu  kāmāvacare khandhe aniccataḥ pe domanassam uppajjati rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa
translated: … He sees the defilements as abandoned … He sees the defilements as subsided … He sees the previously-done wholesome things as done … The eye … The theme …

original: …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: Sensual-sphere mental phenomena are a condition for sensual-sphere mental phenomena as an object condition.

original: Kāmāvacaro dhammo nakāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dibbena cakkhunā🔽rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, cetopariyañāṇena kāmāvacaracittasamaṅgissa
analyzed: kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na kāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dibbena cakkhunā  rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena kāmāvacara citta samaṅgissa
translated: A sensual-sphere mental phenomenon is a condition for a non-sensual-sphere mental phenomenon as an object condition. With the divine eye,🔽one sees a form. With the divine ear element, one hears a sound. With the knowledge of encompassing the minds of others, one knows a sensual-sphere mind. The sensual-sphere aggregates are a condition for the knowledge of the mind-made body, for the knowledge of encompassing the minds of others, for the knowledge of past lives,

original: cittaṁ jānāti, kāmāvacarā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,
analyzed: cittam jānāti kāmāvacarā khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa
translated: the mind knows the kinds of supernormal power, the knowledge of the mind of another, the knowledge of recollection of past lives,🔽

original: yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nakāmāvacaro dhammo nakāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo— nibbānaṁ
analyzed: yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na kāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ nibbāna
translated: The knowledge of the destination of beings and knowledge of the future is a condition, as object condition, for knowledge of faring on in accordance with one’s actions.

original: maggassa, phalassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; cetopariyañāṇena nakāmāvacaracittasamaṅgissa
analyzed: maggassa phalassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo cetas pariya ñāṇena na kāmāvacara citta samaṅgissa
translated: A mind-made deathless element is a condition, as object condition, for the path and for fruition.🔽When someone with a mind-made deathless element knows the mind of another, he knows a mind-made deathless element.

original: cittaṁ jānāti, ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanassa …pe… ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa
analyzed: cittam jānāti ākāsānañcāyatanam viññāṇañcāyatanassa pe ākiñcaññāyatanam nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa
translated: The base of infinite space is a condition, as object condition, for the base of infinite consciousness … The base of nothingness is a condition, as object condition, for the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: …pe… nakāmāvacarā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,
analyzed: pe na kāmāvacarā khandhā iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa
translated: … The mind-made deathless element is a condition, as object condition, for the various kinds of supernormal power, for the knowledge of the past, for knowledge of faring on in accordance with one’s actions, and for knowledge of the future.🔽A mind-made deathless element is a condition, as object condition, for a mind-made deathless element.

original: yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nakāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo  na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ kāmāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayojhānā vuṭṭhahitvā
translated: A mind-made deathless element is a condition, as object condition, for a formless element.🔽When someone, after emerging from a formless jhāna, reviews that jhāna, he relishes it, he welcomes it, and he remains holding to it. Delight arises in him because of that relishing. Greed arises in him because of that delight.

original: jhānaṁ paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati
analyzed: jhānam paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: Greed is a condition, as object condition, for the defilement of that jhāna.

original: …pe… ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhanti; phalaṁ …pe… nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: pe ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam paccavekkhanti phalam pe nibbānam paccavekkhanti
translated: … the noble paths, having emerged from the path, he reflects on the path; he reflects on the fruition; he reflects on Nibbāna;

original: nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ
analyzed: nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ākāsānañcāyatana
translated: Nibbāna is related to the faculty of final knowledge, to the faculty of coming to know what is as yet unknown, to the faculty of understanding, as object condition. The base of infinite space

original: paccavekkhati, viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ paccavekkhati, ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ paccavekkhati, nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ🔽paccavekkhati, dibbaṁ cakkhuṁ paccavekkhati, dibbaṁ sotadhātuṁ paccavekkhati, iddhividhañāṇaṁ
analyzed: paccavekkhati viññāṇañca āyatanam paccavekkhati ākiñcañña āyatanam paccavekkhati nevasaññānāsaññāyatana  paccavekkhati dibbam cakkhum paccavekkhati dibbam sotadhātum paccavekkhati iddhividha ñāṇa
translated: reflects on the base of infinite consciousness, on the base of nothingness, on the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,🔽on the divine eye, on the divine ear element, on the knowledge of the categories of psychic power,

original: paccavekkhati, cetopariyañāṇaṁ …pe… pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṁ …pe… yathākammūpagañāṇaṁ
analyzed: paccavekkhati cetaḥ pariya ñāṇam pe pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇam pe yathā kammūpaga ñāṇa
translated: on the knowledge of the awareness of others, … on the knowledge of recollecting past lives, … on the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings,

original: …pe… anāgataṁsañāṇaṁ paccavekkhati, nakāmāvacare khandhe aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: pe anāgata sañāṇam paccavekkhati na kāmāvacare khandhe aniccatas pe domanassam uppajjati
translated: … on the knowledge of the destruction of the taints, he reflects on the sense-sphere aggregates as impermanent … he feels painful, unhappy mental feelings.

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominance

translated: A sense-sphere states is related to a sense-sphere states as object dominance,

original: Sahajātādhipati—nakāmāvacarādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo. Nakāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: sahajāta adhipatinā kāmāvacara adhipati sampayuttakānaṃ khandhānaṃ adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ kāmāvacarassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is when a state of the sense-desire realm is predominant for associated aggregates.

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā jhānam garum katvā paccavekkhati
translated: A state of the sense-desire realm is a condition by way of predominance condition for a state of the form realm: the condition being by way of predominance condition is when, after emerging from a form-sphere jhāna, one recollects the jhāna,

original: assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati, ariyā maggā
analyzed: assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati ariyā maggā
translated: one values it, one delights in it, and from valuing it, lust arises, a view arises, and the noble paths and fruits

original: vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, phalaṁ …pe… nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: vuṭṭhahitvā maggam garum katvā paccavekkhanti phalam pe nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti
translated: after emerging from the paths and fruits, one recollects the paths and fruits,

original: nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo; ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ garuṁ
analyzed: nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ākāsānañcāyatanam garu
translated: Nibbāna is a condition by way of predominance condition for the path, for cleansing, for the fruit, for Nibbāna. The base of infinite space is a condition by way of predominance condition for the base of infinite consciousness … the base of nothingness … the base of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: katvā paccavekkhati viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ …pe… ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ …pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ🔽garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, dibbaṁ cakkhuṁ …pe… dibbaṁ sotadhātuṁ …pe… iddhividhañāṇaṁ
analyzed: katvā paccavekkhati viññāṇañcāyatanam pe ākiñcaññāyatanam pe nevasaññānāsaññāyatana 🔽garum katvā paccavekkhati dibbam cakkhum pe dibbam sotadhātum pe iddhividha ñāṇa
translated: The divine eye … the divine ear … the various kinds of supernormal power …

original: …pe… anāgataṁsañāṇaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati, nakāmāvacare khandhe garuṁ katvā
analyzed: pe anāgata sañāṇam garum katvā paccavekkhati na kāmāvacare khandhe garum katvā
translated: … he reflects on future perception as superior … he reflects on the mental phenomena of the sensual realm as superior …

original: assādeti abhinandati taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—nakāmāvacarādhipati🔽cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo; nakāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa
analyzed: assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati sahajāta adhipatinā kāmāvacara adhipati  citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ kāmāvacarassa
translated: he relishes and delights in that reflection as superior, and because of that delight greed arises. A view arises. The co-nascent dominant condition is the dominant condition of the mental phenomena of the sensual realm.🔽A phenomenon of the non-sensual realm is the dominant condition for a phenomenon of the sensual realm

original: ca nakāmāvacarassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—nakāmāvacarādhipati🔽sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: ca na kāmāvacarassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati na kāmāvacara adhipati  sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: and for a phenomenon of the non-sensual realm. The co-nascent dominant condition is the dominant condition of the associated aggregates and of the kinds of materiality that are derived.

original: Anantarādi🔽Kāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā
analyzed: anantara ādi  kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ kāmāvacarassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā
translated: Immediately preceding

original: kāmāvacarā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ kāmāvacarānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena
analyzed: kāmāvacarā khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam kāmāvacarānam khandhānam anantara paccayena
translated: A phenomenon of the sensual realm is the immediately preceding condition for a phenomenon of the sensual realm. The prior prior aggregates are the immediately preceding condition for the later later aggregates of the sensual realm.

analyzed: maggassa anulomam phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayo  na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na kāmāvacarassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā  na kāmāvacarā khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam na kāmāvacarānam khandhānam anantara paccayena  paccayaḥ maggo phalassa phalam phalassa nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa  phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayaḥ na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ kāmāvacarassa dhammassa

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo—nakāmāvacaraṁ cuticittaṁ kāmāvacarassa upapatticittassa,

original: phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Nakāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,

original: anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—nakāmāvacaraṁ saddhaṁ upanissāya
analyzed: anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ na kāma avacaram saddham upanissāya
translated: decisive support as proximity, natural decisive support … Natural decisive support: having sensual-sphere faith as decisive support,

original: dānaṁ deti, sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ …pe… vipassanaṁ uppādeti, mānaṁ jappeti, diṭṭhiṁ🔽gaṇhāti; nakāmāvacaraṁ sīlaṁ …pe… paññaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti, sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ

translated: He gives a gift, observes a training rule, performs an Uposatha ceremony, generates insight, recites a mnemonic verse, or holds a view.

analyzed: pe vipassanam uppādeti mānam jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti na kāmāvacarā saddhā pe
translated: He gives a gift, observes a training rule, performs an Uposatha ceremony, generates insight, recites a mnemonic verse, or holds a view.🔽Faith, etc., in the sense-desire realm are conditions, as support condition, for faith, etc., in the sense-desire realm.

original: paññā kāmāvacarāya saddhāya …pe… paññāya, rāgassa …pe… patthanāya kāyikassa sukhassa,
analyzed: paññā kāmāvacarāya saddhāya pe paññāya rāgassa pe patthanāya kāyikassa sukhassa
translated: They are conditions, as support condition, for greed, for the attainment of the material and immaterial jhānas, for bodily pleasure and pain,🔽and for formations that are related to the noble path.

original: kāyikassa dukkhassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo; ariyā maggaṁ upanissāya saṅkhāre🔽aniccato …pe… vipassanti, maggo ariyānaṁ atthapaṭisambhidāya … dhammapaṭisambhidāya
analyzed: kāyikassa dukkhassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ariyāḥ maggaṃ upanissāya saṅkhāre  aniccataḥ pe vipassanti maggaḥ ariyānam attha paṭisambhidāya dhamma paṭisambhidāya
translated: The noble path is a condition, as support condition, for the four discriminations of the noble ones, for skill in the aggregates,

original: … niruttipaṭisambhidāya … paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya … ṭhānāṭhānakosallassa upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: nirutti paṭisambhidāya paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya ṭhāna aṭhāna kosallassa upanissaya paccayena
translated: for skill in the sense bases, for skill in the elements, for skill in the truths, for skill in dependent origination, and for skill in what is possible and what is impossible.

original: paccayo; phalasamāpatti kāyikassa sukhassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Purejātādi
analyzed: paccayaḥ phala samāpatti kāyikassa sukhassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ 🔽purejāta ādi
translated: The attainment of fruition is a condition, as support condition, for bodily pleasure.

original: Kāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ🔽uppajjati; rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe….🔽Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe…🔽vatthu kāmāvacarānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo. Kāmāvacaro dhammo nakāmāvacarassa🔽dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇapurejātaṁ, vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—dibbena
analyzed: kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccato pe domanassa  uppajjati rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe  vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe  vatthu kāmāvacarānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na kāmāvacarassa  dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayo ārammaṇa purejāta vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta dibbena
translated: A sense-sphere states is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for a sense-sphere state. The condition being that of the object prenascent condition, the condition being that of the physical basis prenascent condition. The condition being that of the object prenascent condition: When one contemplates as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, as a tumour, as a barb, as a calamity, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as a terror, as a plague, as a dart, as arisen through nutriment, as subject to destruction, as subject to fall, as subject to fading away, as subject to cessation, as subject to change, any of the sense objects, then the sense objects are a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the associated states.🔽The condition being that of the physical basis prenascent condition: When one contemplates the eye as impermanent, as painful, as a disease, as a tumour, as a barb, as a calamity, as an affliction, as alien, as disintegrating, as a terror, as a plague, as a dart, as arisen through nutriment, as subject to destruction, as subject to fall, as subject to fading away, as subject to cessation, as subject to change, then the eye is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. When one contemplates the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … the mind as impermanent … as subject to change, then the mind is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the mind-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith.🔽The condition being that of the physical basis prenascent condition: The eye base is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the eye-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. The ear base … The nose base … The tongue base … The body base … The mind base is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the mind-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. The physical basis is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for the sense-sphere aggregates. A sense-sphere state is a condition, as a prenascent condition, for a not-so-state.🔽The condition being that of the object prenascent condition, the condition being that of the physical basis prenascent condition. The condition being that of the object prenascent condition: When

original: cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu🔽nakāmāvacarānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti vatthu purejāta vatthu 🔽na kāmāvacarānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A sense-sphere states is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for a sense-sphere state, as object pre-arising and as physical basis pre-arising. As object pre-arising: the eye is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for eye-consciousness and for the states associated therewith. The ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … the visible form … the sound … the odour … the flavour … the tangible object … is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the body-consciousness element and for the states associated therewith. As physical basis pre-arising: the physical basis is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the sense-sphere states. A sense-sphere state is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for a non-sense-sphere state, as object pre-arising and as physical basis pre-arising. As object pre-arising: by means of the divine eye … he sees visible forms belonging to the fine-material sphere. As physical basis pre-arising: the physical basis is a condition, as a pre-arising condition, for the non-sense-sphere states.

original: Pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … dve … āsevanapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.

original: atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Sahajātaṁ—paṭisandhikkhaṇe vatthu nakāmāvacarānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena paccayo. Purejātaṁ—dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati …pe…. (Purejātasadisaṁ.)

original: Nakāmāvacaro dhammo nakāmāvacarassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo— sahajātaṁ.🔽(Saṅkhittaṁ.) Nakāmāvacaro dhammo kāmāvacarassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ,

analyzed: pacchājāta āhāra indriya sahajāta anakāmāvacarā khandhā ca mahābhūtā ca  rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe pacchājātā na kāmāvacarāḥ khandhāḥ  ca kabaḷīkāro āhāro ca imassa kāyassa atthi paccayena paccayo pacchājātā na kāmāvacarā  khandhā ca rūpa jīvita indriyañca kaṭattā rūpānaṃ atthi paccayena paccayo kāmāvacaro
translated: the postnascent, nutriment, and faculty. The conascent—the aggregates not belonging to the sense-desire realm and the great elements—are a condition, by way of presence condition, for the form that is derived from the mind.

original: ca nakāmāvacaro ca dhammā nakāmāvacarassa dhammassa atthipaccayena paccayo—sahajātaṁ,🔽purejātaṁ. Sahajāto—nakāmāvacaro eko khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannaṁ khandhānaṁ atthipaccayena
analyzed: ca na kāmāvacaraḥ ca dhammā na kāmāvacarassa dhammassa atthi paccayena paccayo sahajāta 🔽purejāta sahajāta ūna kāmāvacaraḥ ekaḥ khandho ca vatthu ca tiṇṇannam khandhānaṃ atthi paccayena

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā nava, naanantare tīṇi …pe… naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napurejāte nava, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane nava (suddhike arūpe ca missake🔽ca “vipākan”ti niyāmetabbaṁ), nakamme cattāri, navipāke nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye🔽ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi, navippayutte ekaṁ, nonatthiyā

translated: The Pure

original: tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: tīṇi na u vigate tīṇi
translated: In the case of non-cause, there is one triad, three duals, and one dual in the case of non-object. In the case of non-predominance, there are nine triads, three duals, and one dual in the case of non-antecedent. … In the case of non-support, there are three triads, three duals, and one dual in the case of non-conascence. … In the case of non-kamma, there are four triads, four duals, and one dual in the case of non-result. … In the case of non-nutriment, there is one triad, one dual, and one dual in the case of non-faculty. … In the case of non-jhana, there is one triad, one dual, and one dual in the case of non-path. … In the case of non-conascence, there are three triads, three duals, and one dual in the case of non-association. … In the case of non-disappearance, there are three triads, three duals, and one dual in the case of non-defeat. …

analyzed: nissaya vāra  sa saṭṭhavāra

analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi  vibhaṅgavāra

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu

original: (Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi nissayavāropi kātabbo.)🔽Rūpāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho rūpāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— rūpāvacaraṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….🔽Narūpāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho narūpāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— narūpāvacaraṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api nissaya vāro api kātabbo  rūpāvacaram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ rūpāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā rūpāvacaram ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhā pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe  na rūpāvacaram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ na rūpāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā na rūpāvacaram ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhā pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: (The other two calculations and the section on dependence should be done in the same way.)🔽A form-sphere state that is associated arises with a form-sphere state as its cause condition. … A form-sphere aggregate that is associated arises with three aggregates … with two aggregates … At the moment of rebirth-linking …🔽A formless-sphere state that is associated arises with a formless-sphere state as its cause condition. … A formless-sphere aggregate that is associated arises with three aggregates … with two aggregates … At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve (sabbattha dve), avigate dve.
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve sabbattha dve avigate dve
translated: In the section on cause there are two, in the section on object two, in the section on predominance two, in the section on non-distortion two, in the section on non-disappearance two, and in the section on disconnection two.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: In the forward order.

original: Narūpāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho narūpāvacaro dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na rūpāvacaram dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ na rūpāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati na hetu paccayā
translated: A formless-sphere state that is associated arises with a formless-sphere state as its non-cause condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane dve, nakamme dve, navipāke dve, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte ekaṁ.🔽Paccanīyaṁ.🔽2.13.12.6. Sampayuttavāra🔽Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na kamme dve na vipāke dve na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte eka  paccanīya     evam itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ
translated: With respect to not a root, there is one; with respect to not a condition, there are two; with respect to not arising before, there are two; with respect to not arising after, there are two; with respect to not repetition, there are two; with respect to not kamma, there are two; with respect to not result, there are two; with respect to not jhāna, there is one; with respect to not path, there is one; with respect to not non-causality, there is one.🔽The reverse order.🔽2.13.12.6. The associated method🔽The other two calculations and the associated method should be done in the same way.

analyzed: hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ

analyzed: ārammaṇa

translated: one knows the mind and the mental concomitants associated with the form-world mind. The form-world aggregates are a condition, as a condition by way of object condition, for the knowledge of the mind-made body, for the knowledge of the divine ear,

original: paccayo. Rūpāvacaro dhammo narūpāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—paṭhamaṁ🔽jhānaṁ paccavekkhati …pe… catutthaṁ jhānaṁ paccavekkhati, dibbaṁ cakkhuṁ paccavekkhati,
analyzed: paccayaḥ rūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na rūpāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya upaṭhama 🔽jhānam paccavekkhati pe catuttham jhānam paccavekkhati dibbam cakkhum paccavekkhati
translated: for the knowledge of recollecting past lives, for the knowledge of the way to the destinations, for the knowledge of the future. A form-world Dhamma is a condition, as a condition by way of object condition, for a formless-world Dhamma. One reviews the first jhāna … one reviews the fourth jhāna, one reviews the divine eye,🔽one reviews the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers.

original: dibbaṁ sotadhātuṁ …pe… iddhividhañāṇaṁ …pe… cetopariyañāṇaṁ …pe… pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇaṁ
analyzed: dibbam sotadhātum pe iddhividha ñāṇam pe cetas upariya ñāṇam pe pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇa
translated: He reflects on the devas’ divine hearing element … the devas’ divine vision element … the knowledge of the devas’ ability to assume any form at will … the knowledge of the devas’ ability to hear sounds from far away … the knowledge of the devas’ ability to recollect their former lives …🔽the knowledge of the devas’ ability to know the minds of others … the knowledge of the devas’ ability to know where beings are being reborn according to their kamma … the knowledge of the devas’ ability to know the ending of the mental effluents.

original: …pe… yathākammūpagañāṇaṁ …pe… anāgataṁsañāṇaṁ paccavekkhati, rūpāvacare khandhe aniccato
analyzed: pe yathā kammūpaga ñāṇam pe anāgata sañāṇam paccavekkhati rūpāvacare khandhe aniccato
translated: He reflects on the aggregates that are in the form realm as impermanent …

original: …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: pe domanassam uppajjati
translated: and he feels painful, racking, piercing feelings.

original: Narūpāvacaro dhammo narūpāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ datvā
analyzed: na rūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na rūpāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya udānam da tvā
translated: A formless-world mind element is a condition, as object condition, for a formless-world mind element.

original: sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ …pe… pubbe suciṇṇāni paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: sīlam pe uposatha kammam pe pubbe su ciṇṇāni paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati
translated: Having given a gift, having observed morality, having performed an Uposatha, he reflects on the virtues of that generosity, morality, and Uposatha. He recollects the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha.🔽He feels joyful, and from joy he feels rapture.🔽When he has become detached from sensual pleasures … he experiences the first absorption … the second absorption … the third absorption … the fourth absorption.🔽He reflects on that jhāna …

original: taṁ ārabbha rāgo …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ paccavekkhanti,🔽phalaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa,
analyzed: tam ārabbha rāgaḥ pe domanassam uppajjati ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam paccavekkhanti  phalam paccavekkhanti nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa
translated: He reflects on the path …🔽He reflects on the fruition …

original: maggassa, phalassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; ariyā pahīne kilese …pe…
analyzed: maggassa phalassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ariyā pahīne kilese pe
translated: He reflects on Nibbāna. Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the fruition attainment, for the path, for reviewing, and for direct knowledge.

original: vikkhambhite kilese …pe… pubbe …pe… cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ narūpāvacare khandhe aniccato🔽…pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanassa …pe… ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ🔽nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa …pe… rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ🔽kāyaviññāṇassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: vikkhambhite kilese pe pubbe pe cakkhum pe vatthum na rūpāvacare khandhe aniccato  pe domanassam uppajjati ākāsānañcāyatanam viññāṇañcāyatanassa pe ākiñcaññāyatana  nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa pe rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatana  kāya viññāṇassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: when defilements are suppressed … when (the mind) is directed to a pre-existing (object) … the eye … the visible-form … the ear … the sound … the nose … the smell … the tongue … the taste … the body … the tangible … the mind … the mind-object … the mind-object element is the condition, by way of object condition, for mind-consciousness element.🔽The base of infinite space is the condition, by way of object condition, for the base of infinite consciousness … the base of nothingness … the base of neither perception nor non-perception … the visible-form base is the condition, by way of object condition, for eye-consciousness … the tangible base is the condition, by way of object condition, for body-consciousness.

translated: A non-form-sphere state is a condition, as predominance condition, for a non-form-sphere state, as object-predominance and as conascence-predominance. Object-predominance: having made giving weighty … having made virtue … having made the observance-day ceremony … having made the duties of a novice monk … having made the duties of an ascetic … having made the duties of a monk … having made the supernormal powers … having made the form-sphere jhānas … having made the formless-sphere attainments … having made the attainment of cessation … having made the knowledge of former habitations … having made the knowledge of the passing away and reappearance of beings … having made the knowledge of the destruction of the taints weighty, he reviews it and delights in it. Taking it as weighty, delight arises, and greed arises,🔽and view arises.

translated: The form-sphere mental factors are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the later and later form-sphere mental factors.

original: Narūpāvacaro dhammo narūpāvacarassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo— purimā purimā🔽narūpāvacarā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ narūpāvacarānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena

translated: A form-sphere state is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a formless-sphere state: the death consciousness in the form-sphere is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the rebirth-linking consciousness in the formless-sphere; the form-sphere life-continuum is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the adverting; the form-sphere mental factors are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the arising of the formless-sphere.

original: paccayo; anulomaṁ gotrabhussa …pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena

translated: A formless-sphere state is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for a formless-sphere state: the earlier and earlier formless-sphere mental factors are a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the later and later formless-sphere mental factors; conformity is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the change-of-lineage; … the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception is a condition, as an immediately preceding condition, for the attainment of the fruit.

original: paccayo. Narūpāvacaro dhammo rūpāvacarassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo— narūpāvacaraṁ

translated: A formless-sphere mental factor is a condition, as proximate condition, for a form-sphere mental factor.🔽The mind at death in the formless-sphere is a condition, as proximate condition, for the mind at rebirth in the form-sphere.

original: cuticittaṁ rūpāvacarassa upapatticittassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; narūpāvacarā🔽khandhā rūpāvacarassa vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; paṭhamassa jhānassa

translated: The aggregates in the formless-sphere are a condition, as proximate condition, for the attainment of the form-sphere.

translated: decisive support as proximity, natural decisive support. Natural decisive support: Depending on faith in the formless world one does …

original: … kāyikassa dukkhassa … maggassa, phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kāyikassa dukkhassa maggassa phala samāpattiyāḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: … depending on morality in the formless world … depending on learning in the formless world … depending on generosity in the formless world … depending on understanding in the formless world … depending on greed in the formless world … depending on food in the formless world … depending on a resting place in the formless world one gives a gift … one does an action … one destroys life … one splits the Saṅgha. Depending on faith in the formless world … depending on understanding in the formless world … depending on greed in the formless world … depending on aspiration in the formless world … depending on bodily pleasure … depending on bodily pain … depending on the path … depending on fruition … depending on attainment in the formless world one gives a gift … one does an action … one destroys life … one splits the Saṅgha.

analyzed: na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare satta na samanantare  satta na sahajāte cha na aññamaññe cha na nissaye cha na upanissaye satta na purejāte
translated: With respect to non-cause, there are seven. With respect to non-object, there are seven. With respect to non-predominance, there are seven. With respect to non-antecedent, there are seven. With respect to non-conascence, there are seven.

original: satta, napacchājāte satta …pe… nasampayutte cha, navippayutte pañca, noatthiyā pañca,

translated: With respect to non-contention, there are six. With respect to non-deprivation, there are six. With respect to non-retribution, there are seven. original: nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta, noavigate pañca.
analyzed: nonatthiyā satta no vigate satta no avigate pañca
translated: With respect to non-retribution, there are seven. With respect to non-deprivation, there are seven. With respect to non-retribution, there are five.

translated: A formless-world Dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a formless-world Dhamma. The base consisting of boundless space is a condition, as object condition, for the base consisting of boundless consciousness. A formless-world Dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a form-world Dhamma.

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Arūpāvacaro dhammo naarūpāvacarassa
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ arūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na arūpāvacarassa
translated: is a condition, as a dominant condition, for the associated aggregates. A formless-world thought is a condition, as a dominant condition, for the materiality originated by kamma.

original: dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ🔽garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati …pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati,🔽arūpāvacare khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati,
analyzed: dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati ākāsa ānañca āyatana  garum katvā paccavekkhati pe nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam garum katvā paccavekkhati  arūpāvacare khandhe garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati
translated: It is a condition, as predominance condition, for the associated aggregates. A formless-world Dhamma is a condition, as predominance condition, for a formless-world Dhamma. Predominance as object is when someone regards the base consisting of boundless space as peaceful and sublime, and so on as in §101 up to … regards the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception as peaceful and sublime,🔽and he resolves on that as his object, and he resolves on that as his sign, and he develops concentration with that as his object, and he attains the attainment with that as his object, and he sees the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception is stilled, calmed, and completely destroyed in one who is attaining Nibbāna through non-liability to renewed existence.’

original: diṭṭhi uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—arūpāvacarādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Arūpāvacarādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca
analyzed: diṭṭhi uppajjati sahajāta adhipati arūpāvacara adhipati citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba arūpāvacara adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca
translated: and he resolves on that as his object, and he resolves on that as his sign, and he develops concentration with that as his object, and he attains the attainment with that as his object, and he sees the formless-world aggregates as they actually are with proper wisdom thus: ‘These formless-world aggregates are impermanent, painful, and subject to change.’🔽Predominance as conascence is when a formless-world predominance is a condition, as predominance condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽(The rest is as in §102.)

original: rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A formless-world predominance is a condition, as predominance condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Naarūpāvacaro dhammo naarūpāvacarassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: na arūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na arūpāvacarassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A not-formless-world Dhamma is a condition, as predominance condition, for a not-formless-world Dhamma. Predominance as object is when someone regards materiality as peaceful and sublime, and so on as in §101 up to … regards the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception as peaceful and sublime,🔽and he resolves on that as his object, and he resolves on that as his sign, and he develops concentration with that as his object, and he attains the attainment with that as his object, and he sees the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception as it actually is with proper wisdom thus: ‘This base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception is stilled, calmed, and completely destroyed in one who is attaining Nibbāna through non-liability to renewed existence.’

translated: The condition being by way of the immediately preceding condition is: the conformity knowledge of the path is the immediately preceding condition for the change-of-lineage knowledge … the conformity knowledge of the path is the immediately preceding condition for the attainment of the fruit.

original: cuticittaṁ arūpāvacarassa upapatticittassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; naarūpāvacarā🔽khandhā arūpāvacarassa vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; ākāsānañcāyatanassa🔽parikammaṁ ākāsānañcāyatanassa anantarapaccayena paccayo; viññāṇañcāyatanassa …pe…🔽ākiñcaññāyatanassa …pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa parikammaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa🔽anantarapaccayena paccayo.

translated: A formless-world Dhamma is the condition, being by way of the immediately preceding condition, for a formless-world Dhamma: the mind-element at death is the immediately preceding condition for the mind-element at rebirth; the formless-world mental-data aggregates are the immediately preceding condition for the attainment of the formless-world worlds; the preliminary-work concentration of the base of infinite space is the immediately preceding condition for the base of infinite space; the preliminary-work concentration of the base of infinite consciousness … the preliminary-work concentration of the base of nothingness … the preliminary-work concentration of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is the immediately preceding condition for the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: Purejāta
analyzed: purā jāta
translated: Preceding

original: Naarūpāvacaro dhammo naarūpāvacarassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇapurejātaṁ,🔽vatthupurejātaṁ. Ārammaṇapurejātaṁ—cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniccato …pe… domanassaṁ🔽uppajjati; dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, rūpāyatanaṁ🔽cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe…. Vatthupurejātaṁ—cakkhāyatanaṁ
analyzed: na arūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ na arūpāvacarassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa purejāta  vatthu purejāta ārammaṇa purejāta cakkhum pe vatthum aniccato pe domanassa  uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti rūpa āyatana  cakkhu viññāṇassa pe phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu purejāta cakkha āyatana
translated: A formless-world Dhamma is a condition, as a preceding condition, for a formless-world Dhamma. The condition being, as object, a preceding condition,🔽and as physical basis, a preceding condition. As object, a preceding condition: When one contemplates impermanence … and so on with eye … and so on with physical basis as object, then painful … and so on with the mind as object, then not self, then one generates joy.

original: cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… vatthu naarūpāvacarānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: cakkhu viññāṇassa pe kāya āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe vatthu na arūpāvacarānam khandhānaṃ
translated: With the divine eye … and so on with the mind as object, then one sees visible forms … and so on with the mind as object, then one hears sounds … and so on with the mind as object, then one smells scents … and so on with the mind as object, then one tastes tastes … and so on with the mind as object, then one touches tactual objects … and so on with the mind as object, then one cognizes mental objects. As physical basis, a preceding condition: The eye base is a condition, as a preceding condition, for eye-consciousness … and so on with the mind base … and so on with the body base … and so on with the physical basis as a condition, as a preceding condition, for the formless-world mental factors.

original: purejātapaccayena paccayo. Naarūpāvacaro dhammo arūpāvacarassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena🔽paccayo. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu arūpāvacarānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ na arūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ arūpāvacarassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena  paccayaḥ vatthu purejāta vatthu arūpāvacarānam khandhānam purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A formless-world Dhamma is a condition, as a preceding condition, for a form-world Dhamma. As physical basis, a preceding condition: The physical basis is a condition, as a preceding condition, for the form-world mental factors.

original: Pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … dve … āsevanapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ dve āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: As a post-arising condition … two … As a repetition condition … three …

translated: Kamma 🔽A formless-world thought is a condition, as kamma condition, for a formless-world thought and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

translated: The reverse order🔽A formless-world dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a formless-world dhamma … as conascence condition …🔽as dependence condition … as kamma condition. A formless-world dhamma is a condition, as object condition, for a form-world dhamma … as conascence condition …

original: naarūpāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo

analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ arūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ arūpāvacarassa

original: Naarūpāvacaro dhammo naarūpāvacarassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena🔽paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena

original: Naarūpāvacaro dhammo arūpāvacarassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: na arūpāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ arūpāvacarassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A not-formless-world thought is related to a formless-world thought by decisive-support condition, by prenascence condition.

original: Arūpāvacaro ca naarūpāvacaro ca dhammā arūpāvacarassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ.
analyzed: arūpāvacaro ca na arūpāvacaro ca dhammā arūpāvacarassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta
translated: A formless-world thought and a not-formless-world thought are related to a formless-world thought by conascence and by prenascence.

original: Arūpāvacaro ca naarūpāvacaro ca dhammā naarūpāvacarassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.🔽2.13.13.7.2. Paccayapaccanīya
analyzed: arūpāvacaro ca na arūpāvacaro ca dhammā na arūpāvacarassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya  paccaya paccanīya
translated: and formless-sphere thoughts and neither-formless-sphere-nor-not-formless-sphere thoughts are conascent, prenascent, postnascent, nutriment, and a faculty.🔽..... The reverse of conditions

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā satta, naārammaṇe satta, naadhipatiyā satta, naanantare satta, nasamanantare
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā satta na ārammaṇe satta na adhipatiyā satta na anantare satta na samanantare
translated: Pure

original: satta, nasahajāte pañca, naaññamaññe pañca, nanissaye pañca, naupanissaye satta,
analyzed: satta na sahajāte pañca na aññamaññe pañca na nissaye pañca na upanissaye satta
translated: With respect to non-cause, there are seven. With respect to non-object, there are seven. With respect to non-dominance, there are seven. With respect to non-antecedent, there are seven. With respect to non-conascence, there are five. With respect to non-contention, there are five. With respect to non-dependence, there are five. With respect to non-support, there are seven.

original: napurejāte cha, napacchājāte satta …pe… nasampayutte pañca, navippayutte cattāri,
analyzed: na purejāte cha na pacchājāte satta pe na sampayutte pañca na vippayutte cattāri
translated: With respect to non-pre-nascence, there are six. With respect to non-post-nascence, there are seven. … With respect to non-conjoined, there are five. With respect to non-disjoined, there are four.

original: noatthiyā cattāri, nonatthiyā satta, novigate satta, noavigate cattāri.
analyzed: no atthiyā cattāri no natthiyā satta no vigate satta no avigate cattāri
translated: With respect to non-presence, there are four. With respect to non-absence, there are seven. With respect to non-disappearance, there are seven. With respect to non-non-disappearance, there are four.

original: 2.13.13.7.3. Paccayānulomapaccanīya🔽Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cattāri, naadhipatiyā cattāri, naanantare nasamanantare cattāri,

analyzed: na aññamaññe dve na upanissaye cattāri pe na sampayutte dve na vippayutte dve no natthiyā
translated: With respect to cause as condition, there are four as object, four as dominance, four as antecedent, four as conascence, two as kamma-result, four as nutriment, four as faculty, four as jhāna, four as path, two as association, two as non-causality, two as supported, four as object-relation, four as proximity, four as presence, four as absence, four as disappearance, four as non-disappearance, four as the element of continuity, four as the sphere of endless consciousness, four as the base of neither perception nor non-perception, four as this world, four as the other world, four as the world of men, four as the world of the gods, four as the world of Brahmās, four as the unformed, four as the seen, four as the heard, four as the sensed, four as the cognized, four as the seen, heard, sensed and cognized, four as the seen, heard, sensed, cognized and the contact, four as the seen, heard, sensed, cognized and the element of mental volition, four as the seen, heard, sensed, cognized, mental volition and the

original: cattāri, novigate cattāri.🔽2.13.13.7.4. Paccayapaccanīyānuloma
analyzed: cattāri no vigate cattāri  paccaya paccanīya anuloma
translated: Four, and four in the non-perilous.🔽… In the reverse order of the conditions

original: Nahetupaccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā cattāri (anulomamātikā kātabbā) …pe… avigate satta.
analyzed: na hetu paccayā ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā cattāri anuloma mātikā kātabbā pe avigate satta
translated: With non-cause condition, in the object three, in the dominant four. (The matrix should be done in the forward order.) … With non-peril four, with non-perilous seven.

original: Arūpāvacaradukaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ.
analyzed: arūpa avacara dukam niṭṭhita

analyzed: dhammam paṭicca niyyānikaḥ ca aniyyānikaḥ ca dhammāḥ uppajjanti hetu paccaya aniyyānika

original: Aniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— aniyyānikaṁ
analyzed: aniyyānikam dhammam paṭicca aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā aniyyānika

original: ekaṁ khandhaṁ paṭicca tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe…🔽paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe… khandhe paṭicca vatthu, vatthuṁ paṭicca khandhā, ekaṁ mahābhūtaṁ …pe….

translated: With a (volitional) process pertaining to the sense sphere as condition, two (volitional) processes that are not pertaining to the sense sphere and the form that is derived from the four great elements …🔽With a (volitional) process pertaining to the sense sphere as condition, one (volitional) process that is not pertaining

original: Niyyānikañca aniyyānikañca dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā—niyyānike khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: niyyānikam ca a niyyānikam ca dhammam paṭicca aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccaya aniyyānike khandhe ca mahābhūte ca paṭicca citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: Dependent on a Dhamma that is leading out and one that is not leading out, a Dhamma that is not leading out arises with root-cause as condition: dependent on the aggregates that are leading out and the great primaries, materiality derived from the four great primaries arises.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra

translated: … with the aggregates as condition, the physical basis; with the physical basis as condition, the aggregates; with one …

original: mahābhūtaṁ …pe… (yāva asaññasattā) vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate khandhe paṭicca
analyzed: mahābhūtam pe yāva asaññasattā vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate khandhe paṭicca
translated: the great primaries … (up to) the non-percipient beings … the aggregates that are conjoined with uncertainty and with agitation …

original: vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho. Naārammaṇapaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho na ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi
translated: delusion that is conjoined with uncertainty and with agitation. As object condition … three.

original: Naadhipatyādi🔽Niyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca niyyāniko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā— niyyānike khandhe paṭicca niyyānikādhipati.
analyzed: na adhipati ādi  niyyānikam dhammam paṭicca niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā niyyānike khandhe paṭicca niyyānika ādhipati
translated: As non-dominance condition, etc.🔽A resultant idea arises with a leading idea as object condition, not as non-dominance condition, the leading idea being the four dominants of the eye-door adverting consciousness.

original: Aniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā— aniyyānikaṁ
analyzed: aniyyānikam dhammam paṭicca aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā aniyyānika

analyzed: ekam khandham paṭicca tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe
translated: One aggregate … three aggregates and materiality derived from the four great primaries … two aggregates …

original: paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe…. (Yāva asaññasattā kātabbā.)🔽Naanantarapaccayā … nasamanantarapaccayā … naaññamaññapaccayā …pe….🔽Napurejāta
analyzed: paṭisandhi khaṇe pe yāva asaññasattā kātabbā  na anantara paccayā na samanantara paccayā na aññamañña paccayā pe  napurejāta
translated: at the moment of rebirth-linking … (up to) the non-percipient beings …🔽As prenascence condition, etc.

original: Niyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca niyyāniko dhammo uppajjati napurejātapaccayā—arūpe niyyānikaṁ
analyzed: niyyānikam dhammam paṭicca niyyānikaḥ dhammo uppajjati na purejāta paccayā arūpe
translated: A resultant idea arises with a leading idea as object condition, not as prenascence condition, in the immaterial sphere …
