analyzed: khandhañca vatthuñca paccayā tayo khandhā pe dve khandhe ca pe niyyānike khandhe
translated: and a component and a basis, three components … two components … in the components that are to be given up …

original: ca mahābhūte ca paccayā cittasamuṭṭhānaṁ rūpaṁ.
analyzed: ca mahābhūte ca paccayā citta samuṭṭhānam rūpa
translated: The three remaining aggregates and the physical basis are conditionally originated from the aggregates and the great primaries. … The two remaining aggregates are conditionally originated from the aggregates and the great primaries. … The materiality originated by mind is conditionally originated from the aggregates and the great primaries that are subject to cankers.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Numerical Order

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure

original: Hetuyā nava, ārammaṇe cattāri, adhipatiyā nava, anantare cattāri, samanantare cattāri,
analyzed: hetuyā nava ārammaṇe cattāri adhipatiyā nava anantare cattāri samanantare cattāri
translated: Nine in the cause, four in the object, nine in the predominance, four in the proximity, four in the contiguity,

original: sahajāte nava, aññamaññe cattāri, nissaye nava, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte cattāri,
analyzed: sahajāte nava aññamaññe cattāri nissaye nava upanissaye cattāri purejāte cattāri
translated: nine in the association, four in the dissociation, nine in the dependence, four in the support, four in the prenascence,

original: āsevane cattāri, kamme nava, vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: āsevane cattāri kamme nava vipāke ekam pe avigate nava
translated: four in the repetition, nine in the kamma, one in the result, … one in the root cause, nine in the absence, nine in the disconnection.🔽The Reverse Order

original: 2.13.15.3.2. Paccayapaccanīya🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya paccanīya  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Analysis

original: Nahetu
analyzed: na hetu
translated: Not a Root Cause

original: Aniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati nahetupaccayā— ahetukaṁ aniyyānikaṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā tayo khandhā cittasamuṭṭhānañca rūpaṁ …pe… dve khandhe …pe…
analyzed: aniyyānikam dhammam paccayā aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na hetu paccayā ahetukam aniyyānika  ekam khandham paccayā tayaḥ khandhāḥ citta samuṭṭhānañca rūpam pe dve khandhe pe
translated: A non-leading-on state is conditionally originated from a non-leading-on state by a not-root-cause condition: a non-leading-on state that is without root-cause🔽is conditionally originated from one aggregate … from two aggregates …

original: (yāva asaññasattā) cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā
analyzed: yāva asaññasattā cakkhu āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇam pe kāya āyatanam paccayā
translated: (up to) the eye base is conditionally originated from the eye-consciousness element … the body base is conditionally originated from the body-consciousness element …

original: kāyaviññāṇaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā ahetukā aniyyānikā khandhā, vicikicchāsahagate uddhaccasahagate
analyzed: kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā ahetukāḥ aniyyānikā khandhāḥ vicikicchā sahagate uddhacca sahagate
translated: With body-consciousness as condition: the non-leading-out aggregates that have materiality as their basis. With the states associated with doubt and with agitation

original: khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā vicikicchāsahagato uddhaccasahagato moho.
analyzed: khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayāḥ vicikicchā sahagataḥ uddhacca sahagataḥ moho
translated: and with the basis as condition: delusion that is associated with doubt and with agitation.

original: Naārammaṇādi
analyzed: na ārammaṇa ādi
translated: Not object condition, etc.

original: Niyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati naārammaṇapaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: niyyānikam dhammam paccayā aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na ārammaṇa paccayā tīṇi
translated: With a leading-out idea as condition, a non-leading-out idea arises by way of not object condition … there are three .

original: Niyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā niyyāniko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā— niyyānike khandhe paccayā niyyānikādhipati.
analyzed: niyyānikam dhammam paccayā niyyānikaḥ dhammo uppajjati na adhipati paccayā niyyānike khandhe paccayā niyyānika ādhipati
translated: With a leading-out idea as condition, a leading-out idea arises by way of predominance condition. With the leading-out aggregates as condition, a leading-out predominance.

original: Aniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā— aniyyānikaṁ🔽ekaṁ khandhaṁ paccayā …pe… (yāva asaññasattā) cakkhāyatanaṁ paccayā cakkhuviññāṇaṁ
analyzed: aniyyānikam dhammam paccayā aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā  ekam khandham paccayā pe yāva asaññasattā cakkhu āyatanam paccayā cakkhu viññāṇa
translated: With a non-leading-out idea as condition, a non-leading-out idea arises by way of predominance condition. With a non-leading-out🔽aggregate as condition … (as in §10) … With the eye base as condition, eye-consciousness … With the body base as condition, body-consciousness … With the states that have materiality as their basis as condition, the non-leading-out aggregates. With a non-leading-out

original: …pe… kāyāyatanaṁ paccayā kāyaviññāṇaṁ, vatthuṁ paccayā aniyyānikā khandhā. Aniyyānikaṁ
analyzed: pe kāya āyatanam paccayā kāya viññāṇa vatthum paccayā aniyyānikā khandhā aniyyānika
translated: aggregate as condition …

original: dhammaṁ paccayā niyyāniko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā—vatthuṁ paccayā niyyānikādhipati.
analyzed: dhammam paccayā niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccayā vatthum paccayā niyyānika adhipati
translated: A factor that is leading to disengagement is due to a condition that is not a dominant condition …

original: Niyyānikañca aniyyānikañca dhammaṁ paccayā niyyāniko dhammo uppajjati naadhipatipaccayā—niyyānike khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā niyyānikādhipati.
analyzed: niyyānikam ca aniyyānikam ca dhammam paccayā niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati na adhipati paccaya aniyyānike khandhe ca vatthuñca paccayā niyyānika ādhipati
translated: A factor that is leading to disengagement and a factor that is not leading to disengagement are due to a condition that is not a dominant condition …

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The section on enumeration

original: Suddha🔽Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naārammaṇe tīṇi, naadhipatiyā cattāri, naanantare tīṇi …pe… naupanissaye🔽tīṇi, napurejāte cattāri, napacchājāte nava, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme cattāri, navipāke🔽nava, naāhāre ekaṁ, naindriye ekaṁ, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, nasampayutte tīṇi,
analyzed: suddha  na hetuyā eka na ārammaṇe tīṇi na adhipatiyā cattāri na anantare tīṇi pe na upanissaye  tīṇi na purejāte cattāri na pacchājāte nava na āsevane eka na kamme cattāri na vipāke  nava na āhāre eka na indriye eka na jhāne eka na magge eka na sampayutte tīṇi
translated: Pure

original: navippayutte dve, nonatthiyā tīṇi, novigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na vippayutte dve no natthiyā tīṇi no vigate tīṇi
translated: In the section on the absence of cause, there is one permutation. In the section on the absence of object, there are three permutations. In the section on the absence of a dominant condition, there are four permutations. In the section on the absence of an immediately preceding condition, there are three permutations. … In the section on the absence of support, there are three permutations. … In the section on the absence of prior, there are four permutations. In the section on the absence of arising after, there are nine permutations. In the section on the absence of nutriment, there is one permutation. In the section on the absence of a faculty, there are four permutations. In the section on the absence of result, there are nine permutations. … In the section on the absence of nutriment, there is one permutation. In the section on the absence of a faculty, there is one permutation. In the section on the absence of a jhāna, there is one permutation. In the section on the absence of a path, there is one permutation. In the section on the absence of association, there are three permutations. … In the section on the absence of non-disappearance, there are three permutations. …

original: 2.13.15.4. Nissayavāra
analyzed: nissaya vāra
translated: The section on support

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi nissayavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.15.5. Saṁsaṭṭhavāra
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api nissaya vāro api kātabbo  sa saṭṭhavāra
translated: The other two calculations should be done in the same way, as in the section on support.🔽The section on the connected

original: 2.13.15.5.1–4 Paccayānulomādi
analyzed: paccaya anuloma ādi
translated: The section on conditions in direct order, etc.

original: Niyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho niyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— niyyānikaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe….
analyzed: niyyānikam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā niyyānikam ekam khandham sa saṭṭhāḥ tayaḥ khandhāḥ pe dve khandhe pe
translated: When a causally arisen element that is leading to liberation is conjoined, a causally arisen element that is leading to liberation arises … (as in §1, but with aniyyānika instead of niyyānika).

original: Aniyyānikaṁ dhammaṁ saṁsaṭṭho aniyyāniko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā— aniyyānikaṁ ekaṁ khandhaṁ saṁsaṭṭhā tayo khandhā …pe… dve khandhe …pe… paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: aniyyānikam dhammam sa saṭṭhaḥ aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā aniyyānikam ekam khandham sa saṭṭhā tayaḥ khandhā pe dve khandhe pe paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: When an element that is not leading to liberation is conjoined, an element that is not leading to liberation arises … (as in §1, but with aniyyānika instead of niyyānika).

original: Hetuyā dve, ārammaṇe dve (sabbattha dve), vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate dve. (Anulomaṁ.)
analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve sabbattha dve vipāke ekam pe avigate dve anuloma
translated: In dependence on a cause, two; in dependence on an object, two; (in all cases two). In dependence on nutriment, one; … in dependence on a faculty, two; in dependence on a condition, two. (Direct order)

original: Nahetuyā ekaṁ, naadhipatiyā dve, napurejāte dve, napacchājāte dve, naāsevane ekaṁ, nakamme dve, navipāke dve, najhāne ekaṁ, namagge ekaṁ, navippayutte dve. (Paccanīyaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetuyāḥ eka na adhipatiyāḥ dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane eka na kamme dve na vipāke dve na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte dve paccanīya
translated: In dependence on a non-cause, one; in dependence on a non-domin-ance, two; in dependence on a non-pre-nascence, two; in dependence on a non-post-nascence, two; in dependence on a non-nutritive-state, one; in dependence on a non-kamma, two; in dependence on a non-ripening, two; in dependence on a non-path, one; in dependence on a non-associatedness, two. (Reverse order)

original: 2.13.15.6. Sampayuttavāra
translated: The Section on Conjoined

original: Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.🔽2.13.15.7. Pañhāvāra🔽2.13.15.7.1. Paccayānuloma
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ  pañhāvāra  paccaya anuloma
translated: The other two sets of twenty should be worked out in the same way, by the method of the Conjoined.🔽The Section on Questions🔽The Section on Conditions in Direct Order

original: Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The Section on Analysis

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: Niyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—niyyānikā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ🔽khandhānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Niyyānikā hetū cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayo niyyānikāḥ hetū  khandhānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba niyyānikāḥ hetū
translated: A way-out Dhamma is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a way-out Dhamma. The way-out roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates.🔽The way-out roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.🔽

original: rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Niyyānikā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ🔽cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo.🔽Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo—aniyyānikā hetū sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba niyyānikāḥ hetū sampayuttakānam khandhānam  citta samuṭṭhānānam ca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ  aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ aniyyānikāḥ hetū sampayuttakāna
translated: A way-of-falling-away idea is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a way-of-falling-away idea. The way-of-falling-away roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates. (The root should be treated.) The way-of-falling-away roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. (The root should be treated.) The way-of-falling-away roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ hetupaccayena paccayo; paṭisandhikkhaṇe …pe….
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam hetu paccayena paccayaḥ paṭisandhi khaṇe pe
translated: A not-way-of-falling-away idea is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a not-way-of-falling-away idea. The not-way-of-falling-away roots are a condition, as root-cause condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. At the moment of rebirth-linking …

original: Ārammaṇa🔽Niyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā
analyzed: ārammaṇa  niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayoariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā
translated: Object

original: maggaṁ paccavekkhanti, cetopariyañāṇena niyyānikacittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānāti, niyyānikā
analyzed: maggam paccavekkhanti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena niyyānika citta samaṅgissa cittam jānāti niyyānikā
translated: A way-of-falling-away idea is a condition, as object condition, for a not-way-of-falling-away idea. Noble persons, having emerged from a path, review the path. With knowledge of penetration of minds, he knows the mind of one possessing a way-of-falling-away mind. With knowledge of faring according to deeds, he knows: “This person is possessed of a way-of-falling-away mind” …

original: khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya
analyzed: khandhā cetas upariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya
translated: The aggregates are a condition, as object condition, for knowledge of the awareness of others, for knowledge of past lives, for knowledge of the future, and for adverting.

original: ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.🔽Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo— dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ🔽…pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo🔽uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati; pubbe suciṇṇāni …pe… jhānā …pe… ariyā phalaṁ🔽paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, phalassa,
analyzed: ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ  aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dānam pe sīla  pe uposatha kammam katvā tam paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ  uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni pe jhānā pe ariyā phala  paccavekkhanti nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa phalassa
translated: As object condition.

original: uppajjati; dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati, dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddaṁ suṇāti, cetopariyañāṇena
analyzed: uppajjati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati dibbāya sotadhātuyā saddam suṇāti cetaḥ pariya ñāṇena
translated: with the divine eye he sees forms, with the divine ear element he hears sounds, with the knowledge of penetration of minds he knows

original: aniyyānikacittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānāti, ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ viññāṇañcāyatanassa …pe…
analyzed: aniyyānika citta samaṅgissa cittam jānāti ākāsānañcāyatanam viññāṇañcāyatanassa pe
translated: the mind of one who is not on the path, the base of infinite space is the condition, as the dominant condition, for the base of infinite consciousness …

original: ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa …pe… rūpāyatanaṁ cakkhuviññāṇassa …pe…🔽phoṭṭhabbāyatanaṁ kāyaviññāṇassa …pe… aniyyānikā khandhā iddhividhañāṇassa, cetopariyañāṇassa,
analyzed: ākiñcaññāyatanam nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa pe rūpa āyatanam cakkhu viññāṇassa pe  phoṭṭhabba āyatanam kāya viññāṇassa pe aniyyānikā khandhāḥ iddhividha ñāṇassa cetas pariya ñāṇassa
translated: the base of nothingness is the condition, as the dominant condition, for the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception … the form base is the condition, as the dominant condition, for eye-consciousness …

original: pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa, yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa yathākammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: the tangible-object base is the condition, as the dominant condition, for body-consciousness … the states on the side of the unwholesome are the condition, as the dominant condition, for the knowledge of the kinds of spiritual power, for the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers, for the knowledge of past lives, for the knowledge of faring on in accordance with kamma, for the knowledge of the future, for adverting …

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—nibbānaṁ maggassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo nibbānam maggassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo
translated: A state on the side of the unwholesome is the condition, as the dominant condition, for a state on the side of the unwholesome— nibbana is the condition, as the dominant condition, for the path.

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Predominance

original: Niyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—niyyānikādhipati
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati niyyānika adhipati
translated: A state on the side of the unwholesome is the condition, as the predominance condition, for a state on the side of the unwholesome. As conascence predominance, as postnascence predominance, as repetition predominance, as non-repetition predominance, as disappearance predominance, as non-disappearance predominance, as object predominance, as non-object predominance, as sign predominance, as non-sign predominance, as adverting predominance, as non-adverting predominance, as jhana predominance, as non-jhana predominance, as reviewing predominance, as non-reviewing predominance, as resolution predominance, as non-resolution predominance, as object-as-condition predominance, as non-object-as-condition predominance, as object-as-non-object-as-condition predominance, as non-object-as-object-as-condition predominance, as object-as-non-object-as-condition-predominance, as non-object-as-object-as-condition-predominance, as object-as-non-object-as-condition-predominance, as non-object-as-object-as-condition-predominance, as object-as-non-object-as-condition-predominance, as non-object-as-object

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Niyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa
translated: is a condition, as dominant condition, for the associated aggregates.🔽A path-to-restraint factor is a condition, as dominant condition, for a path-to-restraint factor,

original: dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—ariyā
analyzed: dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati ariyā
translated: as object-predominance and as co-nascence-predominance. As object-predominance:

original: maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti. Sahajātādhipati—niyyānikādhipati🔽cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Niyyānikādhipati
analyzed: maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam garum katvā paccavekkhanti sahajāta adhipati niyyānika adhipati  citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba niyyānika adhipati
translated: noble persons, having emerged from a path, review the path as being of great benefit. As co-nascence-predominance:🔽a path-to-restraint factor is a condition, as dominant condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. (The rest of the section is to be elaborated as in §10.)

original: sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A path-to-restraint factor is a condition, as dominant condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇādhipati,
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati
translated: A path-to-restraint factor is a condition, as dominant condition, for a path-to-restraint factor,🔽as object-predominance and as co-nascence-predominance. As object-predominance:

original: sahajātādhipati. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ garuṁ
analyzed: sahajāta adhipati ārammaṇa adhipati dānam pe sīlam pe uposatha kammam katvā tam garu
translated: having given a gift … having undertaken the precepts of virtue … having performed a robe-offering in connection with the Uposatha ceremony, he reviews it as being of great benefit,

original: katvā paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi
analyzed: katvā paccavekkhati assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi
translated: he exalts it, he delights in it, and because he exalts it greed arises in him, and views.

original: uppajjati, pubbe suciṇṇāni …pe… jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā …pe… ariyā phalaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti,
analyzed: uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni pe jhānā vuṭṭhahitvā pe ariyā phalam garum katvā paccavekkhanti
translated: When a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling has arisen, he looks upon it as impermanent, not as permanent, and so the underlying tendency to ignorance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a pleasant feeling as impermanent, not as permanent, the underlying tendency to lust does not lie within him.

original: nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa, phalassa adhipatipaccayena🔽paccayo; cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ aniyyānike khandhe garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa phalassa adhipati paccayena  paccayaḥ cakkhum pe vatthum aniyyānike khandhe garum katvā assādeti abhinandati
translated: When he looks upon a painful feeling as a dart, the underlying tendency to resistance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as impermanent, not as permanent, the underlying tendency to ignorance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a pleasant feeling as painful, the underlying tendency to lust does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a painful feeling as a dart, the underlying tendency to resistance does not lie within him.

original: taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi uppajjati. Sahajātādhipati—aniyyānikādhipati🔽sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati sahajāta adhipati aniyyānika adhipati  sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: When he looks upon a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as an affliction, the underlying tendency to ignorance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a pleasant feeling as subject to change, the underlying tendency to lust does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a painful feeling as a dart, the underlying tendency to resistance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as an affliction, the underlying tendency to ignorance does not lie within him.

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—nibbānaṁ
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa ādhipati nibbāna
translated: When he looks upon a pleasant feeling as subject to change, the underlying tendency to lust does not lie within him.

original: maggassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo.🔽Anantarādi
analyzed: maggassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ  anantara ādi
translated: When he looks upon a painful feeling as a dart, the underlying tendency to resistance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as an affliction, the underlying tendency to ignorance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a pleasant feeling as subject to change, the underlying tendency to lust does not lie within him.

original: Niyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—maggo phalassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo maggaḥ phalassa anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: When he looks upon a painful feeling as a dart, the underlying tendency to resistance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling as an affliction, the underlying tendency to ignorance does not lie within him.🔽When he looks upon a pleasant feeling as subject to change, the underlying tendency to lust does not lie within

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimā purimā
translated: A non-leading-on Dhamma is an immediately preceding condition for a non-leading-on Dhamma, for the earlier and earlier …

original: aniyyānikā khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ aniyyānikānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena
analyzed: aniyyānikā khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam aniyyānikānam khandhānam anantara paccayena
translated: A non-leading-on Dhamma is a condition, as proximity condition, for a non-leading-on Dhamma. Preceding … non-leading-on … are conditions, as proximity condition, for succeeding … non-leading-on …

original: paccayo; anulomaṁ gotrabhussa … anulomaṁ vodānassa … phalaṁ phalassa … anulomaṁ phalasamāpattiyā
analyzed: paccayaḥ anulomam gotrabhussa anulomam vodānassa phalam phalassa anulomam phala samāpattiyā
translated: The conformity of the path is a condition, as proximity condition, for change-of-lineage. Change-of-lineage is a condition, as proximity condition, for conformity. The fruition is a condition, as proximity condition, for fruition. Conformity of the path is a condition, as proximity condition, for fruition attainment.

original: … nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena
analyzed: nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassa nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena
translated: When emerging from cessation, the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is a condition, as proximity condition, for fruition attainment.

original: paccayo. Aniyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo … gotrabhu
analyzed: paccayaḥ aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ gotrabhu
translated: A non-leading-on Dhamma is a condition, as proximity condition, for a leading-on Dhamma … Change-of-lineage …

original: maggassa; vodānaṁ maggassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: maggassa vodānam maggassa anantarapaccayena paccayaḥ
translated: is a condition, as proximity condition, for the path. Change-of-lineage … is a condition, as proximity condition, for the path.

original: Samanantarapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … pañca … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … dve … nissayapaccayena paccayo … satta.
analyzed: samanantara paccayena paccaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pañca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ dve nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ satta
translated: As antecedent and similar conditions … As simultaneous and support conditions … five … As mutuality and support conditions … two … As support conditions … seven.

original: Upanissaya
analyzed: upanissaya
translated: Predominance

original: Niyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Pakatūpanissayo—paṭhamo🔽maggo dutiyassa maggassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo …pe… tatiyo maggo catutthassa🔽maggassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Niyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—ariyā
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pakatūpanissaya upaṭhamaḥ  maggo dutiyassa maggassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe tatiyaḥ maggo catutthassa  maggassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ ariyā
translated: A way-of-falling-away idea is a condition, as proximity condition, for a way-of-falling-away idea. The natural condition is the first path as a condition, as proximity condition, for the second path, and the second path for the third, and the third path for the fourth. A way-of-falling-away idea is a condition, as proximity condition, for a not-way-of-falling-away idea. The object-predominance condition, the immediately preceding condition, the natural condition … The natural condition is noble

original: maggaṁ upanissāya anuppannaṁ samāpattiṁ uppādenti, uppannaṁ samāpajjanti, saṅkhāre🔽aniccato …pe… vipassanti, maggo ariyānaṁ atthapaṭisambhidāya …pe… paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāya🔽ṭhānāṭhānakosallassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo, maggo phalasamāpattiyā upanissayapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: maggam upanissāya anuppannam samāpattim uppādenti uppannam samāpajjanti saṅkhāre 🔽aniccataḥ pe vipassanti maggaḥ ariyānam attha paṭisambhidāya pe paṭibhāna paṭisambhidāya 🔽ṭhānāṭhānakosallassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ maggo phala samāpattiyāḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A way-of-under­standing idea is a condition, as proximity condition, for a way-of-understanding idea. The first path is a condition, as proximity condition, for the second path. … The third path is a condition, as proximity condition, for the fourth path. A way-of-understanding idea is a condition, as proximity condition, for a not-way-of-understanding idea. As object proximity condition, as prior conditionality, as post-conditionality, as natural-state conditionality, … as natural-state conditionality: Noble persons, depending on the path, arouse unarisen jhana and keep arisen jhana in being. They see ideas as impermanent, … as painful, … as not-self, … They see the four noble Truths. The path is a condition, as proximity condition, for the four noble Truths. The path is a condition, as proximity condition, for the four discriminations of noble persons, namely, the discrimination of meaning, of Truth, of language, and of perspicuity. The path is a condition, as proximity condition, for skill in the aggregates, … for skill in the sense-bases, … for skill in the elements, … for skill in the truths, … for skill in dependent origination, … for skill in what is possible and what is impossible, … for the fruit of Stream-Entry, … for the fruit of Once-Return, … for the fruit of Non-Return, … for the fruit of Arahantship. The path is a condition, as proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit of Stream-Entry. … The path is a condition, as proximity condition, for the attainment of the fruit of Arahantship.

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,🔽anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—aniyyānikaṁ saddhaṁ upanissāya🔽dānaṁ deti, sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ karoti, jhānaṁ uppādeti … vipassanaṁ … abhiññaṁ🔽… samāpattiṁ uppādeti … mānaṁ jappeti … diṭṭhiṁ gaṇhāti; aniyyānikaṁ sīlaṁ …pe… paññaṁ
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayo  anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ aniyyānikam saddham upanissāya  dānam deti sīlam pe uposatha kammam karoti jhānam uppādeti vipassanam  samāpattim uppādeti mānam jappeti diṭṭhim gaṇhāti aniyyānikam sīlam pe pañña
translated: A non-leading-on Dhamma is a condition, as decisive support condition, for a non-leading-on Dhamma. Decisive support as object,🔽decisive support as proximity, decisive support as natural constitution, … decisive support as natural constitution: Having decided on non-leading-on faith,🔽one gives a gift, undertakes precepts, performs an Uposatha, arouses jhana, arouses insight, arouses direct-knowledge, arouses an attainment, recites mantras, or holds a view; having decided on non-leading-on virtue … non-leading-on understanding …

original: … rāgaṁ …pe… patthanaṁ … utuṁ … bhojanaṁ … senāsanaṁ upanissāya dānaṁ deti …pe… samāpattiṁ🔽uppādeti, pāṇaṁ hanati …pe… saṅghaṁ bhindati; aniyyānikā saddhā …pe… senāsanaṁ aniyyānikāya🔽saddhāya …pe… patthanāya … kāyikassa sukhassa … kāyikassa dukkhassa … phalasamāpattiyā
analyzed: rāgam pe patthanam utum bhojanam senāsanam upanissāya dānam deti pe samāpatti 🔽uppādeti pāṇam hanati pe saṅgham bhindati aniyyānikā saddhā pe senāsanam aniyyānikāya 🔽saddhāya pe patthanāya kāyikassa sukhassa kāyikassa dukkhassa phala samāpattiyā
translated: A non-leading-on Dhamma is a condition, as decisive support condition, for a non-leading-on Dhamma. Decisive support as object, decisive support as proximity, natural decisive support. Natural decisive support: Depending on non-leading-on faith, one gives a gift, undertakes precepts, performs an act of devotion, arouses jhāna, arouses insight, arouses direct-knowledge, arouses an attainment, recites a mnemonic, holds a view, depending on non-leading-on virtue … non-leading-on understanding … greed … hate … delusion … insistence … season … food … resting place, one gives a gift … arouses an attainment, kills breathing things … splits the Sangha. Non-leading-on faith … resting place is a condition, as decisive support condition, for non-leading-on faith … for insistence … for bodily pleasure … for bodily pain … for fruition attainment …

original: upanissayapaccayena paccayo. Aniyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena🔽paccayo—ārammaṇūpanissayo, anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—paṭhamassa
analyzed: upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena  paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayo paṭhamassa
translated: The unfixed is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the fixed.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the derived materiality originated thereby.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the mind element and for the mind-consciousness element.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states associated with applied thought.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states associated with sustained thought.

original: maggassa parikammaṁ paṭhamassa maggassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo …pe… catutthassa
analyzed: maggassa parikammam paṭhamassa maggassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pe catutthassa
translated: As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states not associated with applied thought but associated with sustained thought.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states not associated with applied thought or sustained thought.

original: maggassa parikammaṁ catutthassa maggassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo.🔽Purejātādi
analyzed: maggassa parikammam catutthassa maggassa upanissaya paccayena paccayo  purejāta ādi
translated: As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states associated with applied thought and sustained thought.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states not associated with applied thought or sustained thought.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states associated with applied thought and sustained thought.

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa purejātapaccayena paccayo … dve (arūpadukasadisā kātabbā) … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo … dve … āsevanapaccayena paccayo … dve.🔽Kamma
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ dve arūpa duka sadisā kātabbā pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ dve āsevana paccayena paccayaḥ dve  kamma
translated: As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states not associated with applied thought or sustained thought.🔽As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states associated with applied thought and sustained thought.

original: Niyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—niyyānikā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ niyyānikā cetanā
translated: As decisive support condition, the pre-nascence of the great primaries is a condition, as decisive support condition, for the states associated therewith and for the states not associated with applied thought or sustained thought.

original: khandhānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. Niyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa kammapaccayena
analyzed: khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa kamma paccayena
translated: The aggregates are related to the volitional formations as a condition being a pre-arising condition.🔽A condition that is a way-of-access is related to a condition that is not a way-of-access as a condition being a kamma condition.🔽Conascent and cross-related. Conascent: Volitions that are a way-of-access are related to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness as a condition being a kamma condition.

original: paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā. Sahajātā—niyyānikā cetanā cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: paccaya usahajātā nānā kkhaṇikā sahajātā aniyyānikā cetanā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ
translated: Cross-related: Volitions that are a way-of-access are related to the kinds of materiality due to kamma-formation as a condition being a kamma condition.🔽(The same method of treatment is followed in the case of the remaining three of the five kinds of conditions.)🔽Volitions that are a way-of-access are related to the associated aggregates and to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness as a condition being a kamma condition.

original: kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—niyyānikā cetanā phalassa kammapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānākkhaṇikā aniyyānikā cetanā phalassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A condition that is not a way-of-access is related to a condition that is not a way-of-access as a condition being a kamma condition.

original: (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Niyyānikā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.🔽Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa kammapaccayena paccayo—sahajātā, nānākkhaṇikā.🔽Sahajātā(Saṅkhittaṁ.) Nānākkhaṇikā—aniyyānikā cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā
analyzed: mūlam kātabba niyyānikā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānañca  rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ  aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayo sahajātā nānākkhaṇikā  sahajātā asaṅkhitta nānā kkhaṇikā aniyyānikā cetanā vipākānam khandhānam kaṭattā
translated: Conascent and cross-related.🔽Conascent: … . Cross-related: Volitions that are not a way-of-access are related to the resultant aggregates as a condition being a kamma condition.

original: ca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo … vipākapaccayena paccayo … ekaṁyeva … āhārapaccayena
analyzed: ca rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ vipāka paccayena paccayaḥ ekayā iva āhāra paccayena
translated: They are related to the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to kamma-formation as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to consciousness as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to nutriment as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to temperature as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to earth as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to water as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to fire as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to air as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of materiality due to space as a condition being a kamma condition. … They are related to the kinds of material

original: paccayo … cattāri … indriyapaccayena paccayo … cattāri … jhānapaccayena paccayo …
analyzed: paccayaḥ cattāri indriya paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri jhāna paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Condition by way of support condition … four … by way of faculty condition … four … by way of absorption condition …

original: cattāri … maggapaccayena paccayo … cattāri … sampayuttapaccayena paccayo … dve …
analyzed: cattāri magga paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri sampayutta paccayena paccayaḥ dve
translated: four … by way of path condition … four … by way of association condition … two …

original: vippayuttapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi (arūpadukasadisā kātabbā) … atthipaccayena paccayo
analyzed: vippayutta paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi arūpa duka sadisā kātabbā atthi paccayena paccayo
translated: by way of non-association condition … three (as in the Formless Sphere) … by way of presence condition …

original: … satta (arūpadukasadisā kātabbā, āmasanā nānāpadāyeva) … natthipaccayena paccayo
analyzed: satta arūpa duka sadisā kātabbā āmasanāḥ nānā padāya iva natthi paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: seven (as in the Formless Sphere, but with different words for the repetition) … by way of absence condition …

original: … tīṇi … vigatapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi … avigatapaccayena paccayo … satta.
analyzed: tīṇi vigata paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi avigata paccayena paccayaḥ satta
translated: three … by way of disappearance condition … three … by way of non-disappearance condition … seven.

original: Saṅkhyāvāra
analyzed: saṅkhyāvāra
translated: The Section on Mathematics

original: Suddha
analyzed: suddha
translated: The Pure

original: Hetuyā cattāri, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā pañca, anantare tīṇi, samanantare tīṇi,
analyzed: hetuyā cattāri ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā pañca anantare tīṇi samanantare tīṇi
translated: As for the root cause, there are four; as for the object, there are three; as for the predominance, there are five; as for the prior, there are three; as for the proximate, there are three;

original: sahajāte pañca, aññamaññe dve, nissaye satta, upanissaye cattāri, purejāte dve, pacchājāte
analyzed: sahajāte pañca aññamaññe dve nissaye satta upanissaye cattāri purejāte dve pacchājāte
translated: as for the conascence, there are five; as for the mutuality, there are two; as for the support, there are seven; as for the decisive support, there are four; as for the prenascence, there are two; as for the postnascence,

original: dve, āsevane dve, kamme cattāri, vipāke ekaṁ, āhāre cattāri, indriye cattāri, jhāne
analyzed: dve āsevane dve kamme cattāri vipāke eka āhāre cattāri indriye cattāri jhāne
translated: there are two; as for the repetition, there are two; as for the kamma, there are four; as for the result, there is one; as for the nutriment, there are four; as for the faculty, there are four; as for the absorption,

original: cattāri, magge cattāri, sampayutte dve, vippayutte tīṇi, atthiyā satta, natthiyā
analyzed: cattāri magge cattāri sampayutte dve vippayutte tīṇi atthiyā satta natthiyā
translated: there are four possibilities with regard to the path, two with regard to the associated, three with regard to the dissociated, seven with regard to presence, seven with regard to absence,

original: tīṇi, vigate tīṇi, avigate satta.
analyzed: tīṇi vigate tīṇi avigate satta
translated: there are four possibilities. In the case of the path, there are four possibilities. In the case of the associated, there are two possibilities. In the case of the dissociated, there are three possibilities. In the case of the causally related, there are seven possibilities. In the case of the causally unrelated, there are three possibilities. In the case of the homogeneous, there are three possibilities. In the case of the heterogeneous, there are seven possibilities.

original: Anulomaṁ.
analyzed: anuloma
translated: The direct order.

original: Paccanīyuddhāra
analyzed: paccanīya uddhāra
translated: The reverse order

original: Niyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo … upanissayapaccayena
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena
translated: An outcome is a condition, as conascence condition, for an outcome. … It is a condition, as decisive support condition, …

original: paccayo. Niyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayaḥ niyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: An outcome is a condition, as object condition, for a non-outcome. … It is a condition, as conascence condition, …

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena paccayo. Niyyāniko dhammo🔽niyyānikassa ca aniyyānikassa ca dhammassa sahajātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ pacchājāta paccayena paccayaḥ niyyānikaḥ dhammo  niyyānikassa ca aniyyānikassa ca dhammassa sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: as support condition, … as post-nascence condition. An outcome is a condition, as conascence condition, for an outcome and a non-outcome.

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ aniyyānikassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta paccayena
translated: A non-outcome is a condition, as object condition, for a non-outcome. … It is a condition, as conascence condition, …

original: paccayo … upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo … pacchājātapaccayena
analyzed: paccayo upanissaya paccayena paccayo purejāta paccayena paccayo pacchājāta paccayena
translated: as support condition, … as pre-nascence condition, … as post-nascence condition, …

original: paccayo … kammapaccayena paccayo … āhārapaccayena paccayo … indriyapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ kamma paccayena paccayaḥ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ indriya paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: Condition by way of object condition … Condition by way of nutriment condition … Condition by way of faculty condition.

original: Aniyyāniko dhammo niyyānikassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo … purejātapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: aniyyānikaḥ dhammaḥ niyyānikassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ purejāta paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A not-leading-out Dhamma is a condition, by way of decisive support condition, for a leading-out Dhamma. … is a condition, by way of pre-arising condition, for a leading-out Dhamma.

original: Niyyāniko ca aniyyāniko ca dhammā niyyānikassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, purejātaṁ. Niyyāniko ca aniyyāniko ca dhammā aniyyānikassa dhammassa sahajātaṁ, pacchājātaṁ, āhāraṁ, indriyaṁ.
analyzed: niyyāniko ca aniyyāniko ca dhammā niyyānikassa dhammassa sahajāta purejāta niyyāniko ca aniyyāniko ca dhammā aniyyānikassa dhammassa sahajāta pacchājāta āhāra indriya
translated: A leading-out and a not-leading-out Dhamma is conascence, pre-arising, for a leading-out Dhamma. A leading-out and a not-leading-out Dhamma is conascence, post-arising, nutriment, faculty, for a not-leading-out Dhamma.

original: Hetupaccayā naārammaṇe cattāri, naadhipatiyā cattāri, naanantare nasamanantare cattāri,
analyzed: hetu paccayāḥ na ārammaṇe cattāri na adhipatiyā cattāri na anantare na samanantare cattāri
translated: In the case of condition being a condition by way of object condition, there are four, in the case of condition being a condition by way of predominance condition, there are four, in the case of condition being a condition by way of proximity condition, there are four, in the case of condition being a condition by way of contiguity condition, there are four,🔽in the case of condition being a condition by way of support condition, there are two, in the case of condition being a condition by way of non-disappearance condition, there are four, in the case of condition being a condition by way of non-restraint condition, there are four.

translated: An undetermined Dhamma is a condition being by way of a preceding condition, object condition,🔽and a condition being by way of a preceding condition, object condition, and a condition being by way of a preceding condition, physical basis condition. (Abbreviated.)🔽An undetermined Dhamma is a condition being by way of a preceding condition, object condition, and a condition being by way of a preceding condition, physical basis condition. Object condition: The form life faculty is a condition being by way of a preceding condition, object condition, for the action of killing one’s mother …

original: paccayo. Vatthupurejātaṁ—vatthu niyatānaṁ khandhānaṁ purejātapaccayena paccayo.

translated: for the action of killing one’s father … for the action of killing an perfected one … for the action of causing a schism … for the action of maliciously drawing blood from a Buddha. Physical basis condition: The physical basis is a condition being by way of a preceding condition, physical basis condition, for the determined aggregates.

analyzed: kamma  niyataḥ dhammaḥ niyatassa dhammassa kamma paccayena paccayaḥ niyatā cetanā  khandhānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ niyataḥ dhammaḥ aniyatassa dhammassa kamma paccayena  paccayaḥ usahajātā nānā kkhaṇikā sahajātā aniyatā cetanā citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ
translated: Kamma Condition🔽A limited phenomenon is a condition, as kamma condition, for a limited phenomenon. The limited volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

original: kammapaccayena paccayo. Nānākkhaṇikā—niyatā cetanā vipākānaṁ khandhānaṁ kaṭattā ca🔽rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo. (Mūlaṁ kātabbaṁ.) Niyatā cetanā sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ
analyzed: kamma paccayena paccayaḥ nānā kkhaṇikā aniyatā cetanā vipākānam khandhānam kaṭattā ca  rūpānam kamma paccayena paccayaḥ mūlam kātabba niyatā cetanā sampayuttakānam khandhānam
translated: A limited phenomenon is a condition, as kamma condition, for an unlimited phenomenon. Conascent and postnascent. Conascent: the limited volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. Postnascent: the limited volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the materiality of the kinds already arisen due to kamma that has stored up resultant-ripening.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ kammapaccayena paccayo.

translated: The limited volition is a condition, as kamma condition, for the associated aggregates and for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness.

analyzed: hetuyā dve ārammaṇe dve sabbattha dve vipāke eka avigate dve anuloma  na hetuyāḥ dve na adhipatiyāḥ dve na purejāte dve na pacchājāte dve na āsevane dve na kamme dve na vipāke dve na jhāne eka na magge eka na vippayutte dve paccanīya
translated: In the section on the straightway, there are two questions on cause and two on object (in all cases). There is one question on result, and two on indeterminate. (The straightway.)🔽In the reverse order, there are two questions on non-cause, two on non-predominance, two on non-conascence, two on non-arising before, two on non-arising after, two on non-detention, two on non-kamma, two on non-result, one on non-jhāna, one on non-path, and two on non-association. (The reverse order.)

original: 2.13.18.6. Sampayuttavāra🔽13.18.7. Pañhāvāra
analyzed: pañhāvāra
translated: ... The associated section🔽... The section on questions🔽... The direct order of conditions

original: 2.13.18.7.1. Paccayānuloma🔽Vibhaṅgavāra
analyzed: paccaya anuloma  vibhaṅgavāra
translated: The section on analysis

original: Hetu
analyzed: hetu
translated: Cause

original: (Evaṁ itare dve gaṇanāpi sampayuttavāropi kātabbo.)
analyzed: evam itare dve gaṇanā api sampayutta vāraḥ api kātabbaḥ
translated: (The other two enumerations and the associated section should be done in the same way.)

original: Saraṇo dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa hetupaccayena paccayo. (Arūpadukasadisaṁ, cattāri.)
analyzed: saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ saraṇassa dhammassa hetu paccayena paccayaḥ cattāri
translated: A dependent state is a condition, as a cause condition, for a dependent state. (Four, like the section on the immaterial aggregates.)

original: Ārammaṇa
analyzed: ārammaṇa
translated: Object

original: Saraṇo dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—rāgaṁ assādeti abhinandati,
analyzed: saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ saraṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayorāgam assādeti abhinandati
translated: A dependent state is a condition, as an object condition, for a dependent state: One approves of, welcomes, and remains holding to that delight that arises in dependence on that object.

original: taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati, diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā …pe… uddhaccaṁ …pe… domanassaṁ
analyzed: tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā pe uddhaccam pe domanassa
translated: Delight arises in him in dependence on that view, and greed arises in him in dependence on that delight. … Delusion arises in him in dependence on that greed, and uncertainty arises in him in dependence on that delusion. … Restlessness arises in him in dependence on that uncertainty, and anxiety arises in him in dependence on that restlessness.🔽Delight arises in him in dependence on that view, and greed arises in him in dependence on that delight. … Anxiety arises in him in dependence on that restlessness.

original: uppajjati, diṭṭhiṁ assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ
analyzed: uppajjati diṭṭhim assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassa
translated: Uncertainty arises in him in dependence on that view, and anxiety arises in him in dependence on that uncertainty. … Restlessness arises in him in dependence on that uncertainty, and anxiety arises in him in dependence on that restlessness.🔽The unarisen defilements that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that view, and the arisen defilements are abandoned in him in dependence on that view.

original: uppajjati, vicikicchaṁ ārabbha …pe… uddhaccaṁ ārabbha …pe… domanassaṁ ārabbha domanassaṁ🔽uppajjati, diṭṭhi …pe… vicikicchā …pe… uddhaccaṁ uppajjati. Saraṇo dhammo araṇassa
analyzed: uppajjati vicikiccham ārabbha pe uddhaccam ārabbha pe domanassam ārabbha domanassa  uppajjati diṭṭhi pe vicikicchā pe uddhaccam uppajjati saraṇaḥ dhammo araṇassa
translated: The unarisen defilements that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that uncertainty, and the arisen defilements are abandoned in him in dependence on that uncertainty.🔽The unarisen defilements that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that restlessness, and the arisen defilements are abandoned in him in dependence on that restlessness.🔽The unarisen defilements that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that anxiety, and the arisen defilements are abandoned in him in dependence on that anxiety.

original: dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—ariyā pahīne kilese …pe… vikkhambhite kilese🔽…pe… pubbe samudāciṇṇe …pe… saraṇe khandhe aniccato …pe… vipassati, cetopariyañāṇena
analyzed: dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayo ariyā pahīne kilese pe vikkhambhite kilese  pe pubbe samudāciṇṇe pe saraṇe khandhe aniccataḥ pe vipassati cetas pariyañāṇena
translated: The unarisen wholesome states that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that view, and the arisen wholesome states are suppressed in him in dependence on that view.🔽The unarisen wholesome states that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that uncertainty, and the arisen wholesome states are suppressed in him in dependence on that uncertainty.🔽The unarisen wholesome states that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that restlessness, and the arisen wholesome states are suppressed in him in dependence on that restlessness.

original: saraṇacittasamaṅgissa cittaṁ jānāti. Saraṇā khandhā cetopariyañāṇassa, pubbenivāsānussatiñāṇassa,
analyzed: saraṇa citta samaṅgissa cittam jānāti saraṇā khandhā cetaḥ pariya ñāṇassa pubbenivāsa anussati ñāṇassa
translated: The unarisen wholesome states that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that anxiety, and the arisen wholesome states are suppressed in him in dependence on that anxiety.

original: yathākammūpagañāṇassa, anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: yathā kammūpaga ñāṇassa anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The unarisen defilements that have not already appeared in the mental continuum do not arise in him in dependence on that view, and the arisen defile

original: Araṇo dhammo araṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo; dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe…
analyzed: araṇaḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ dānam pe sīlam pe
translated: A state that is without conflict is a condition, as object condition, for a state that is without conflict. Generosity … Virtue …

original: uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ paccavekkhati, pubbe …pe… jhānā …pe… ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā🔽maggaṁ paccavekkhanti, phalaṁ …pe… nibbānaṁ paccavekkhanti; nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa,🔽vodānassa, maggassa, phalassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Cakkhuṁ …pe…
analyzed: uposatha kammam katvā tam paccavekkhati pubbe pe jhānā pe ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā  maggam paccavekkhanti phalam pe nibbānam paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa  vodānassa maggassa phalassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ cakkhum pe
translated: having done the Uposatha ceremony, he reviews it; the kinds of knowledge he has already had … the jhānas … the paths … the fruitions … Nibbāna …

original: vatthuṁ araṇe khandhe aniccato …pe… vipassati, dibbena cakkhunā rūpaṁ passati …pe…🔽anāgataṁsañāṇassa, āvajjanāya ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Araṇo dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa🔽ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ assādeti
analyzed: vatthum araṇe khandhe aniccataḥ pe vipassati dibbena cakkhunā rūpam passati pe  anāgata sañāṇassa āvajjanāya ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ araṇaḥ dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa  ārammaṇa paccayena paccaya udānam pe sīlam pe uposatha kammam katvā tam assādeti
translated: the reviewing of the path … the reviewing of fruition … the reviewing of Nibbāna is a condition, as object condition, for the reviewing of Nibbāna. The eye is a condition, as object condition, for the states of one kind or another that belong to the sense sphere or to the fine-material sphere or to the immaterial sphere. Having materiality as object …🔽having the six bases as object … having contact as object … having feeling as object … having perception as object … having volition as object … having consciousness as object … having eye-consciousness … having eye-contact … having the states associated with eye-contact as object …

original: abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… pubbe …pe… jhānā …pe… cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ,
analyzed: abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe pubbe pe jhānā pe cakkhum pe vatthu
translated: having the states associated with ear-contact as object … having the states associated with nose-contact as object … having the states associated with tongue-contact as object … having the states associated with body-contact as object … having the states associated with mind-contact as object …🔽having the states associated with eye-contact as object … having the states associated with ear-contact as object … having the states associated with nose-contact as object … having the states associated with tongue-contact as object … having the states associated with body-contact as object … having the states associated with mind-contact as object …🔽having the states associated with eye-contact as object … having the states associated with ear-contact as object … having the states associated with nose-contact as object … having the states associated with tongue-contact as object … having the states associated with body-contact as object … having the states associated with mind-contact as object …

original: araṇe khandhe assādeti abhinandati, taṁ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati …pe… domanassaṁ uppajjati.
analyzed: araṇe khandhe assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati pe domanassam uppajjati
translated: He delights in and enjoys the body in the wilderness, and because of that lust arises … and grief arises.

original: Adhipati
analyzed: adhipati
translated: Dominant condition

original: Saraṇo dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati.🔽Ārammaṇādhipati—rāgaṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati🔽… diṭṭhi uppajjati; diṭṭhiṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati. Sahajātādhipati—saraṇādhipati🔽sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Saraṇo dhammo araṇassa dhammassa🔽adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—saraṇādhipati cittasamuṭṭhānānaṁ rūpānaṁ
analyzed: saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ saraṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati  ārammaṇa adhipati rāgam garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati  diṭṭhi uppajjati diṭṭhim garum katvā assādeti abhinandati sahajāta adhipati saraṇa adhipati  sampayuttakānam khandhānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa dhammassa  adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati saraṇa adhipati citta samuṭṭhānānam rūpānaṃ
translated: A resorting phenomenon is a condition, as dominant condition, for a resorting phenomenon—as object-predominance and as co-nascence-predominance.

original: adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Saraṇo dhammo saraṇassa ca araṇassa ca dhammassa adhipatipaccayena
analyzed: adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ saraṇassa ca araṇassa ca dhammassa adhipati paccayena
translated: As object-predominance: Having made lust predominant, he delights in and enjoys it. Because of that lust arises … and view arises. Having made view predominant, he delights in and enjoys it. As co-nascence-predominance: The predominance of a resorting state … is a condition, as dominant condition, for the associated aggregates. A resorting phenomenon is a condition, as dominant condition, for a non-resorting phenomenon. As co-nascence-predominance: The predominance of a resorting state … is a condition, as dominant condition, for the kinds of materiality originated by consciousness. A resorting phenomenon is a condition, as dominant condition, for a resorting phenomenon and for a non-resorting phenomenon.

original: paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—saraṇādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca🔽rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: paccayaḥ sahajāta adhipati saraṇa adhipati sampayuttakānam khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānam ca  rūpānam adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: The condition being by way of predominance condition is this: the predominance condition of the associated aggregate, and the predominance condition of the form that is derived data.🔽The condition being by way of predominance condition is this: the predominance condition of the associated aggregate, and the predominance condition of the form that is derived data.

original: Araṇo dhammo araṇassa dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo—ārammaṇādhipati, sahajātādhipati.
analyzed: araṇaḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati sahajāta adhipati
translated: A state that is not a condition being by way of predominance condition is a condition being by way of predominance condition—object predominance and associated predominance.

original: Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ katvā taṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhati,
analyzed: ārammaṇa adhipati dānam pe sīlam pe uposatha kammam katvā tam garum katvā paccavekkhati
translated: Object predominance is this: having given a gift … having observed the Uposatha … having done a deed of skill, one recollects that as being foremost,

original: pubbe …pe… jhānā …pe… ariyā maggā vuṭṭhahitvā maggaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti,🔽phalaṁ …pe… nibbānaṁ garuṁ katvā paccavekkhanti, nibbānaṁ gotrabhussa, vodānassa,🔽maggassa, phalassa, adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Sahajātādhipati—araṇādhipati sampayuttakānaṁ
analyzed: pubbe pe jhānā pe ariyāḥ maggāḥ vuṭṭhahitvā maggam garum katvā paccavekkhanti  phalam pe nibbānam garum katvā paccavekkhanti nibbānam gotrabhussa vodānassa  maggassa phalassa adhipati paccayena paccayo sahajāta adhipati araṇa adhipati sampayuttakāna
translated: having had a former existence … having had a meditation … having emerged from a noble path, one recollects that as being foremost,🔽having had a fruition … having had Nibbāna as one’s object, one recollects that as being foremost. Nibbāna is a condition being by way of predominance condition for the investigation-of-states faculty, for the concentration faculty,

original: khandhānaṁ cittasamuṭṭhānānañca rūpānaṁ adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Araṇo dhammo saraṇassa
analyzed: khandhānam citta samuṭṭhānānaṃ ca rūpānaṃ adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ araṇaḥ dhammaḥ saraṇassa
translated: for the direct-knowledge faculties, for the path, for the fruition, and for the unproclaimed attainments. Associated predominance is this: the predominance condition of the associated aggregate, and the predominance condition of the form that is derived data. A state that is not a condition being by way of predominance condition is a condition being by way of predominance condition—object predominance and associated predominance.🔽The condition being by way of predominance condition is this: the predominance condition of the associated aggregate, and the predominance condition of the form that is derived data.

original: dhammassa adhipatipaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇādhipati—dānaṁ …pe… sīlaṁ …pe… uposathakammaṁ🔽katvā taṁ garuṁ katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati … diṭṭhi🔽uppajjati; pubbe suciṇṇāni …pe… jhānā …pe… cakkhuṁ …pe… vatthuṁ, araṇe khandhe garuṁ
analyzed: dhammassa adhipati paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa adhipati dānam pe sīlam pe uposatha kamma  katvā tam garum katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi  uppajjati pubbe su ciṇṇāni pe jhānā pe cakkhum pe vatthu araṇe khandhe garu
translated: A state that is a dominant condition in the sense of object condition is a condition, as dominant condition, for:

original: katvā assādeti abhinandati, taṁ garuṁ katvā rāgo uppajjati … diṭṭhi uppajjati.
analyzed: katvā assādeti abhinandati tam garum katvā rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi uppajjati
translated: Having given a gift … having observed the Uposatha, he exalts and delights in that meritorious deed; because of his exalting and delighting in that meritorious deed, greed arises in him … a view arises in him. Because of his previously doing meritorious deeds … because of his previously developing concentration … the eye … the ear … the mind … the mental phenomena that are its object are a condition, as dominant condition, for the eye-consciousness element … for the mind element … for the mind-consciousness element. The mental phenomena that are its object are a condition, as dominant condition, for the mind-consciousness element.🔽The mental phenomena that are its object are a condition, as dominant condition, for the states that are its object.

original: Anantarādi🔽Saraṇo dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā saraṇā🔽khandhā pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ saraṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo. Saraṇo
analyzed: anantara ādi  saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ saraṇassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayaḥ purimā purimā saraṇā  khandhā pacchimānam pacchimānam saraṇānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ saraṇaḥ
translated: Immediately preceding condition, etc.

original: dhammo araṇassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—saraṇā khandhā vuṭṭhānassa anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: dhammaḥ araṇassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayosaraṇāḥ khandhāḥ vuṭṭhānassa anantara paccayena paccayo
translated: A state that is a refuge is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for a state that is a refuge: the prior prior aggregates are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the prior later aggregates. The prior aggregates are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the later aggregates. The prior aggregates are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the present aggregates. The prior and present aggregates are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the future aggregates. A state that is a refuge is a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for a state that is not a refuge: the prior aggregates are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the mind element and for the mental-data element. The prior and present aggregates are a condition, as immediately preceding condition, for the future mind element and for the future mental-data element.

original: Araṇo dhammo araṇassa dhammassa anantarapaccayena paccayo—purimā purimā araṇā khandhā🔽pacchimānaṁ pacchimānaṁ araṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo; anulomaṁ gotrabhussa
analyzed: araṇaḥ dhammaḥ araṇassa dhammassa anantara paccayena paccayo purimāḥ purimāḥ araṇāḥ khandhāḥ  pacchimānam pacchimānam araṇānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ anulomam gotrabhussa
translated: A state that is free from the corruptions is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is free from the corruptions: the preceding preceding states that are free from the corruptions are an immediately preceding condition for the succeeding succeeding states that are free from the corruptions. The conformity knowledge is an immediately preceding condition for the change-of-lineage knowledge. …

original: …pe… phalasamāpattiyā anantarapaccayena paccayo. Araṇo dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa
analyzed: pe phala samāpattiyāḥ anantara paccayena paccayaḥ araṇaḥ dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa
translated: The attainment of fruition is an immediately preceding condition for the attainment of fruition. A state that is free from the corruptions is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is not free from the corruptions: adverting is an immediately preceding condition for the corruptions that arise next.🔽A state that is not free from the corruptions is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is not free from the corruptions: the preceding preceding corruptions are an immediately preceding condition for the succeeding succeeding corruptions. The corruptions are an immediately preceding condition for the corruptions that arise next.

original: anantarapaccayena paccayo—āvajjanā saraṇānaṁ khandhānaṁ anantarapaccayena paccayo.
analyzed: anantara paccayena paccayaḥ āvajjanā saraṇānam khandhānam anantara paccayena paccayaḥ
translated: A state that is not free from the corruptions is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is free from the corruptions: the corruptions are an immediately preceding condition for the change-of-lineage knowledge.🔽A state that is free from the corruptions is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is free from the corruptions: the change-of-lineage knowledge is an immediately preceding condition for the conformity knowledge. …

original: Samanantarapaccayena paccayo … sahajātapaccayena paccayo … pañca … aññamaññapaccayena paccayo … dve … nissayapaccayena paccayo … satta.
analyzed: samanantara paccayena paccaḥ sahajāta paccayena paccayaḥ pañca aññamañña paccayena paccayaḥ dve nissaya paccayena paccayaḥ satta
translated: The attainment of fruition is an immediately preceding condition for the attainment of fruition. A state that is free from the corruptions is an immediately preceding condition for a state that is not free from the corruptions: the conformity knowledge is an immediately preceding condition for the corruptions that arise next.

original: Upanissaya
analyzed: upanissaya
translated: Dependent Origination

original: Saraṇo dhammo saraṇassa dhammassa upanissayapaccayena paccayo— ārammaṇūpanissayo,🔽anantarūpanissayo, pakatūpanissayo …pe…. Pakatūpanissayo—rāgaṁ upanissāya pāṇaṁ hanati
analyzed: saraṇaḥ dhammaḥ saraṇassa dhammassa upanissaya paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇa upanissayaḥ 🔽anantara upanissayaḥ pakata upanissayaḥ pe pakata upanissayaḥ rāgam upanissāya pāṇam hanati
translated: A state that is not free from the corruptions is a decisive support condition for a state that is not free from the corruptions: the support of lust is a decisive support condition for killing living beings …

The unadhesive Dhamma is the condition, by way of presence condition, for the adhesive Dhamma.🔽The prior is: the eye … the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … a form … a sound … a smell … a taste … a tangible … the mind-object … the eye-base … the ear-base … the nose-base … the tongue-base … the body-base … the mind-base … a visible-form … a sound … a smell … a taste … a tangible … a mind-object … the eye … the ear … the nose … the tongue … the body … the mind … eye-consciousness … ear-consciousness … nose-consciousness … tongue-consciousness … body-consciousness … mind-consciousness … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … feeling … perception … volition … consciousness … eye-sensation … ear-sensation … nose-sensation … tongue-sensation … body-sensation … mind-sensation … eye-sensation … ear-sensation … nose-sensation … tongue-sensation … body-sensation … mind-sensation … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-contact … nose-contact … tongue-contact … body-contact … mind-contact … eye-contact … ear-
